loans.name: Aziza

texts.en: Aziza is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be innovative. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Mefaraji

texts.en: Mefaraji is a Kiva borrower. She has 1 child. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy materials to build a business stall. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a business stall

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is an old man living with his children and a wife. He is involved in the poultry business and farming. According to him he has been in the above activity for over ten years.
Alongside that he is involved in cattle rearing and trading which also majorly contributing to his sources of income. Through the above projects has been able to buy land plus also taking care of his family and sisters.

He is applying for this facility to boost his cattle trade business by buying more cattle to sell.
He says his customers are basically people from his home area and trader’s and his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and bad weather.

loans.use: to boost his cattle trade business.

loans.name: Amka Tujenge A Group

texts.fr: Furaha est un entrepreneur, propriétaire d’un cabinet de change dans un rond-point de la ville, membre du groupe solidaire «Amka Tujenge A», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 34 ans, divorcée mère de trois enfants scolarisés. Elle va s’approvisionner en monnaie locale pour renforcer ses activités. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu de son petit ami, il y a douze ans. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancable
texts.en:
Furaha is an entrepreneur and the owner of an exchange office located in a hub of the city. She is a member of the group Amka Tujenge A and a client of the Hekima MFI.

At age 34, she is divorced with three children who go to school. She plans to stock up on local currency to bolster her activity. She initially started her business with funding from her boyfriend 12 years ago.

She wishes to thank Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who don't have access to the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase local currency.

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en:
A single woman living in Kampong Cham province, Pum is 41 years old. To provide for her family's needs, she grows rice and raises cows to earn an income. In addition, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Pum has been involved in her business for 23 years and can save about 7 USD per day.

Her rice did not grow well because it was destroyed by insects. This is her main business challenge. This is her sixth micro loan with VisionFund, and she fully paid back her past loans on time. With the help of her previous loans, her family’s business has improved.

In a group of two, she is the leader of the group. She will spend her loan portion to buy more fertilizer and organic pesticide so that her farmland will produce a better yield than last year. She hopes that she can get more yield from her farmland so she can increase her income. Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and organic pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is the proud owner of a small accounting and tax preparation business. He has been helping people and businesses in his community do their taxes since he graduated from college in 1977. Back when he was just starting, Richard spent most of his time meeting people in his community and cultivating referral sources to bring him new clients.

Richard's greatest success has been growing his business from serving clients in New Jersey to reaching clients in New York, Pennsylvania, and Connecticut. His largest difficulty, however, has been not being able to get access to capital required to invest in working capital needs for his business. He is currently seeking a loan to pay for marketing materials before tax season starts in the spring. A Kiva loan from you will help Richard promote his small business.

On top of his client work, Richard also works with and advises local bankers on accounting matters as another way to support local businesses. Although Richard works long hours, he is happy to be pursuing his dream as a business owner. Outside of work, Richard enjoys spending time with his two adult children and his two dogs.

loans.use: to pay for marketing materials and promote his business.

loans.name: Suega

texts.en: Suega is a 29 year old mother with 3 children, she runs a small business of providing a good services to people by transportation. Suega requested for a loan to buy new wheels, paint color, car seat, air condition, to help her maintain the good services. She will use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint color, car seat, air conditioning,.

loans.name: Amilaina

texts.en: Amilaina is a 31 year old mother with 2 children and had a business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Amilaina requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn is a 29-year-old married woman with three children. Two years ago she started running a sari-sari(variety) store, selling household commodities like  sugar, seasonings, pouch soy sauce, sugar, eggs, milk, coffee, energy drink, vegetables and noodles. It was situated  inside the local public market in her place and caters mostly town dwellers .

Mailyn is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI to buy groceries like noodles, assorted canned goods, beverages and toiletries. These will help boost her earnings and slowly able to pay her obligation.

She hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening another stall to  improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries like noodles, assorted canned goods, beverages and toiletries

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es leal, honesta y muy considerada. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas. 
Laura es de piel morena, cabello negro y físico mediano. Su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español. Su vida la realiza con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, cargada de unos sacos llenos de ropa, ambula por las calles hasta establecer un puesto de venta para exponer la ropa en el piso, “camino bastante, empiezo bien cargada y al retorno vuelvo más liviana…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende continuamente y a diario, la desventaja es que los sacos pesan mucho y se hace difícil transportarlos. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta fijo para poder vender, ella desea comprar un carrito de 2 ruedas para transportar la mercadería. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Laura solicita un préstamo para comprar un carro de 2 ruedas para transportar la mercadería.
texts.en:
Laura is a 25-year old woman and the single mother of 2 children of 7 and 10 years old.  She has a business selling secondhand clothing.  She is loyal, honest, and very thoughtful.  She carries out her business in the 'Plan 3000' neighborhood, which is characterized by all kinds of manufacturing.  

Laura has a dark complexion, black hair,  and a medium build.  Her maternal language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish.  She shares her life with her children who are in school.  They live in their own home made of bricks that is equipped with all of the basic amenities.  

She has a business selling secondhand clothing.  She walks through the streets loaded up with bags full of clothing until she can establish a place to display her clothing on the ground.  "I walk quite a lot, starting out very loaded up and return lighter", she comments.  The advantage of her business is that she sells clothing continuously and daily.  The disadvantage is that the bags weigh a lot and it is difficult to transport them.  Her dream is to have a fixed point of sale in order to be able to carry out her sales activities.  She is requesting a loan to buy a small 2-wheeled cart to transport her merchandise.  This is her first sequence of loans with the institution in the year that she has been carrying out her business.

loans.use: to buy a two-wheeled cart to transport merchandise.

loans.name: Irina Esther

texts.es: Irina es una microempresaria que inició su negocio motivada por una amiga que la invitó a una conferencia de canales de distribución masivos y le sugirió vincularse a las ventas por catálogos de productos de uso personal, propuesta a la que accedió muy motivada y con muchos deseos de generar sus propios recursos.  A partir de su incorporación mejoró su condición de vida y la de su familia, ella en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, habitan en un barrio de Cartagena de Indias un municipio del departamento de Bolívar en donde se consolida su clientela y les promueve productos a sus vecinos, amigos y conocidos, con quienes ha tenido muy buena acogida, sin embargo su capital es insuficiente para responder a toda la demanda de solicitudes, es por ello que en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir artículos del catálogo y con esta inversión podrá responder a sus pedidos, así continuará ejerciendo su actividad comercial sin contratiempos. Su meta a futuro es ser líder de revista y su meta familiar es educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Irina is a micro-entrepreneur who started her business when a friend invited her to a conference of mass distribution channels and she suggested that she sell personal products through catalogs, a suggestion that she accepted, very motivated and full of desire to generate her own income.  After she joined, she was able to improve living conditions for her and her family.  She lives with her partner and her children in a neighborhood of Cartagena de Indias, a town in the department of Bolíva where she built a customer base and promotes products to her neighbors, friends, and acquaintances, who have received her well.  

However, she doesn't have enough capital to meet the demand of all of her orders, and therefore she is applying for her first Kiva loan now through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy catalog items and be able to fill her orders through this investment.  This will allow her to go about her business without setbacks.  Her goal for the future is to be a picture-perfect leader and her family dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy catalog items.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 32 years old and married with one child in school, Raquel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like can goods, egg, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Raquel has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Raquel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is married and a resident of Kasese district. He deals in live stock business that is milk production plus cattle selling and does farming as well for extra income.By doing this, he is able to provide for his family needs. Ezra would like to improve his live stock business by buying fresian bull to mate with his cows so that he gets improved breeds with time which can provide more milk and increase his incomes from milk production.He lacks 15000000shs(one million five hundred thousand only) to buy the bull.He would be very grateful  if borrowed that money and would gladly pay back.

loans.use: to buy a fresian bull.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a 37 year old woman, she has been married to a loving husband for a long time, with him, she was blessed with two boys. The older one is currently studying high school, the younger one is another kind of blessing because he came by surprise, he wasn't expected as his brother. He is only 2 years old, but Silvia claims that her life wouldn't be complete without her little boy.

Silvia's husband is the main provider of economical support of the house, yet Silvia helps to the income by working on a small grocery store that she owns. This along with her kids is between the biggest achievements of her life, because on hard time the store moved her family ahead.
Silvia mostly sells groceries and dry chillies. She started her store 8 years ago, and since then she has been working hard on it to see it grow. She is even thinking about the future, she believes that with an employer the store will provide for her and her husband when the are retired.
She would like to improve her business by buying fixed assets and increasing her stock. She will buy showcases and containers for her species and dry chillies.

loans.use: to restock her store

loans.name: Onyiye's Group

texts.en:
Onyiyechi is 25 years old born in a family of 6. Her parents are very poor farmers and are of age now. Since after her secondary education, Onyiyechi could not proceed to the university because of the economic state of her family. To make ends meet, she joined other women in the village who are into palm kernel processing. Because she lacks money and support to start her own production, she works for other millers.

Her older sister who got a loan funded by Kiva lenders introduced her to join the cooperative. A portion of this loan will help her purchase bags of kernel this season and also make more income to support her and her aged parent. With future savings, she hopes to return back to school someday.
She thanks all Kiva lenders for supporting her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm kernel

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 28 years old. She owns and operates a small business of selling elei printing materials at the market to earn a living.

Genevieve requested a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine to assist her in running the business.

She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brushes, elei designs, containers, and a printing machine.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Jose Omero

texts.es:
José con 34 años de edad, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

José se dedica al cultivo de café, se dedica a este negocio hace 10 años. El préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de abonos e inversión en el mantenimiento de su finca,con ello obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

José es socio exclusivo en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo a cancelado de forma puntual. .
texts.en:
Jose is 34 years old and lives with his spouse and three children in the Callayuc district, Jaén province, of the Cajamarca department of Peru. The people who live in this area mostly work in agriculture and cattle ranching.

Jose has been working in coffee cultivation for 10 years.  He will use this loan to buy manure and to invest in plantation maintenance. This way he will have better yields.

Jose is an exclusive member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. He had another loan, which he paid off on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and to invest in plantation maintenance.

loans.name: Cadena De Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El grupo está trabajando para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida no solo de cada una, sino también las de sus familias. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, ella es cocinera, trabaja en un patio de comidas  y en sus horas libres hace bocaditos sobre pedidos  para cualquier tipo de eventos, es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Ella se define a sí misma como una persona muy sacrificada, que pese a su sacrificio está esforzándose por crecer.
La Sra. Norma solicita este préstamo para la compra de Carne, Harina, Huevo  etc., para que de esa forma pueda seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
This group is working to be able to improve both the living conditions of its members and their families.  These women are in the poverty elimination program, working hard to improve every day.

One of the members is Mrs. Norma. She is a cook and works at a food court. In her free time she fills snack orders for all kinds of events. She is a hard working woman who fights to be able to improve her living conditions and to offer her family a better quality of life.  She describes herself as a selfless person, who, despite her sacrifice, is working hard to grow.

Mrs. Norma is requesting this loan to buy meat, flour and eggs, etc. to continue pleasing her customers with the delicacies she makes.  She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to improve every day.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, and eggs, etc. to make a sell food.

loans.name: Segundo Froilan

texts.es:
Segundo con 59 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Segundo se dedica al cultivo de café,realiza esta actividad desde hace 15 años. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos e inversión en el mantenimiento de su finca.De esta manera sus fincas obtendrán mayores rendimientos.

Segundo es socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Segundo, 59 years old, is in a common-law marriage and lives with his spouse and two children in the Callayuc district, in the Cutervo province, in the department of Cajamarca in Peru. The people who live in this area mostly work in agriculture and cattle ranching.

Segundo has been working in coffee cultivation for 15 years. He will use the loan to buy manure and to invest in plantation maintenance. This way he will have better yields.

Segundo is a recurring member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. He had another loan, which he paid off on time.

loans.use: to buy manure and to invest in plantation maintenance.

loans.name: Wyonna May

texts.en:
Wyonna May is 25 years old with one child. She works very hard to provide for her child.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

Wyonna May has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Wyonna May would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of household goods to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilou has a general store business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marilou has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona is 31 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Rona works very hard to provide for them.

Rona has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Rona has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

In the future, Rona would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilia

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilia is 42 years old and married with one child.

Ma. Cecilia works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries like canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

Ma. Cecilia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Ma. Cecilia aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

loans.name: Sunjaila Patricia

texts.es: Sunjaila es una microempresaria que reside junto a su familia en el municipio de Barranquilla,  ella logró desarrollar su negocio con el apoyo de una cuñada que es fabricante de golosinas y le entregó a consignación una gran variedad para su comercialización. En sus inicios recorría las calles de diferentes poblaciones del Atlántico y vendía puerta a puerta, con el tiempo decidió colocarle en un extremo del dulce un juguete, con lo que logró incrementar las ventas y adquirir el capital para consolidarse como una distribuidora de productos de piñatería y golosinas, que exclusivamente vende al por mayor. En la actualidad su demanda le exige tener un capital de trabajo mucho mayor, es por ello que en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar juguetería, serpentina, globos, piñatas, confeti y toda una gama de productos de piñatería.  Su meta a futuro es convertir su negocio en una empresa y ofrecer excelentes estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sunjaila is a small businesswoman who lives with her family in the town of Barranquilla. She was successful in growing her business with the support of a sister-in-law, who is a snack food manufacturer and loaned her a wide variety of these snacks for her sales. 

At first she sold door to door in the streets to several populations of Atlántico. After some time she decided to place a toy on one side of the sweets, which improved her sales and allowed her to save the capital needed to establish herself as a piñata and snack food distributor. She sells these items exclusively in bulk. 

Currently, the demand for her products requires much higher working capital. This is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy toys, streamers, balloons, piñatas, confetti, and a wide range of products for piñata making.  Her future goal is to turn her small store into a company and provide her son with an excellent education.

loans.use: to buy toys, streamers, balloons, piñatas, confetti, and a wide range of products for piñata making.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor es una señora con 53 años, tiene 5 hijos, cuatros de ellos ya mayores, sus deseos de salir adelante son admirables, pese a su edad, no disminuye esfuerzos para lograr su objetivo, el de formalizar su negocio y dejárselo a sus hijos. Ella se dedica desde hace tres años a la cría y venta de aves, labora todos los días durante 8 horas.
Con el deseo de aumentar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ganancias, Leonor solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de dos terneras, pollos, alimento para las mismas y adecuara un galpón en el que colocara gallinas ponedoras.
La actividad que realiza esta señora para sobrevivir con los suyos es digna de aplausos y es aconsejable prestarle el beneficio de apoyo que solicita.
texts.en:
Leonor is a 53 year old woman with 5 children, four of which are grown. She has admirable goals of getting ahead and despite her age, she has not stopped working hard to achieve these goals, which include formalizing her business and leaving it to her children. She has been raising and selling birds for the last three years. She works 8 hours every day.

In order to increase her sales and thus her profits, Leonor is requesting a loan, which she will use to invest in two calves, chickens, feed for the animals, and to fix up a house for the laying hens.

The work this woman does to survive deserves applause and it is a good idea to help her with the support she is asking for.

loans.use: to buy two calves, chickens, feed for the animals, and to fix up a house for the laying hens.

loans.name: Bunna's Group

texts.en:
Bunna is a local resident living in Kampong Cham province, 36 years old. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are in school and other one is under age of school. Her main sources of income are from fishing and working as a laborer for others. The amount of fish is less than before, so this is her main challenge of her business. For Bunna, she has been with her business for 18 years and she can save from her income about 6 USD per day.

She leads a group of three to seeking this loan and it is her first loan with VisionFund. The group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy a fishing-net to support her fishing in order to get more fish. She hopes that she can earn a decent income to upgrade her family’s living better than before and to support her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing-net for her fishing in order to get more fish to support her family's business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beja is 38 year old second hand clothingdealer. He is a father of five whose spouse provides with additional income and has been in this business for the last one year doing well.

This is his second borrowing after successfully repaying the previous loan.

He will use the money to purchase bed sheets and curtains for resale.With the anticipated profits, he will be able to improve the life of his family.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a happy family whose needs are catered for.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets and curtains for resale

loans.name: Palakia

texts.en:
Palakia is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes, beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are mostly women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. He will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 64 years old and widow with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like chips, soft drinks, egg, can goods, etc.

Ana has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Ana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like chips, soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Lupita Group

texts.es: El dúo Lupita está integrado por la líder quien es  doña  Guadalupe quien desde hace 16 años se dedica y posee un salón de belleza que se ubica en su comunidad de ciudad vieja, actualmente ella solicita un crédito para la compra de productos de belleza que son estrellas los cuales son combos por mayor de lociones y cremas esto le beneficia ya que ella los distribuye a un menor precio y posee una gran demanda de sus clientes, ya este es su 3ro crédito en kiva y Fape y le ayudo ya que su meta para este año es obtener su titulo de masaje profesional ya que en diciembre concluirá sus estudios y esto le ayudara para poner en el futuro un spa  para poder tener más ingresos y darles una mejor vida a sus hijas que actualmente estudian.
texts.en:
The "Dúo Lupita" group is represented by Guadalupe who for the last 16 years has worked in her beauty salon in her community, Ciudad Vieja. She currently is requesting a loan to buy the beauty products which are her flagship products which are formulated mainly from creams and lotions. This benefits her as she distributes them at a lower price and she has good demand from her clients.

This is her third loan from Kiva and Fape. It will help her with her goal for this year which is to get her professional massage certification as her courses end in December. This will help open a spa in the future to obtain more income and provide a better life for her daughters who are studying at this time.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally, 48, is a mother of three schoolchildren from Kampong Cham province. She has been earning income to support her living condition via cassava growing and rice cropping for 20 years. Insects that destroy her cassava and her rice are a challenge to her business. This is Phally’s fourth cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans on time. Her previous loans have helped her living condition get better by enabling her to purchase decent household supplies. Phally leads a group of two in seeking a new loan with VisionFund. As the leader of group, she will use her loan portion to buy organic pesticide to improve on her cassava farm to get a good yield and she will spend a part of her loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland to produce more yields than last year. She hopes that she can gain good yields from her farmland to upgrade her family condition and support her children’s studies.

loans.use: To buy organic pesticide to improve her cassava farm and to buy more fertilizer for her rice farm to produce more yields.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Moeun is 61 years old and a mother of four schoolchildren. She grows cashew on one hectare area as her main source of income. She also grows rice for additional income. Her cashews did not produce her with a good yield and this is the main challenge for her family’s business. Moeun has been involved with her business for 43 years and she can save from her daily income about 7 USD per day. This is the fifth microloan for her with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loans on time. With the previous loans, she improved her family's living with better health than before. In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will manage her entire loan portion to purchase more organic pesticide and fertilizer to support  her cashew farm. She hopes that she can get more income from her family’s business in order to expand her farmland and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and fertilizer to support her cashew farm.

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
At her age of 56 years, Rong is a resident in Battambang province. She has six children, three of whom rely on her. To make a living, she and her husband are growing rice as their main source of income. They also raise cows and sometimes work for their neighbor for fees. Together, they earn about USD 11 per day and can save approximately about USD 6 each day for future needs. Drought is the main challenge to her rice growing business.

In a group of two, Rong is the group leader and this will be her third time with VisionFund. With the past two loans she got, she has been improving her family’s living condition. Rong will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve farmland. Moreover, she will use some of her loan portion to pay for plowing and harvesting fees, too. She hopes that she can increase her income to expand her farming business and upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve farmland so as to expand her current business.

loans.name: Honly's Group

texts.en: Aged 45 years, Honly is married and lives with her family in a rural village located in the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. She earns a living through farming rice which she has been doing for 26 years. Her husband is a house builder. Together, she and her husband can earn about 12 USD per day from the current businesses and are able to save about 6 USD each day for the future. This is the second loan for Honly with VisionFund. She has used the past loans wisely and successfully to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seed and to pay a plowing fee to improve on her farming to get a good yield. She wishes that she can earn more income from her current business to upgrade her family’s living and support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and rice seed and to pay a plowing fee to support her farming and increase the yields for her family.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Laiheang's Group

texts.en:
Laiheang is 54 years old and has 11 children. She is from Kampong Cham province. She needs to support three dependent children, two of whom attend school. Growing soybean is her main source of income, which she has been doing for 36 years. She earns additional income making boats to sell. She saves $12 per day. Laiheang's soybean crop was destroyed by insects, which is her main challenge.

Laiheang is the leader of her group, which consists of three members. She requested her first loan from VisionFund, which she will use to buy soybean seed and organic pesticide to input her farmland and produce a good yield for her family. She wishes that her family’s business can improve over last year and earn more income to upgrade her living condition and support her children’s schooling until they graduate.

loans.use: to purchase soybean seed and organic pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Lolite

texts.fr: Lolite, 56 ans, est divorcée. Elle vit avec ses trois enfants. Elle revend des produits cosmétiques et des lessives. Elle a beaucoup d’expérience dans cette activité, car elle l’exerce depuis 20 ans. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des produits afin d’éviter une rupture de stock.
texts.en:
Lolite, age 56, is a divorced mother to three children who live with her. She is a reseller of cosmetic products and laundry supplies. She has extensive experience in this activity that she has been practicing for 20 years.

Lolite is seeking this loan to buy merchandise and avoid a shortage of stock.

loans.use: to buy laundry supplies.

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
After passing fifth periods, the Piling Subur group succeeded in paying off all the loan on time. During the loan period, they took good care of the pigs, keeping them away from disease and helping them grow to be healthy. They always fed the pigs with nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ni Ketut sold her local pigs and earned enough profit. She has also become a piglets seller in her village. She is very happy for the result. Her husband and all her family feel the benefits. The children can go to school and their daily needs are fulfilled. She said thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business. Now, Ni Ketut and one member have decided to resign from the group after they saved enough. They want to continue the business with their own money. The Piling Subur chose a new head to replace Ni Ketut and Ni Wayan now becomes their new head.

Evaluated from the last period, the Piling Subur group decided to continue their loan from MUK. They still need the loan to increase their business and they will stop after they all have enough savings to run their businesses by themselves.

Ni Wayan used her loan to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed. To reduce the cost, she gives a mix feed made from various kind of leaves. Ni Wayan also works at a school as a teacher. She hopes that in the next 5 month the pigs can grow healthy and she will earn a satisfactory price. All the profit will be saved for the capital of her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Him is 50 years old and a mother blessed with six children, one of whom who is still in high school. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice as her main source of income. Her husband works as security guard to earn extra income. Because of the drought, her rice did not grow well and it is her main challenge for her farming business. Him has been involved with her business for 31 years and she can save from her daily income about 7 USD per day. This loan is her second microloan with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan on time. The previous loan has helped to improve her family's living condition. Him is seeking this new loan with her group of four members. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy seed and fertilizer for her rice farm to get more yields than last year. She also will use a part of her loan to pay a plowing fee for her farm. She hopes that she can earn more income from her business to upgrade her living condition and support her child’s studies as well.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for labor for plowing in order to improve her farming to increase her yield.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Naomie

texts.fr: Naomie, 52 ans, est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Elle vend depuis plus de 20 ans des boissons gazeuses en gros dans une petite boutique chez elle. Elle cherche un microcrédit afin d’augmenter son stock. Elle rêve de devenir autonome financièrement et de pouvoir épargner de l’argent pour sa retraite.
texts.en: Naomie, 52, is single and has no children. For more than 20 years, she has been selling carbonated drinks at wholesale in a small shop at her home. She is seeking a microloan in order to augment her stock. She dreams of becoming financially independent and to be able to save money for her retirement.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la pesca artesanal y a la agricultura desde hace 8 años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 4 años, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de trasmayos y darle mantenimiento al motor de la lancha que es la que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: The young man whose face is obscured, due to being 21 and living in a high-risk area, has worked in fishing, by traditional methods, and in agriculture for the past eight years. He sells his products in the various markets that are located near his home. The young man lives in his own house with his wife and 4-year-old son.  He is requesting this loan in order to buy drift nets as well as maintain the motor of his fishing boat, which can be seen in the picture, in order to continue with his work.

loans.use: A loan of $300 helps this borrower to buy drift nets as well as maintain the motor of his fishing boat.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela is 61 years old and has eight children. She is a married woman.

Tarcela is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Tarcela has been in this business for two years now. She has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Tarcela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Guerline

texts.fr: Guerline a 37 ans. Mariée, mère d’un enfant, c’est une femme très courageuse et très déterminée à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle veut devenir autonome financièrement et avoir de quoi bien prendre soin de son foyer. Elle revend des produits alimentaires en détail, mais son grand rêve est d’avoir une grande boutique de vente en gros. Elle cherche du financement pour développer sa petite activité actuelle en vue de réaliser son grand rêve.
texts.en: Guerline is 37. A married mother of one, she is a very brave woman determined to improve her family’s living conditions. She wants to become financially independent and have what’s needed to take care of her household. She sells food products at retail, but her big dream is to have a big wholesale shop. She is looking for financing to develop her current small business with the goal of realizing her big dream.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour.

loans.name: Martin Grégoire

texts.fr: Grégoire est un jeune homme marié âgé de 31 ans. Il n’a pas encore d’enfant. Sans emploi, il ne reste pas les bras croisés. Il a démarré une activité de revente de boissons gazeuses. Cela lui permet de gagner des revenus pour répondre aux besoins de son foyer et faire un peu d’épargne. Grace au crédit, il espère développer cette activité et maximiser ses revenus.
texts.en: Grégoire is a young, 31-year-old married man. He doesn’t have any children yet. Unemployed, he doesn’t stand idly by. He started a business selling carbonated drinks. This allows him to earn money to meet the needs of his household and to save a little. Thanks to the loan, he hopes to develop this business and maximize his revenues.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.fr: Rose Marie, 47 ans, vit en union libre. Elle a deux enfants. Elle revend des lessives en gros: savon de lessive, détergente, etc.  Cela fait huit ans qu’elle prend du crédit pour investir dans son commerce. Ces crédits ont beaucoup contribué dans le développement  de son activité. Elle continue à solliciter du crédit pour augmenter ses stocks.
texts.en: Rose Marie, 47, lives with her partner. She has two children. She sells laundry detergents at wholesale: laundry soap, detergent, etc. It’s been eight years that she has been taking loans to invest in her business. These loans have greatly contributed to the development of her business. She continues to apply for loans to augment her stock.

loans.use: to buy laundry detergent.

loans.name: Valence

texts.en:
Valence, who is in his mid 30's, is married with three children who are still in school. He has been running a butcher shop for four years now. He works from 02pm to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Valence's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase the meat stock in his butcher shop. He has managed to pay back his loan successfully.



He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to increase on the meat stock in his butcher shop. He can now serve more customers. He dreams of owning a big butchery.

Valence will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase on the meat stock in his butcher shop. He can now serve more customers.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio is originally from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil and has been in the United States for a total of 24 years. He started his business five years ago because he needed a change and was thinking of ways to embark on self-employment. He knew that starting a pool installment business would be a good fit for him.

Claudio’s business has helped him support his family and make ends meet. He currently runs his business with his wife and together they are the most proud of gaining the ability to control their schedules and income.

Since starting his business, Claudio and his wife have faced difficulties due to the changes in seasons. During hot seasons, the intense heat requires more chemical usage therefore increasing expenses that are required to maintain the quality of their work.

Claudio is currently seeking a loan that would allow him to increase the volume of his business. He would like to purchase additional pools from a pool installment company that is closing down. His vision for the future is to increase his number or clients. He would also like his business to become a successful, reputable and long lasting family business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pools from a company in the industry that is going out of business

loans.name: Kha

texts.en: Kha, 56 years old, is a fish seller and fisherman who lives in Santuk district, Kampong Thom Province. He is a hardworking father of five children. This woman is a wife of Kha and she is a​ chicken seller at the market. This couple can make a net profit of approximately USD 15 a day. During this time, Kha is facing a financial issue in his family. He needs some money to buy wood to improve his house because it has started to fall into decay, but yet he can’t afford it. After getting to know that HKL provides Kiva loans with a lower interest rate than its normal loan, he has decided to apply for a Kiva loan to help him. He would like to thank all the lenders for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy wood for improving his house.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.fr: Michelle, 49 ans, mère de trois enfants, gère depuis neuf ans sa petite épicerie à domicile. L’écolage de ses enfants, la nourriture, les autres dépenses domestiques, tout repose sur les rentrées de la petite épicerie. Son compagnon ne travaille.  Elle veut trouver un moyen pour augmenter les revenus de l’activité. Avec le crédit qu’elle demande, elle va acheter des boites de beurre, des caisses d’œufs et de l’huile.
texts.en: Michelle, a 49-year-old mother of three, has been running a small grocery store from her home for nine years. Her children’s schooling, food, and other household expenses all depend on the income from the small grocery store. Her partner doesn’t work. She wants to find a way to increase her business’s revenue. With the loan she is seeking, she is going to buy containers of butter, cases of eggs, and oil.

loans.use: to buy tubs of butter, cases of eggs, and oil.

loans.name: Quintín

texts.es:
Quintín es un hombre con 35 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores y vive con su pareja en el municipio de Corozal. Con mucho esfuerzo logro montar su primer negocio, una tiene en un pequeño local arrendado por un familiar. De allí obtiene muy buenos ingresos los cuales son invertidos en la alimentación y vestimenta de sus hijos.
Trabaja todos los días durante 10 horas.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para poder abastecer su negocio con productos de consumo diario en los hogares, como lo es el arroz, aceite, azúcar, carnes frías y otros.
Quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de tener su casa propia, pero principalmente para poder pagar la educación de sus hijos.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en este hombre unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Quintín is a 35-year-old man.  He has three young children and lives with his partner in the town of Corozal.  With great effort he managed to start his first business, which he has in a little place he rents from a family member.  He gets a good income from it, which he invests in feeding and clothing his children.

He works every day for 10 hours.  He is currently asking for a loan to be able to stock his business with staples that are used daily in homes such as rice, oil, sugar, cold meats, and other items.

He wants to keep working in order to achieve his dream of having his own house, but mainly in order to be able to pay for his children’s education.

His positive attitude and his desire to get ahead allow a huge urge to improve himself to be seen in this man and, of course, a favorable answer to his request.

loans.use: to stock his business with staples that are used daily in homes such as rice, oil, sugar, cold meats, and other items.

loans.name: Fanaka Kajiungeni Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is in his early 20s and is single with no child. He has been running a gengeduka (a small shop with fruits and vegetables) for one year now. He works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to improve the gengeduka and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to take care of himself, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to restore the out-of-stock items in the gengeduka store. He dreams of expanding his business.

Mohamed will share this loan with his loan group Fanaka Kajiungeni, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restore the out-of-stock items in the gengeduka store.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa started a piggery business six years ago. With her desire to have daily income, she decided to engage herself in the retail business. Her husband is a farmer. She also has a sari-sari store business in their village. Since they wanted their three children to have a better future, Marissa and her husband are working together for them. Using their motorcycle, Marissa and her husband are able to sell and deliver chicken, pork, and fish. Marissa wanted to extend the businesses she has now. Thus, she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy groceries and meat to sell. She hopes to sell more, and gain more for the improvement of their business as well as for the future of their family.

loans.use: to buy groceries and meat to sell.

loans.name: Huch's Group

texts.en:
Huch, 64, is a widowed woman who has nine children. She lives in Battambang province where rice growing business and fishing have been run for years. To make more income, she sometimes works as paid worker. Earning around USD11 per day, Huch can save around USD5 each day.

She decided to form a group of three members to apply for loans from VisionFund and this is the fifth cycle for her. Past loans have enabled her to upgrade the standard of living. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy fishing gear to support fishing business. She hopes that she can earn more income to timely support family’s needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear to support her fishing business. .

loans.name: Siekly

texts.en: Siekly is 18 years old, a single freshman who is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Information Technology at a university in the city. His father is a construction worker and his mother earns main income from selling Khmer cake in a school.  Siekly has decided to take out a loan because he is short of the money to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year. This loan will help him in earning a bachelor’s degree successfully. After graduation, he dreams of having a proper job with a reasonable salary, he will be able to save money to build his own house and if he got children he wants his children to study to pursue a bachelor degree.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the fourth year for a BSc, in IT

loans.name: Paris Group

texts.en:
Hellen is in her early fifties and a widow with four children, one of whom is still in school while the other three are grown. She is also the leader of the Paris group whose five members are shown here. She has been making and selling chicken feed for two years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be the first time Hellen has borrowed money from Kiva's field partner Tujijenge Tanzania. She will apportion this 6,500,000 TZS loan among her group members and use her share to buy more supplies to make chicken feed so as to meet her customers’ requirements. She hopes her feed sales will lead to an expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more supplies to make chicken feed to sell.

loans.name: Petrona

texts.en:
Petrona is the owner of the house where she lives. Petrona makes cheese and she needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Petrona wants to increase her milk production.

Petrona's house is made of adobe and the place has no electric installation. Petrona would like to improve her house in the future. She is married, has one kid, but her husband is not working right now

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Julieto

texts.en: Julieto is 65 years old married man.He manages his own motorcycle rendering transportation services to their local community member. Since then, he has actively driven and sent passengers to designated areas safely. It allows him to earn PHP 15,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too. Recently, he borrowed a loan to buy tires and brake pads. The availability of this fund is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan, Julieto is expecting to pursue his job with a motorcycle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. He hopes to sustain the family's daily needs and improve further service capacity.

loans.use: to buy new tires and brake pads

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
She is married with five children. They all live in a two bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life some of which are the death of her father and brother and when she lost some of her business money. She was motivated by her friends to join GHAPE in 2011 and she has been a member for some time now and has taken and repaid EC three times.

With this new loan requested, she will buy foodstuffs to sell in the market and will also rent a farm for farming. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in it for a long time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her activity in that she will provide food for the population.

With the profit made from this loan, she is planning to expand her business pay her children’s school fees and improve on the family standard of living and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell in the market and will also rent a farm for farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, soap, flour, cereals. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy more stock of maize, beans. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her grand children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize, beans.

loans.name: Legida

texts.en:
Legida is 46 years old and married with nine children, three children still in school. Legida works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,500 loan through NWTF to buy item to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

Legida has been in this business for 2 years. In the future Legida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, milk, noodles, spices, drinks, bread, snack foods, eggs, shampoo, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is a married mother of 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old, and both of her children are currently in school.

Daniela has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

Daniela has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Plutarca

texts.en:
Plutarca is 59 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. 

Plutarca requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business. She has been pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Plutarca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, coffee, eggs, sugar, etc.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, noodles, coffee, eggs, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Arn

texts.en:
Arn is 45 years old and she is married. She has two children in school. Residing in Kandal province, she and her husband are growing rice and working as paid workers to earn additional income. They have been involved in farming business for years. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her business. 
Arn is now applying for a loan from VisionFund, which will be the fourth cycle loan for her. Past three loans have helped her support family’s living and farming business better. Arn will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity. She hopes that she can upgrade the standard of living for her family and keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop productivity to upgrade the standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.name: Muázu

texts.en: Muázu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muázu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8MT/Ha, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Muázu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Muázu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Muázu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Muázu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tumaini

texts.en:
Tumaini is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Tumaini has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Tumaini dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future

With the Kshs 25,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman and has been blessed with six children two of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over six years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition and perishability leading to losses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past year, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she also operates a cloth selling business.She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. Stella dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Bulus

texts.en: Bulus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Bulus is thankful to Babban Gona  that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. Traditionally, Bulus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to buy food and clothing for his family. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Bulus will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season. Then his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Bulus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Tavai

texts.en: Tavai is a 24 year old mother with 3 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. Tavai requested for a loan to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, and hand gloves,

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 47 years old and married with eight children, five of whom in school, Marivic works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future Marivic would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 25 years old, married, and has one child. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.

Ana Marie requested her fifth loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Cherry Pie

texts.en:
Cherry Pie works hard to support her family. Cherry Pie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Cherry Pie has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Cherry Pie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 46 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 50 years old and married with four children, one of whom in school, Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell.

Gemma has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future Gemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundle of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina works hard to support her family. Regina is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

Regina has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Regina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a married woman with one child who is still young to attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
Sochea, aged 33, is a married mother of here dependent children, two of whom are in school while the remaining one is under the age of school. She lives in Kampong Thom province where she is growing rice for the main source of income for years. Additionally, she is working as paid worker to add more income. She earns about USD15 per day and can save about USD7 each day.

This former client has been with VisionFund for three cycle loans already. Now, Sochea, the leader of four members group, is asking for loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She wants to provides all family members with hygienic living and keep them healthy.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to keep them healthy.

loans.name: Saroeun's Group

texts.en:
Saroeun is a mother blessed with four children, two of whom are in school and other two are too young. Saroeun is 36 years old and living in Preah Vihear province. To support her family’s living, she can earn income via grocery items selling for ten years.

For Saroeun, this is her seventh cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans on time. The previous loan has helped her family’s living better than before. She is seeking a new loan with two members in her group. Saroeun will manage her portion of loan to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that her family can live more healthily than before.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family to live in good health.

location.town: Preah Vihear Province, Chaom Ksan District

loans.name: Kwagalana Development Ndeeba Group

texts.en:
Angella is a repeat client in Ugafode microfinance, previously applied for a loan of UGX800,000/=. She is a married. She is a business woman owning astall selling fruits,vegetables among other items like spices and yellow bananas. She is a hard working lady who is trying to increase on her working capital by borrowing to meet her customers' needs.

She is applying for a loan of UGX800,000/= through the group to buy more items for sell since she is assured of clients but is limited by capital. She is very grateful for the support Ugafode microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.
The sixth person extreme left is the UGAFODE credit staff in charge of the group.

loans.use: to boost the business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, todo esto a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza implementado por la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Del Rosario, ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de remedios naturales, ella por medio de este pequeño emprendimiento lucha y se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia. Del Rosario es una persona muy luchadora, que con sacrificio esta saliendo adelante y mejorando de esta forma sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, luchando por ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called "Mujeres Unidas" (Women United), is from the city of Caaguazú. They are women who are the head of their households that came together to improve their life conditions, all through a program for the elimination of poverty implemented by the "Fundación Paraguaya" (Paraguayan Foundation).

One of the members is Del Rosario. She works in the humble area of natural remedies. Through this small business she fights and strives to help her family. Del Rosario is a very hard-working. persistent person that is getting ahead and improving her lifestyle through her sacrifice.

She requests this loan in order to buy natural remedies for resale, so that she can continue her sales, fighting to help her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is married for over 12 years and is the mother of 4 kids. Juana sells milk and she makes cheese and her husband is a mason.

She needs a loan to buy a milking cow. Juana hopes you can help because she wants to make more cheese and use the money to improve her house in the future. The current place where she lives with her family is made of adobe, so Juana would like to live in a better place

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 11 years.

Ana requested a loan from NWTF for 24,000 PHP, which she will use in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 56 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, milk, can goods, soft drinks, etc.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Judith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Sartiyah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients,Sartiyah, who is a 46-year-old married with one daughter. Sartiyah is a housewife and her husband is a breeder. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah.

This loan will be used to build a new toilet at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sartiyah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build new toilet at their home to improve access to clean water for their family.

loans.name: Noeun's Group

texts.en:
Noeun, a resident in Battambang province, is a 57-year-old married mother of five dependent children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband have been supporting family through growing rice and raising pigs for main source of income for years. They also work for others for a fee and raise cows to earn additional income too. Pigs getting ill, which cost lots of money to cure, is the challenge she faces.

This second-cycled client is leading a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy piglets and feed to nourish them. She hopes she can earn more income to expand pig-raising business and support her school-aged child’s studying.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to nourish them so as to support her school-aged child’s studying.

loans.name: Tepalua

texts.en: Tepalua is a 52 year old mother with 7 children, she owns and operates a small business of selling pancake, pork cake, buns in her community to earn a living. Tepalua requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, to assist her run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build small bakery store in the near future. She joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan,.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. para seguir teniendo una buena cosecha y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Manuel is 44 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and four children. He has earned a living growing corn, beans and millet for many years. He sells his produce in the different markets close to his home and with what he earns he manages to pay for some household costs. He is asking for a new loan to buy manure, fertilisers, pest control, etc. to continue having a good harvest and thus have a better income.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilisers, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Jessie Vic

texts.en:
Jessie Vic works hard to support her family and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.
Jessie Vic has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy works hard to support her family. Levy is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Levy has been in this business for 10 years now.
