In the future, Levy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Louwella

texts.en:
Louwella works hard to support her family. Louwella is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Louwella has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Louwella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 57 years old, married with two children.  

Rosie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosie requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Rosie has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support her family. Jean is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing nets, gallon of gasoline, etc.

Jean has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing nets, gallon of gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang, 47, is living in Kampong Cham province and a widowed mother of two dependent children. To support family, she is growing cassava and cashew. She has been doing this for 29 years. Low cassava yields and diseases are the obstacles to cassava farming. She earns around USD10 per day and can save approximately around USD5 each day.

Having been with VisionFund for four cycle loans, Leang has improved family’s living and business through purchasing household supplies and agricultural tools. She is now requesting for a loan from VisionFund to purchase organic fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for paid workers fees for agribusiness. She hopes she is able to buy two-hectare area of farmland to grow cassava and prepare a wedding party for a child.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer and pesticide for cassava farming so as to be able to buy two-hectare area of farmland to grow cassava.

loans.name: Faaifo

texts.en: Faaifo is a woman of 40 years old with 8 children. She owns and operates a small business of selling cabbage,cucumber, eggplant, in her village to earn a living. Faaifo requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals, to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds(cabbage,cucumber, eggplant), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, chemicals,

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking businesswoman who operates a general store, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from a welding shop for tricycles and jeepneys so she can fully provide for her family's needs.

Editha is requesting another loan for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items such as rice, coffee, soda, and rice noodles to sell. Her store means a lot to her as her source of income, which helps her to meet her family's basic needs. Her earned income helps send her three children to school. Editha hopes her store becomes a big grocery so can send all her children to college.

Every week, Editha meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Jocelyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una hermosa mujer de 29 años de edad, una persona que quiere progresar y generar sus propios ingresos.
Cansada de ir divagando buscando una oportunidad  laboral, Sandra quiere autogenerarse esa oportunidad y de momento está buscando fondos para iniciar una cafetería, en la foto está ella junto al local que logro alquilar, pero aún necesita un dinero para completar la compra de los activos fijos como loza, congelador, vitrina, nevera, cafetera, horno, estufa, estantería, y los insumos para abastecer el negocio, es un gran proyecto y por ello pide una ayuda para dar el paso  final e iniciar lo más pronto a operar.
Su único propósito es salir adelante, no depender de nadie y ayudar a su familia incondicionalmente, no verlos pasar necesidades y progresar cada día.
texts.en:
Sandra is a beautiful 29 year old woman who wants to get ahead and earn her own income.

Tired of roaming around searching for a job opportunity, Sandra wants to create for herself that opportunity and is now looking for funds to open a cafe. In the photo she is in the place she is renting, but she still needs money to buy fixed assets such as crockery, freezer, a display cabinet, refrigerator, coffee maker, oven, stove, shelving, and supplies to stock the business. This is a major project so she is asking for help to take the final step and begin to operate as soon as she can.

Her only purpose is to get ahead, not to depend on anyone and support her family unconditionally and for them not to suffer hardships and to progress each day.

loans.use: to buy fixed assets such as crockery, freezer, a display cabinet, refrigerator, coffee maker, oven, stove, shelving, and supplies to stock the business.

loans.name: Pin's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village of Battambang province, Pin is 47 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she needs to support ort three children and two of whom are in school. To earn income for her family’s living, she grows rice and raises pigs. She can get more income beside her main business via selling snacks and working as a labor for others. She has been involved in her farm for 12 years. Her rice did not grow well this year and she can save from her daily income about 9 USD per day.

For Pin, this is her ninth cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loans on time. Her family’s living has improved with a decent income to keep her children to school on time via her past loans. This new loan, she leads a group of four members and she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to improve her rice to grow better than last year.

Beside this, she will use a part of her loan to purchase more pig feed for her pig-raising. She hopes that she can earn more income to upgrade her living condition and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for her farming and to purchase pig feed to support her pig-raising so as to improve her family's businesses.

loans.name: Jhon Arbey

texts.es:
Jhon es un hombre con 22 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, dedicado a la venta y preparación de comida, una actividad que aprendió gracias a un anterior empleo.
Su propósito es continuar con esto,  más adelante abrir su primer local y llegar a generar empleo a las personas más necesitadas.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de canastillas y una maquina empacadora la cual le permita más agilidad en su labor.
Sueña con comprar su casa, poder tener una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.
Para la realización de sus proyectos cuenta con la ayuda de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva, sabe que con ellos sus sueños se harán realidad.
texts.en:
Jhon is 22 years old, is hardwokring and is modest. He earns a living in preparing food, an activity that he learned from a previous job.

His aim is to continue with this and, in the future, open his own premises and create jobs for the people that need it most.

He is asking for a loan that he will use to buy small baskets and a packing machine which will make his work more flexible.

He dreams of buying his home and having more financial stability and having good health.

To carry out his plans he needs the help of Interactuar and the collaborators of Kiva, he knows that with them, his dreams will become a reality.

loans.use: to buy small baskets and a packing machine.

loans.name: Tuvaelagi

texts.en: Tuvaelagi is a 35 year old mother with 1 child and had a business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this over 2 years. Tuvaelagi requested for a loan to buy backpack sprayer, vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,

loans.name: Sauoleola

texts.en:
Sauoleola is 33 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business growing and selling vegetables in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

In the future, Sauoleola hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is an 18-year-old single woman with no child. She makes and sells pork buns and ice cakes in her community to earn a living.

She has two years of experience with this business. Esther needs a loan to buy an oven, flour, sugar, yeast, ,soy sauce, and onions. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies.

Esther has been a member of SPBD since September 2015.

loans.use: to buy an oven, flour, sugar, yeast, soy sauce, and.onions.

loans.name: Mery Eriselda

texts.es: Mery de 46 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos para el hogar, como manteles, sobre fundas, cobijas, cortinas, entre otros productos, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz de poder llevar el sustento a su hogar. Mery vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su grupo familiar y su hija de 15 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando con el apoyo de Mery. Ella desea que su negocio sea más próspero, además ha notado que cada día cuenta con una mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: manteles, cobijas, cortinas, sandalias para dama, entre otros productos para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mery, who is 46 years old, is a hard-working woman who works in selling products for the home, such as tablecloths, pillow covers, blankets, curtains, and other products. This allows her to get her family ahead, for which she feels happy to be able to bring sustenance home.

Mery lives in her own home together with her family and her daughter who is 15 years old and is currently studying with the support from Mery.

She wishes for her business to be more prosperous. Besides, she has noticed that every day she has a greater number of customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing tablecloths, blankets, curtains, sandals for women, among other products to stock her business.

loans.use: to invest in tablecloths, blankets, curtains, sandals for women, among other products to stock her business.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda es una señora soltera con 42 años de edad, la adversidad que la ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y realizar sus proyectos, lo que se propone lo consigue, anterior mente deseaba tener su propio negocio, ahora lo tiene, monto una pequeña papelería en la sala de la casa donde reside.
Con el fin de aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias, esta mujer solicita un préstamo con el cual comprara variedad de productos como cuadernos, lápices, marcadores, también comprara vitrinas y principalmente una fotocopiadora.
Su mayor sueño es poder pagar el tratamiento médico de su hijo, ya que este padece de una grave enfermedad y con urgencia lo necesita.
Usted puede ser parte de este sueño, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is 42 and is single. The adversity that she has faced has not been an obstacle to her wanting to get ahead in life and carry out her plans. What she sets out to do she achieves. She used to want to have her own business, now she has it. She started a small stationary shop in a room of the home where she lives.

In order to increase her sales and her income she is asking for a loan with which to buy a variety of products such as notebooks, pencils, markers and also display cabinets and mainly a photocopier.

Her biggest dream is to be able to pay for the medical treatment of her child as he is suffering from a serious illness and needs it urgently.

You could be part of this dream, come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products such as notebooks, pencils, markers, and also display cabinets and mainly a photocopier.

loans.name: Srang's Group

texts.en:
Originally in Kampong Cham province, Srang is 43 years old and a mother blessed with five children. Nowadays, she still needs to support on two schoolchildren. The growing cassava and pigs-raising are the main sources of income of Srang to earn income for her family’s living for 25 years. The price of cassava is getting lower than last year, this is her main challenge.

Srang leads a group of three to seeking a new loan with VisionFund and this is her third cycle. She fully paid back her past loans and her family’s living is getting better than before with her past loans. She will spend her loan portion to buy more piglets to support on her raising business and she will use a part of her loan to purchase more fertilizer to improve on her farming to get good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her businesses to improve on her living condition and support on her children’s studying as well.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to support on her raising business and to purchase fertilizer for her farm to get good yield.

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is 28 years old and married with two children. She wants to start a small business growing and selling vegetables in her community.

To do this, she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. In the future, Sami hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education . She joined SPBD in September 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty Pora está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo que tiene como propósito el crecimiento de cada una de las integrantes del grupo, a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien se dedica a las ventas ambulantes, vende todo tipo de artículos, y comenta que tiene muchos clientes a los cuales siempre ofrece una buena variedad de productos. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que pone todo de si para poder mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar ropas, calzados, artículos de bazar y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que piden. Agradecen por la oportunidad que reciben de poder crecer.
texts.en:
The group Kuña Aty Pora is located in the Number 1 Circle. It is a new group which has the purpose to develop each member of the group through a program to eliminate poverty.

One of the members is Mrs. Maria, who makes a living through street sales. She sells all sorts of things, and she says that she has many customers who she offers a good variety of products. Maria is a hardworking person who wants to get ahead and for this reason she gives her all in order to improve herself.

She is requesting this loan to buy clothes, shoes, bazaar items, and others. This way she can continue her sales and offer her customers what they want. She appreciates the opportunities to grow that she receives.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and other bazaar items to sell.

loans.name: Ken's Group

texts.en:
Ken is a local farmer from Kampong Cham province. She is 51 years old and a mother six dependent children, two in school.

The main sources of her income are from selling grocery items and growing cassava. She has been growing rice to earn additional income. Her daily income earns her about $12 (USD) per day.

Her cassava crop did not produce a good yield because it was destroyed by insects. Lacking capital, she decided to take out a new loan from VisionFund. This is her seventh loan and she repaid her past loans completely.

Ken, the leader of a group of four members, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed to increase her cassava yields for her family. She hopes to sell her harvest at a good price to improve her living conditions and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and seed to grow cassava and increase  yields.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella tiene 47 años de edad es casada, desde hace varios años trabaja en una asociación de mujeres indígenas. Nació con una afección en sus ojos que le  afecta la forma redonda de su cornea, por lo que ha empezado a empeorar su visión la cual no se puede corregir con gafas. Le han realizado unos implantes corneales para que pueda utilizar lentes de contacto, ella teme que esto no funcione y la única alternativa que tenga sea el trasplante de cornea.
texts.en: She is 47 years old and married. For several years, she has worked in an association of indigenous women. She was born with an eye condition that affects the round shape of her cornea, which has begun to diminish her vision and cannot be corrected with glasses. They made her corneal implants so that she could use contact lenses, but she is afraid those are not working and the only alternative that she has is a corneal transplant.

loans.use: pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina es una microempresaria que le apostó a sus destrezas y habilidades para fomentar su propio negocio y lograr por si misma recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, ella reside con su familia en el corregimiento de Juan Mina y en su vivienda presta el servicio de confección sobre medidas de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, también elabora artesanías en fique las cuales son comercializadas ciudades turísticas; Santa Marta y Cartagena por algunos de sus  familiares. Ella trabaja de lunes a sábado en el horario de 8 a.m. a 8 p.m., y sus compras las realiza a almacenes del centro de la ciudad y campesinos a quienes les cancela de contado. En la temporada que se avecina su producción se incrementa y su capital es insuficiente para lograr la meta de ventas propuesta, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con la finalidad de comprar pintura, telas, fique que necesita para la elaboración de las artesanías.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia al realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda y conseguir mejores condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a small business owner who used her skills and abilities to set up her own business and is now able to support her home. She lives with her family in the village of Juan Mina.

She works out of her home where she measures all types of clothing as well as makes crafts out of rope which are sold in tourist cities such as Santa Marta and Cartagena by some of her family members.

She works from Monday to Saturday from 8am to 8pm. She purchases her supplies from warehouses in the center of the city and farmers.

In the upcoming season her production increases and her capital is not enough to reach her sales goals.

Therefore she is requesting a credikiva. This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.

She will use the loan to buy paints, fabric and rope which she needs for her crafts. Her goal for the future is to improve the quality of life of her family and improve her home and find better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy paints, fabric and rope which she needs for her crafts.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.en:
Guillermo lives in the town of Carmen, Bohol. He is married man and has two young children ages 2 and 5 year old respectively. He operates a sari-sari(variety) store. He caters locals in his place.
He sold basic household commodities like chips, bread, candies, noodles, assorted canned goods, beverages,soap and seasonings. He also sold gasoline, as supplemental income.

He has been engaged in running a sari-sari(variety) store for 5 years now. This is the source of his income. Her wife also has an income which will help him to meet their daily needs.

Guillermo has requested a loan to buy stocks for the store and gasoline. These will help maintain the inventory of merchandise and attract more buyers. Thus, slowly he could able to handle his finances and settle his obligation.

In the future, he is hoping that his sari-sari(variety) store will become productive.

loans.use: to buy stocks for the store and gasoline

loans.name: Lemasani

texts.en: Lemasani is 52 years old and married with 8 children. She sews and sells clothes in a market. She has (5 years of experience in this line of business. Lemasani needs a loan to buy materials,a sewing machine, scissors, threads etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy materials, a sewing machine, scissors,threads etc.

loans.name: Aristides

texts.es:
Aristides con 27 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo, en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

Aristides se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café,desde hace 7 años.El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará en la compra de abonos y pago de mano de obra para realizar el mantenimiento en su cultivo de café, con dicha inversión obtendrá mayores rendimientos.

Aristides socio recurrente en nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa. Ha manejado cinco créditos los cuáles los a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Aristides, 27, lives in a common law marriage in the district of Callacyuc, in the province of Jaén in Catamarca, Peru with his wife and their young son. The residents in this area primarily make a living from agriculture and cattle raising.

Aristides makes a living in agriculture, growing coffee, which he has been doing since he was 7. He will use this loan to buy fertilizer and for labor costs so that he can maintain his business. With this investment, he will be able to generate greater earnings.

Aristides is an established member of the Edpyme Alternativa Institute. He has received five loans which were all paid off in a timely manner.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 39 years old, married with four children. Two of whom are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary Ann has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mary Ann requested a PHP 21,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Mary Ann has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is 32 years old and is living in a wooden house located in Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She has five children in school.

She grows cassava and rice to earn income to support her family. She earns supplemental income working as a paid laborer. She has involved in her work for 14 years.

Kunthea's crop did not do well and was the main challenge for her business. She can earn about $6 (USD) per day. The previous loans helped her to support her lifestyle better than before.

She is seeking a new loan, her third, with VisionFund. As the leader of a group of two, she will use her loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to improve her cassava crop to get a greater yield. She hopes to earn more income to better support her children’s education until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava crop to get a greater yield.

loans.name: Oan's Group

texts.en:
Oan is a 42-year-old woman with three children, one of whom is in school and living in Kampong Cham province. Her main sources of income which she can support her living condition are from cassava growing and rice. The main challenge, her cassava did not grow well as before, so it made her family’s income lower. She has been with her businesses for 24 years and she can save from her income about 4 USD per day.

This is fifth micro loan for Oan with VisionFund and she wisely repaid her past loans. Her family’s living has improved gradually with her past loans. In a group of three, she is the group leader. Oan will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm to produce good yield for her family. She wishes that she can get more yields with a decent income to upgrade her condition better in the future and to support on her child’s education on time.

loans.use: to purchase the fertilizer to improve on her cassava farm, to get more yields for her family to earn more income.

loans.name: Legalo

texts.en:
Legalo is a 57-year-old woman who is married with eight children. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Legalo has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs. 

She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs

loans.name: Floriano

texts.en:
Floriano is a chainsaw operator and a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. He is 50 years old and married with four dependents.

Floriano is asking for a loan to sustain his rice paddy and help other farmers in his place. The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for hired farm labor.

The harvest from his farm will then give his family rice for family consumption, pay for his children's schooling and provide new capital for their farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for hired labor for his farm.

loans.name: Alexi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Alexi es una señora con 29 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo con 7 años y vive en el municipio Tierralta. Quiere iniciar su propio negocio, cuenta con un local que un familiar dejo de usar hace tiempos, pero le hace falta un poco de dinero para comprar una caba y carnes al por mayor, es por esto que solicita el préstamo.
Su único propósito es salir adelante, no depender de nadie y ayudar a su familia incondicionalmente.
Quiere seguir luchando hasta cumplir el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente poder pagar la educación de su hijo.
Con su aporte este mujer invertirá en un mejor futuro para su familia, anímese, preste hoy.
texts.en:
Alexi is a 29-year-old women who is married and has one 7-year-old son. She lives in the municipality of Tierralta. She wants to begin her own business. She uses a store which a family member stopped using a while back, but she still needs a bit more money to buy a cooler and meats on wholesale. For this reason, she is requesting a loan.

Her only purpose is to get ahead in life, to not depend on anyone, and to help her family unconditionally.

She wants to continue working hard until she achieves her dream of improving her living conditions, but mainly, being able to pay for the education of her son.

With your support, this women will invest in a better future for her family. Go for it, lend today.

loans.use: to buy a cooler and meats on wholesale.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a fish vendor. She was taught this business at an early age because she had to learn in order to help her husband with raising their children. She married early.

Aside from selling her husband’s catch, she also buys additional fish to sell. This is the reason why she is asking for a loan. She will buy more fish to increase her profits.

At 58 years old Erlinda wants to improve her livelihood to be able to send her school aged children to school. She has six children, four adults and two school aged.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
Don Albino es un hombre amable, trabajador y sin duda muy entusiasta. Se considera un hombre de campo y ha formado una linda familia a lado de su esposa Benita y sus cinco hijos. La mayor motivación que tiene es la de brindar lo mejor de sí mismo a sus seres queridos y darles, de igual modo, un ejemplo en la vida. Para lograr sus metas se ha dedicado a la elaboración de un platillo típico del país a base de carne de oveja: la barbacoa. “Es un negocio de herencia” comentó alegre Don Albino quien lleva veintidós años con dicha actividad para la cual cría los animales en unos corrales ubicados a un costado de su casa. Esta “herencia” pasó actualmente a tres de sus hijas quienes están muy contentas de realizar la misma actividad que las vio crecer. "Siempre les inculque que a pesar de tener una profesión no deben confiarse, así que la venta de barbacoa es una muy buena opción para obtener ingresos favorables" agregó.
   El proceso hasta obtener el sabor que caracteriza a este rico alimento es arduo y requiere de mucha atención, no obstante  los beneficios que recibe a cambio son únicos ya que le han servido para solventar todos los gastos de su hogar y los de educación de sus hijos. Los retos son inevitables pero la confianza que tiene lo ayuda a tener siempre clientes, suma su excelente atención, la gran sazón y el precio accesible.
   De igual forma, está muy agradecido con el crédito pues éste le ayudaría a comprar más ovejas, llantas para su medio de transporte e insumos para la elaboración de la barbacoa. Uno de sus sueños es aumentar el número de ventas para asegurar una carrera universitaria a su hijo quien tiene muy buenas calificaciones. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Maricela quien invertirá en vajillas y zapatos por catálogo; Maribel, en donas; Lizbeth, en ropa y Juana, en hilos y carpetas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal.
texts.en:
Don Albino is a kind, hard-working, enthusiastic man. He is considered a man of the land and has made a wonderful family with his wife, Benita, and their five children. The primary motivation that he has is to give the very best of himself for his loved ones and likewise be an example for them in life. To achieve his goals he works by making a meal that is typical of the country and based on sheep meat: barbacoa. "It's a family business," he cheerfully tells us. Don Albino has 22 years of experience with this trade, for which he raises the animals in a corral on the side of his house. This "inheritance" is currently passing to his three daughters, who are very happy to carry out the same work that helped raise them. "I always teach them that even if they have a trade, they shouldn't become complacent because selling barbacoa is a great way to earn a good income," he adds.

The process of getting the flavor that characterizes this delicious meal is difficult and requires much attention. However, the profits he makes in return are unique and have covered all of his household expenses and the education of his children. Challenges are unavoidable but the confidence that he has helps him to always have customers, as well as his excellent attention, and the great taste and accessible prices.

He is also very grateful for the loan because this will help him to buy more sheep, tires for his vehicle, and supplies to make barbacoa. One of his dreams is to raise his sales to ensure a university degree for his son, who gets very good grades in school.

The other members of the group are Maricela, who will invest in silverware and shoes through a catalog, Maribel, in donuts, Lizbeth, in clothes, and Juane, in thread and tablecloths.

*The picture was taken on the steps of the town bandstand.

loans.use: to buy more sheep, tires for his truck, and supplies for traditional consomme.

location.town: San Miguel Tenochtitlan, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig raising business in the Philippines.

Luisa requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Luisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tiva

texts.en:
Tiva is a 28 years old a single woman with 2 children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business.

Tiva needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and baking soda. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and to save for unexpected emergencies. Tiva has been a member of SPBD since September this year, 2015.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and baking soda.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is engaged in the mat weaving business to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years to help her husband augment their livelihood.

Felicisima is asking for a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy buri leaves (the largest palm in the Philippines) and dye to give colors to the mat and make it pleasing to the eye. She wants to expand this business and make it profitable so she will be able to let her school aged child finished a degree.

Felicisima is a 49-year-old woman and lives a simple life with her family in the city of Baybay, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy buri leaves (a large palm) and dye.

loans.name: Heyden

texts.en:
Heyden is a 32-year-old woman who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte with her loving husband and two young daughters. She owns a sari-sari store (general store). She has been doing this business for three years. She sells items such as drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and juice, salt, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, chips, candies, bread, biscuits, etc.

She is asking for a loan to buy the grocery items mention above. In the future, Heyden dreams of having her own capital to run her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, noodles, sugar, powdered chocolate drink and juice, salt, spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, chips, candies, bread, and biscuits.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell and plastic bags.

Yolanda has been in this business for 59 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell and plastic bags.

loans.name: Diodoria

texts.en:
Diodoria is 55 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Diodoria has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish and ingredients for her business.

Diodoria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Diodoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, soap, coffee, and milk. Josephine has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, soap, coffee, and milk

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 24 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living from a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Angeline is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Angeline has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Salvasion

texts.en:
Salvasion is 57 years old and married with eight children. With two of her children still in school, Salvasion works very hard to provide for them.

Salvasion runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like sugar, toothpaste, biscuits, detergent soap, cooking oil, vinegar, etc..

Salvasion has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, toothpaste, biscuits, detergent soap, cooking oil, vinegar, etc.

In the future, Salvasion would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like sugar, toothpaste, biscuits, detergent soap, cooking oil, vinegar, etc.

loans.name: Sitahiti

texts.en: Sitahiti is a 58-year-old woman who is single with no children. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Sitahiti has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, design boards, scissors, thread, etc. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, design board, scissors, thread etc.

loans.name: Avei

texts.en:
Avei is a 21-year-old single woman with no children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Avei has requested a loan to buy cordial, a bag of sugar, plastic cups, a freezer, etc.

She joined SPBD in September 2015 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Avei will extend her business and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cordial, a bag of sugar, plastic cups, a freezer, etc.

loans.name: Banco De Piedra Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mexiquense de origen mazahua se integró un grupo llamado Banco de Piedra cuyo nombre fue elegido por los integrantes debido al hecho de que en la localidad hay una gran cantera de donde extraen piedra y arena para la construcción de sus hogares. Los habitantes son personas muy amables, muy sencillas y muy trabajadoras cuya principal actividad es el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y habas, entre otros. Además de la cría y engorda de animales como ovejas, conejos, becerros, pollos y pavos.
      Doña Patricia es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora siempre mantiene un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su familia es el motor principal para que día a día de lo mejor de sí, la integran su esposo Mario y tres hijos quienes continúan con sus estudios. Desde hace seis meses se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos por catálogo, tiene una papelería y además atiende una tienda de abarrotes. Ha adoptado una rutina que le permite realizar todas sus actividades, así, durante el día ella se encarga de los dos negocios y una vez que sus hijos llegan de la escuela sale a vender la ropa y zapatos alrededor de su comunidad.
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con el préstamo de VFMéxico ya que anteriormente sólo contaba con una pequeña vivienda para toda su familia y ahora pudo construir una casa de dos pisos donde viven tranquila y cómodamente. Estos beneficios también le ayudaron en sus negocios pues los ha remodelado y su esposo abrió uno nuevo en una comunidad vecina. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito para comprar más artículos de papelería pues a Doña Paty, como la conocen sus amistades, siempre ha tenido un gusto especial por cubrir las necesidades de las personas que quieren superarse. Una de sus metas es mejorar sus ventas para así asegurar la educación de sus dos hijas quienes quieren estudiar pedagogía.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Laura, Rosa, Basilia, Elvira, Esmeralda y Brenda quienes invertirán en ovejas, y Janeth, en bordados.

*La fotografía fue tomada en una parte de su comunidad, Paty es quien viste pantalón gris y suéter negro.
texts.en:
In a Mexican community, with Mazahua orgines, a group called Banco de Piedra ("Bank of Rock") was founded. The group's name was chosen by its members due to the fact that in the town there is a quarry from which stone and sand are extracted for construction of their homes. The residents are very friendly, very simple, and very hardworking people whose principle activity is farming corn, beans, broad beans, and others. Additionally, they also raise and fatten animals such as sheep, rabbits, calfs, chickens, and turkeys.

Mrs. Patricia is a very happy and hardworking person who always maintains an entrepreneurial spirit. Her family is her main driver to give her best every day. She has a husband and three children who continue with their studies. For six months she has been selling clothes and shoes by catalogue. She has a stationary store and additionally, she attends to a grocery store. She has adopted a routine which allows her to carryout her activities. This way, during the day she is responsible for two businesses and once her children arrive from school, she leaves to sell clothes and shoes around her community.

What's more, she is very appreciative for the loan she received from VFMéxico considering that before she only relied on a small home for her entire family and now she was able to construct a house of two floors where they live calmly and comfortably. These benefits also helps her in her businesses since she has been able to remodel them and her husband opened up a new business in a neighboring community.

This time, she is requesting a loan to buy more stationary items. Mrs. Paty, as her friends know her, has always had a special liking for covering the needs of people who want to improve themselves. One of her goals is to improve her sales so that she can secure the education of her two daughters who want to study teaching.

The other members of the group are Laura, Rosa, Basilia, Elvira, Esmeralda and Branda who want to invest in sheep, and Janeth in embroidery.

*The photograph was taken in a part of the community. Paty is the one dressed in grey pants and black sweater.

loans.use: to buy stationary items such as notebooks, pencil sharpeners, scissors, erasers, etc.

location.town: El Valerio, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Loleta

texts.en: Loleta is a 48-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has three adult children. She and her husband work together selling fish to earn a living. They ride on a motorcycle going to some neighboring areas just to sell fish and they earn PHP 1,000 per day with this strategy. Loleta wants to uplift their livelihood. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell to be able to increase their earnings.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Jovel

texts.en:
Jovel is 36 years old and married with two children. With both of her children currently in school, Jovel works very hard to provide for them.

Jovel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, coffee, etc. to sell.

Jovel has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, coffee, etc.

In the future, Jovel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, eggs, noodles, detergent soap, and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
Suriya is a 56-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She requested a loan for her husband’s green grocery business. Her husband has been selling vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, potatoes, garlic, peppers, pumpkin, ginger, capsicum etc. for many years. He sells seasonal fresh vegetables in his hometown. He has been using a four wheel manual cart to carry the vegetables from one place to another. Now he has opened a shop selling vegetables, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy the initial inventory and a stall to run his shop in a good manner.

His children are growing and their needs are increasing. To cope with the rapid increase in the school fees, books, utility bills and household expenses, he wants to establish his business but he does not have enough savings to buy vegetables in bulk. Therefore, Suriya has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh and seasonal vegetables and a stall to display his inventory to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables and a display stall for her husband's newly setup greengrocery shop.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Adelaida requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish for her business.

Adelaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 36 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Marissa has a general store business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marissa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising poultry in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Josephine has been in the poultry business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Faalupega

texts.en:
Faalupega is a 24 year old single woman with no children. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business.

Faalupega has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, elei boards and designs

loans.name: Paula Valeria

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijas de 2, 4 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de carne a la parrilla.
Ella es buena madre, trabajadora y muy constante. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘chuquiaguillo’ área caracterizada por la reciente conexión a agua potable, de clima frio y seco.
Paula es de piel morena, ojos pardos y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymara y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al mismo negocio y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en casa de su tío que es propia, construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la cocina de carne a la parrilla, actividad que realiza 2 veces al día, “servimos, vacío, tira toda carne a la parrilla…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja con su pareja, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para renovar la parrilla porque la que tiene se encuentra muy desgastada. Su sueño es consolidar su negocio para dejar de depender de préstamos, ella desea comprar una parrilla para reemplazar la que tiene en su negocio. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paula solicita un préstamo para comprar una parrilla y reponer la antigua.
texts.en:
Paula is 25 years old. She lives with her partner. She has three daughters who are 2, 4, and 7 years of age. Her business is selling grilled meat.

She is a good mother, hardworking and very steadfast. She conducts her business in the Chuquiaguillo area known because it was recently connected to drinking water, and for its cold and dry weather.

Paula is thin with brown skin and brown eyes. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner who works in the same business and with her daughters who are studying in school. They live in her uncle’s house which he owns. It is a brick house with all the basic services.

Her business is cooking grilled meat, an activity she does two times a day. “We serve flank, short ribs, all grilled meat,” she comments. The advantage of her business is that she works with her partner. The disadvantage is the lack of money to renovate the grill because the one we have is worn out.

Her dream is to strengthen her business to stop depending on loans. She wants to buy a grill to replace the one she has in her business. This is the first loan with the institution in the one year she has been in this business.

It is for these reasons that Paula is asking for a loan to buy a grill and replace the old one.

loans.use: to buy a grill to replace the old one.

loans.name: Leatafale

texts.en: Leatafale is a 48-year-old married woman with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a pot. In the future, Leatafale hopes to extend her business and to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a bag of sugar, vegetable oil, an oven and a pot.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from vegetable vending. Lolita is borrowing 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

Sharon has been in this business for 10 years. Sharon earns more income from her general store.

Sharon has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. Marilou is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Marilou requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc., for her food production business. In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Macaria

texts.en:
Macaria hails from the rural town of Carmen, Bohol. She has been raising and selling hogs for 15 years now. Macaria is married with three grown children. Her husband is a farmer. He owns a rice farm and grows rice. She is 66 years old.

Macaria needs this loan to buy pig feed, vitamins and piglets to raise and sell to make some profit. With this loan, she will be able to sell quality pigs, and it will probably improve her earnings. Thus, she can set aside some savings for emergency use and in preparation for her old age. Macaria hopes to expand her business by raising more pigs to become more sustainable. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins and piglets

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 48 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are enrolled in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alona has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Alona requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. In the future, Alona would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Samang's Group

texts.en:
A 23-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province, Samang is married and he has a son under the age for school. He and his wife support the family through growing cassava and rice. They have been involved in this business for two years. Earning about USD 8 per day, they can manage to save about USD 4 per day for future needs. Cassava is threatened by diseases and produces lower outputs. These are the challenges to cassava farming.

He decided to form a group of two members to apply for loans from VisionFund, which is the first time for him. As the group leader, he will use his loan to purchase organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve crop yields.

Moreover, he will use some of his remaining loan to pay paid workers' fees and buy household supplies for his family. He hopes to buy another two-hectare area of farmland to grow cassava, build a new decent house, and to send his son to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields to meet his dream of sending his son to school and to buy a two-hectare area of farmland to grow cassava.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Sonia has been in this business for four years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 46 years old and married with six children.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma has been running her variety ("sari-sari") store for one year. She is a single mother having two children. Aside from selling merchandise, she also offers street foods within her local community. With her hard work and patience, she has been able to support her two children.

Delma still hopes for continuous improvement of her variety store. That's the reason she's asking for financial assistance amounting to 5,000 Philippine pesos. She will use this loan to buy merchandise such as coffee, soft drinks, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her variety store. She hopes to keep it a progressive and stable source of family income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as coffee, soft drinks, ingredients and assorted biscuits for her variety store.

loans.name: Secille

texts.en:
Secille is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 46 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Secille has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 39 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school, Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell of nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa roofing to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Almie

texts.en:
Almie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Almie has been in this business for five years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en:
Leizel is 24 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Leizel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Leizel has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en: Channa, 35, lives with family members in a rural area of Koh Sotin district in Kampong Cham province and is a mother of four children. Now, she needs to support her three dependent children, two of whom are in school and one is too young for school. For her family’s living, she has been selling sugar cane juice and raising chickens as her main businesses for 17 years. Because of the rain, the customers are fewer than before for her retail business and this is her main challenge. This is the second loan for Channa with VisionFund and she wisely paid back her past loan. Her family’s businesses have improved gradually with her previous loan. She leads a group of four members to apply for this new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a machine to squeeze sugar cane to get juice. She hopes that her business can earn her more income to improve her family’s living and support her children’s studying as well.

loans.use: to buy a machine to squeeze sugar cane to get juice to sell.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Olson

texts.fr: Olson a 37 ans. Il est célibataire et a trois enfants à charge. Il est dans la revente de boissons gazeuses. Il y gagne un peu de revenus, mais cela ne lui suffit pas pour couvrir ses dépenses. Il veut agrandir l’activité. Avec le crédit qu’il a demandé, il va commencer par augmenter son stock progressivement.
texts.en:
Olson is a 37-year-old single father to three dependent children. He sells soft drinks but his income, while decent, is not sufficient to cover his expenses.

Olson wants to expand his activity and he plans to use this loan to start increasing his stock gradually.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks.

loans.name: Marie France

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Marie-France est mère de trois enfants. Elle vit en union libre. Son gagne-pain est un petit stand de produits alimentaires qu’elle revend à des clients dans son voisinage. Elle demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Marie-France, age 38, is the mother of three children. She has a common-law partner. She makes a living with a small booth from which she sells grocery items to customers from the area. She is seeking this loan to bolster her stock of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy spaghetti noodles and maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Channak's Group

texts.en:
Channak, a young woman living in Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, is 21 years old and the mother of one kid. She earns income to support her family by fishing and raising chickens. The fish are less than before, so this is the challenge that she faces this year. Channak has been involved with her business for three years. She can save about $6 US per day from her daily income.

In this group of two, Channak is the leader, and this is her second microloan with VisionFund. With the previous loan, her family’s living was improved from last year. She will use her entire loan portion to buy a fishing net to support her business to get more fish. She hopes that her business will run smoother than before and she can earn more income to upgrade her living condition in the future as well.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net to support her fishing business and improve her family's condition.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, a resident of Battambang province, is divorced and the mother of two dependent children under school age. Growing cassava is the main business for this family. Sometimes she works for others for a fee to supplement their income. Drought is the obstacle to her cassava growing business. She earns about $9 US every single day, and she can save approximately $6 US per day.

This is the second loan for Ra with VisionFund. Her past loan has helped her improve her family’s living conditions. Leading a two-member group to get loans, Ra will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve cassava crop yields. She hopes she can earn more income so as to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve cassava crop yields to meet her dream of expanding her current business and sending her children to school.

loans.name: Marelis

texts.es: Marelis es una confeccionista que reside junto a su familia en un barrio de Barranquilla, municipio ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico en donde ha logrado cautivar con su talento a centenares de habitantes del sector. Desde niña sintió una gran inclinación por esta profesión y aprendió de su madre, a quien veía coser en su máquina y se interesaba en saber cómo unía cada una de las piezas. Empíricamente elaboró sus primeras creaciones y sin llegar a realizar capacitaciones, obtuvo prendas con acabados de calidad. Hoy en día cuenta con veinte años de funcionamiento, ofreciendo todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros: camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una máquina plana, telas y accesorios, esta inversión permitirá mejorar la estética de los productos y poder tener márgenes más altos al escoger materiales con precios de oportunidad. Su meta a futuro es ampliar sus confecciones y comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Marelis is a garment manufacturer who lives together with her family in a neighborhood of Barranquilla, a city located in the Atlántico Department where she has captivated with her talent hundreds of inhabitants of the sector.

Since childhood she felt a great inclination for this profession and learned it from her mother, who she saw sewing on a machine, and she was interested in knowing how each of the pieces joined together. She developed her first creations empirically and without being trained, she derived garments with quality finishes.

Today, she has been operating for twenty years, offering all sorts of clothing for ladies and gentlemen: shirts, pants, dresses, and school uniforms, among others. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ['Mario Santo Domingo Foundation'], to purchase a planer, fabrics and accessories, this investment will improve the aesthetic of the products and to have higher margins when choosing materials with opportune prices.

Her goal for the future is to grow her garment business and to purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase a planer, fabrics and accessories.

loans.name: Genevive

texts.en:
Genevive is 31 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Genevive has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Velorme

texts.fr: Velorme a 44 ans. Il est marié et père de 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Cela fait 19 ans déjà, depuis qu’il vend des pièces d’automobile. C'est une activité qui l’aide à répondre aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Il a déjà octroyé de petits prêts qui lui ont permis de faire fonctionner son commerce. Velorme désire agrandir davantage son commerce et mieux investir dans l’éducation de ses enfants. Craignant d’éventuelle rupture de stock, il a sollicité un microcrédit en vue d’augmenter ses marchandises.
texts.en:
Velorme is 44 years old and he is married with four children who all go to school. He has been selling spare parts for 19 years. This business helps him to meet his family's day-to-day needs. He has previously received small loans that helped him to keep his business going.

Velorme's goals are to expand his business and plan ahead for his children's education. Concerned about stock shortages, he is seeking this loan to bolster his supply of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jennylen

texts.en:
Jennylen is a 28-year-old woman who has four children, who are all in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jennylen has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to sustain it. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Jennylen would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 48 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and married. She has five children, who are all in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed from NWTF eight times in the past to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Heidi Stephanie

texts.es:
Heidi es una mujer de 32 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia posgrado en trabajo social.
Ella es inteligente, constante y muy responsable. Sus estudios los realiza en una universidad privada ubicada en la zona de Miraflores, donde se encuentra el estadio de futbol. 
Heidi es de piel trigueña, cabello castaño y físico delgado. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan y junto a sus hermanos que estudian viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Ella estudia la carrera de posgrado en trabajo social, le gustan los espacios diferentes, con jergas y reglas de juego novedosas, también trasladarse a nuevas ciudades que aún no conoce, “me organizo con horarios nuevos en relación al trabajo y repienso las rutinas familiares…” comenta. La ventaja de sus estudios es que le gusta mucho, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para pagar las cuotas. Su sueño es terminar de estudia para aplicar lo aprendido, ella desea pagar las cuotas de sus estudios para recibir un descuento. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que estudia el posgrado.
Es por esos motivos que Heidi solicita un préstamo para pagar las cuotas de su carrera por adelantado y así recibir un descuento.
texts.en:
Heidi is a 32 year old woman, single without children and is doing graduate studies in social work. She is intelligent, persistent, and very responsible. She attends a private university located in the Miraflores area where the football stadium is located.

She has a tanned complexion, brown hair and slim physique. Her mother tongue is Aymará and she speaks Spanish. She lives at home with her parents who work together with her siblings, in their own home built from bricks that has all the basic services.

She is doing graduate studies in social work. She likes different places with jargon and innovative games, also moving to new cities that she does not yet know. “I organize myself with new schedules in relation to work and rethink familiar routines,” she comments.

The advantage of her studies is that she likes it so much. The disadvantage is the lack of money to pay her fees. Her dream is to finish her degree in order to apply what she has learned. She wants to pay her school fees in order to receive a discount. This is the first loan with the institution in the two years she has been doing her graduate studies.

It is for these reasons that Heidi is asking for a loan to pay her school fees in advance in order to receive a discount.

loans.use: to pay the fees for her graduate studies in advance so she can receive a discount.

loans.name: Melone

texts.en:
Melone is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Melone works very hard to provide for them.

Melone runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Melone has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Melone would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman and has 10 children. Her oldest child is 18, and the youngest is 10 months old. Together with her family, she lives in Sagbayan, Bohol.

She raises and sells livestock like cows. Her husband also has an income that could help support the family's daily needs.

For the past 18 years, she has raised and sold cows to neighbors and town dwellers. She would like to expand but has insufficient liquid capital to do so.

Evelyn has decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost her business. She wants to buy an additional cow, which would enable her to raise more livestock, which is very essential in her livelihood.

In the future, Evelyn is determined that she will become successful and able to finance the schooling of her children. She is thankful for your support.

loans.use: to buy an additional cow.

loans.name: Kerline

texts.fr: Kerline, 25 ans, est mère célibataire. Elle a trois enfants. Elle vit chez ses parents. Pour trouver de quoi prendre soin de ses enfants, elle revend des produits alimentaires à domicile. Elle demande un prêt pour acheter des sacs de céréales et des caisses de lait concentré.
texts.en: Kerline, aged 25, is an unmarried mother. She has three children and lives with her parents. To do something to care for her children, she resells grocery items out of her home. She is asking for a loan to purchase sacks of grains and cases of evaporated milk.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of grain and cases of evaporated milk

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Corazon works hard to support her family. She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling personal collection products.

Corazon is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy manicure and pedicure materials and maintenance for her business.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy manicure and pedicure materials and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Lise, who is a 49-year-old married woman with two sons and two daughters. Lise is a housewife, and her husband is an agate seller.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a water source at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family's income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Lise will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build a water source at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Miguel is 52 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has a bodywork and paint shop that he has run out of his home for more than 10 years. With what he earns, he is able to pay his household's expenses.

Miguel is requesting a loan in order to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools so he can continue his work and increase his income to provide his family with a better quality of life, without limitation.

loans.use: to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools.

loans.name: Cresencio

texts.en:
Cresencio is a merchant from the town of Sagbayan, Bohol. He engages in soft drink vending and has sold orange soda, Pepsi, and Sparkle. In addition to that, he has also sold bread for a supplemental income.

He is 35-year-old married man with four children. His oldest child is six while the youngest is four months old.

He has joined CEVI to buy assorted drinks and bread. This is why he is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to invest in his current business. In this way he could improve his financial income.

With his previous loan, Cresencio managed to invest in his soft drink business, for which he is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks and bread

loans.name: Dieumaître

texts.fr: Dieumaître, marié et père de deux enfants, est âgé de 59 ans. Il a une boutique où il revend des boissons alcooliques, des boissons gazeuses et des produits alimentaires. Ainsi, il gagne des revenus qui l’aident à prendre soin de sa famille. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, il a recours au microcrédit.
texts.en: Dieumaître, a married father of two, is 59 years old and has a shop, where he resells alcoholic beverages, soft drinks, and grocery items. Thus, he earns an income helping to care for his family. To avoid inventory shortages, he has turned to micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase cases of beverages

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.fr: Gertrude, 41 ans, est mariée. Elle a deux enfants. Elle a un petit commerce de produits cosmétiques à la maison. L’activité peut marcher dans la zone, mais elle n’a pas suffisamment de stock pour répondre aux demandes de ses clients.
