Elle demande un crédit pour acheter un stock de papiers hygiéniques, de dentifrice et de savons de toilette.
texts.en: Gertrude, aged 41, is married and has two children. She has a small-scale business selling cosmetic products in her house. Her business can work in the area, but she does not have a sufficient inventory to respond to the demands of her customers. She is asking for a loan to purchase an inventory of toilet paper, toothpastes, and bath soaps.

loans.use: to purchase an inventory of toilet paper, toothpastes, and bath soaps

loans.name: Medisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Medisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Medisa is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market for her fish vending business.

Medisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Barrio El Toril Group

texts.es:
Existe un pequeño lugar dentro del Estado de México distinguido por su tranquilidad y su riqueza natural donde sus árboles adornan el lugar de manera especial. Sus habitantes, por otro lado, son muy alegres y entregados a sus labores quienes aún conservan su lengua materna y algunas tradiciones como las fiestas patronales.
   Doña Clara es una mujer muy simpática, integrante del grupo Barrio el Toril; siempre se encuentra de buen humor y contagia su vibra positiva a los demás integrantes. Ella y su esposo Vicente se dedican a la cría de cerdos y ovejas desde hace más de 4 años, para esta pareja dicha actividad es una muy buena opción para solventar los gastos del hogar. "Como vivimos en el campo es más fácil cuidar de los animales” comenta Clara quien se encarga del proceso de cría mientras que su esposo trabaja temporalmente desde la capital en la construcción de casas. "Iniciamos el negocio pues uno de nuestros hijos compró un cerdito cierto día, creció muy bien, y cuando lo vendimos las ganancias que obtuvimos fueron muy buenas” agregó contenta. Tiempo después escuchó hablar de VF México y las oportunidades de crecimiento y fue así como decidieron unir esfuerzos.
   Con el primer préstamo compró más ganado y en esta ocasión necesitan invertir en la compra de cerdos y alimento para las ovejas. El lapso hasta obtener las ganancias esperadas es de  8 o 10 meses, tiempo en el que los animales alcanzan un desarrollo ideal y están listos para ser vendidos, especialmente en las fiestas del municipio. Por lo anterior se encuentra muy agradecida con VF México y KIVA pues sin su apoyo no sería posible remodelar su vivienda. Una de sus metas es construir más corrales para aumentar su producción y por ende sus ganancias.  Por su parte Don Antonio y María Agustina solicitan el préstamo para invertirlo en ganado bovino.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Doña Clara es quien viste el reboso color rojo.
texts.en:
There is a little place within the State of Mexico that is distinguished by its tranquility and its natural richness, where the trees adorn the place in a special way. The inhabitants are very happy and dedicated to their work. They also preserve their mother tongue and some traditions such as the local patron saints' day celebrations.

Dona Clara, a member of the group Barrio El Toril, is a very kind-hearted woman. She is always in a good mood and her positive outlook is contagious to the rest of the members. For the last 4 years, she and her husband Vicente have worked at raising pigs and sheep. For this couple, this occupation is a very good option for resolving the household expenses. "Since we live in the country it is very easy to take care of the animals," says Clara who is in charge of the process of raising them while her husband works seasonally in house construction in the capital.

"We began our business since one day one of our children bought a piglet. It grew well and when we sold it the earnings we obtained were very good," she added happily. A while later she heard of VF [VisionFund] Mexico and the growth opportunities and that was how they decided to join together their efforts.

With the first loan she bought more livestock and on this occasion they need to invest in buying pigs and feed for the sheep. The lapse until they obtain their expected earnings is 8 to 10 months, time in which the animals reach their ideal level of development and are ready to be sold, especially in the municipal fiestas.

For the previous loan she is very thankful to VF Mexico and Kiva since without their help it would not be possible to remodel their home. One of her goals is to build more pens in order to increase production and thus increase her earnings.

For their part, Don Antonio and Maria Agustina are requesting a loan to invest in livestock.

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal pavilion. Clara is the one wearing a red shawl.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for sheep.

location.town: La soledad, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Nattan Brayan

texts.es: Nattan de 21 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de diseño gráfico que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres Nattan   con mucha dedicación a sus  estudios está logrando un buen record de notas y así poder ser un buen diseñador gráfico y más adelante retribuir todo el esfuerzo que hacen sus padres.  Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de su matrícula y pensión universitaria. Nattan   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a Kiva y Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Nattan is 21 years old.  He is single and has no children.  He is a pleasant student in the graphic design faculty who studies a lot to reach his goals in life.  With the help of his parents and with a lot of dedication to his studies, Nattan is earning good grades, and thus is able to be a good graphic designer and later on give back all the efforts that his parents do.

With the loan granted, he will invest it in paying for university tuition and board.  Nattan is very grateful for the support and says goodbye with many wishes to fulfill his proposed goals thanks to Kiva and Edaprospo.

loans.use: To pay university tuition and board

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with four children. She is 59 years old now.

Fe is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

Fe has been in this business for 38 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Solita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting this new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Solita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba is a married and mother of four kids. She is working hard to help her husband in providing good life and good educate for their children.
Heba is working as a teacher in school near to her home and her husband is working in the army Day by day the standards of living are becoming better, also Heba`s children are getting bigger and their needs are increasing.

Therefore Heba decided to start her own small business which is selling cleaning materials Her business is located at her home and she started with low quantity of products.
Now she wants to expand and develop her work and increases her incomes because she wants save money for her children education, therefore she is applying for a loan to buy more cleaning product to sell and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning tools and materials for sale

loans.name: Alijon

texts.ru:
Аличон мужчина 37 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Он с раннего возраста был приучен к труду. Окончив школу, Аличон поступил учеником на Авто мастерскую, старался хорошо научится этой профессии. Аличон трудолюбивый мужчина, он никогда не жаловался на свою работу, никогда не просил у родителей денег. Он наоборот всегда помогал им. Дополнительно он ещё работает в цехе по производству блочного кирпича. 
Сейчас он обратился для получения кредита на потребительскую нужду. Аличон обустраивает свой дом, в котором они живут, чтобы его детям было комфортно там жить. Он хочет закупить комфортную мебель в дом. Но у него сейчас не достаточно средств, чтобы закупить мебель. Поэтому Аличон обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку мебели. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Alijon is 37 years old, married, and the father of two children.  He is used to labor and has been working from an early age.  After he finished school, he started working as an apprentice in an auto shop and he tried to learn his new profession as best as he could.  Alijon is a hardworking man.  He has never complained about work and never asked money from his parents.  To the contrary, he has always helped them.  In addition to his first job, he also works in a brick-production factory. 

Alijon has requested a consumer loan.  He is currently renovating the house in which he lives with his family, so that his children can live comfortably.  He wants to buy some comfortable furniture, but he doesn't have enough financial resources at the moment to make this purchase.  For this reason, he has turned to Arvand in the hope of receiving a loan to buy furniture.  He thanks them in advance for their support and looks forward to a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Zikrillo

texts.ru: Зикрилло житель района Темурмалик.  Он в районе живет вместе 21, 19, 17 и 8  летними детьми. Жена занимается животноводством во дворе. Ей помогает дети после школы. Зикрилло имеет не большой продуктовый магазин. Он хочет приобрести больше продукт питания и обеспечить жителей района хорошим продуктом. Ему нравится торговая деятельность. Зикрилло запрашивает кредит для приобретения. Вы можете, поддержат его сейчас! Ваша поддержка поможет ему начать бизнес.
texts.en: Zikrillo is a resident of the Temurmalik district of Tajikistan where he lives with his children who are 21, 19, 17 and 8 years old.  His wife works in animal husbandry.  The children help her with the farm work after school.  Zikrillo himself owns a small grocery store.  He wants to buy more food supplies in order to provide the local residents with good products.  He enjoys working in small retail.  Zikrillo is taking a loan to stock up his shop. Your support will allow him to grow his business; please help him!

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Loma Del Calvario Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mazahua se conformó el grupo de préstamo “Loma del Calvario”, sus miembros disfrutan la libertad que hay en el lugar donde viven, la facilidad que tienen de salir a caminar y admirar la gran extensión verde que ofrece el bosque.
Erika es representante del grupo y se percibe por la presencia que tiene, la forma de hablar y la seguridad que infunde en las demás integrantes. Ella está casada con Vicente, quien trabaja en la construcción de casas en la capital del país; son padres de tres niños aunque sólo dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando. 
La actividad a la que Erika dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo, después del cuidado de su familia, es la cría de pollos. De pequeña, ella ayudaba a su madre a cuidar los mismos animales lo que le ayudó a adquirir experiencia.
Hace un año Erika solicitó un préstamo a VFMéxico el cual le ayudó a comprar más pollos y alimento, desde entonces no ha dejado de invertir en ello. Gracias al apoyo de la institución, los ingresos de Erika han aumentado un poco y tiene la oportunidad de cubrir los gastos de educación de sus pequeños con más facilidad. 
La meta de Erika es tener una granja con más pollos, un negocio más estable en el que pueda trabajar junto con su esposo para que él ya no tenga que salir a trabajar a la capital y estar lejos de su familia durante toda la semana que permanece en la ciudad.
Cuando Erika habla acerca de comenzar una actividad económica comenta “en esta vida todo se puede, sólo se necesitan ganas”.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son María Aurelia, Rosalba, Leticia, y Elia quienes invertirán en borregos; Francisca y Fabiola, en pollos.

*La imagen fue capturada en el centro del municipio donde se encuentran un quiosco, una iglesia católica y el palacio del gobierno. Erika tiene en brazos a su bebé, es la primera de derecha a izquierda.
texts.en:
In a Mazahua community, a loan group formed called "Loma del Calvario.” It's members have the liberty afforded by the place where they live. They are able to walk out and admire the green horizon the forest provides.

Erika is a representative from the group and she is noticed for the presence that she has: her way of speaking and the certainty that she inspires in the other group members. She is married to Vicente, who works constructing housing in the capital of the country. They are the parents of three children, two of whom are students.

Erika dedicates most of her time, after taking care of her family, raising chickens. Since she was a little girl, she has helped her mother to take care of chickens, which gave her experience in this trade.

A year ago, Erika requested a loan from VFMéxico that helped her to buy more chickens and feed. Since then, she has not failed to invest it in that way. Thanks to the support of the institution, Erika's earnings have increased slightly and she has the opportunity to pay for her children's education more easily.

Erika goal is to have a farm with more chickens, a more stable business where she can work alongside her husband so that he does not have to go to the capital to work and be far away from their family throughout the week when he stays in the city.

When Erika speaks about beginning her business she comments, "in this life, you can do anything, you just have to want it."

The other group members are María Aurelia, Rosalba, Leticia, and Elia who will invest in sheep; Francisca and Fabiola, will invest in chickens.

*This image was captured in the municipal center, where there is a pavillion, a Catholic church, and the governor's palace. Erika has her baby in her arms, she is the first person from the right.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

location.town: Rosa del Calvario, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 45-year-old woman who lives in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has three teenaged children ages 18, 16 and 12 years old. Her husband is a security guard while Elena is engaged in retailing rice. They work hard together to earn a living and to provide the needs of their children. Elena is determined to improve their livelihood to give good education to her children. She dreams for her children to finish their studies. As for now, she is requesting a loan of PHP15000 to buy sacks of rice for retail.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina is a 52-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has nine children and three of them are still dependants. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic commodities like eggs, sugar, bread, canned goods, shampoo, seasonings, and noodles. She has been operating a sari-sari store for a year now. Angelina requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to buy stock for her store, including noodles, canned goods, toiletries, beverages, wine, rice, and feed. This will help Angelina sell more merchandise to increase her sales. In the future, Angelina would like to expand her business to provide her children with a proper diet and quality education.

loans.use: to buy noodles, canned goods, toiletries, beverages, wine, rice, and feed.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: 35-year-old Emily relies on rice farming to provide for her family. She is a married woman with four children, ages 14, 16, 17 and 19. Life in farming is all hard work under the heat of the sun. The challenge is to wait for four months until the harvest to earn anything. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer called Urea and pesticides. She hopes to make the most of her business so she can improve her family’s living conditions. Her income will be for food, school fees and reinvestment in her business. She is from Ormoc City, Leyte.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

Marivic has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a widowed woman, 60 years old, with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nemia has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 25 years. 

Nemia requested a PHP 24,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 51 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines.

Linda requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 31 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.

Janice is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Janice has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Sreytouch's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Cham province, Sreytouch is 37 years old. She is a mother of five dependent children, two of whom are still in school and one is too young to attend. To support her family, she grows cassava and sells grocery items to get more income. Her cassava has been destroyed by insects and it is the main challenge for her. She has been involved with the cassava farm for 19 years and she can save about 10 USD from her income per day. 

She leads a group of two who request a new loan with VisionFund and this is her fifth micro loan. She has improved her family's living with decent household supplies via her previous loan and she also pays her children’s education fees on time. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer and organic pesticide to improve her cassava farm to get more yields. She will also use a part of her loan to purchase more grocery items to support her selling business. She wishes that she can earn more income from her businesses to upgrade her living and support her children’s studies as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield so that she can raise her income and save for her children's education fees.

loans.name: Waeed

texts.en:
Waeed is a victim of her failed marriage. Her husband left her with her two children and without any income or money to provide for her children. She is 22 years old lives in a sector in Jordan called Irbid.

As all mothers, she is working hard to ensure her kids have a good future.She decided to start her own business selling clothes out of her home. She started with few products and she suffers from a lack of money. 

She is a very ambitious lady who wants to be productive woman. She hopes to save up enough money to help her complete her education at a university and find good work with a good salary. 

Waeed is applying for a loan to help her buy more products and clothes to sell and increase her income. She also wants to improve the living standards for her small family.

loans.use: To buy more products and fabric

loans.name: Mehnaz

texts.en: Mehnaz aged 30 is married and a mother of a single child. She is a very passionate woman and a dedicated person-towards her work. She is never ready to compromise her work for anything in her life.She has been working on a smaller scale but now she wants to sell her product directly in the markets, for which she needs to have large stock of inventory, so she applied for the loan and very much happy with the Kiva platform through which she could make her dreams come true,such as to save money for the future,to have a house of their own,to expand her business to a larger scale.She is much thankful to the whole Kiva Team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to tailor clothes for selling it in the markets.

loans.name: Aloka

texts.en:
48-year-old Aloka is an enterprising lady and mother of one son. Her only son, after receiving a higher secondary grade education, is still unemployed. Her husband is a mason by occupation. Aloka is illiterate but can sign her name. She lives with her family in a small village in Kandi of West Bengal.

Aloka runs a puffed rice business. Locally puffed rice is called "muri." Puffed rice is a type of puffed grain made from rice, commonly used in breakfast cereal or as snack foods, and served as a popular street food in India. It is usually made by heating rice kernels in a sand-filled oven. Puffed rice is very popular in rural areas.

Aloka makes puffed rice in her home and supplies it in her neighborhood and local market. Gradually her customers are increasing. Now she wants to expand her business by serving more customers, which will also increase her income, but the problem she is facing is inadequate capital to invest in her business.

Thus she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy good quality rice in bulk at a wholesale rate. Now she hopes she can satisfy her customers' demand by making more puffed rice. She expects a good profit from her business with the support of this financial help.

Aloka is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase paddy rice for her puffed rice making business.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en: Ruqia is a 38-years old woman, living with her two sons and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been driving a motorized rickshaw which does not belong to him. With the help of savings he has purchased a used moto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He sold it again and wished to purchase a new one. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw.Therefore Ruqia requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new moto rickshaw with the contribution of savings and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. She hopes that now her husband would be able to buy more income because now he does not have any need to pay daily rent to anyone.She is very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new motorized rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: ELLA ES UNA SEÑORA DE EDAD MADURA, TRABAJA PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA YA QUE SU ESPOSO SUFRIÓ UN ACCIDENTE Y QUEDO INCAPACITADO PARA LABORAR. ELLA TIENE PROBLEMAS DENTALES QUE REQUIEREN ATENCIÓN INMEDIATA PARA EVITAR LA PERDIDA DE PIEZAS DENTALES.
texts.en:
She's an older woman who works to support her family because her husband suffered an accident and is unable to work.

She has dental problems that require immediate attention to avoid the loss of her teeth.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Peline

texts.en: Peline is 26 years old and married with one child. She runs a small business selling vegetables in her community and has been doing this for four years. Peline has requested a loan to buy seeds, spades, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer . She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Peline will save more for her child's education and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy seeds, spades, bush knives, rakes, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a weed sprayer.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is encouraged that the loan she previously accessed has helped sustain her store and increased the tenants of her rooms for rent, and thus helped in their daily sustenance. She is thanking Kiva and its goodhearted lenders for their support to businesswomen like her.

She trusts that she could once again borrow funds in the amount of 50,000 PHP loan to buy and refill her store with large quantities of grocery items like rice, instant noodles, canned goods, coffee, soda, and toiletries, which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past three years. Although there are times her sales are affected by bad weather, she is filled with faith that there are better sales ahead as sure as the sun rises.

Aileen's precious dream, just like any other loving mother, is to see her children become professionals in their chosen field. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Zenaida works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from clothing retail. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 23,500 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Zenaida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Sartinah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sartinah, who is a 44-year-old married woman with two sons and one daughter. Sartinah has a small shop where she sells food. Her husband is a fisherman. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Sartinah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clear water for their family.

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham province, Phy is 39 years old and widowed. Growing rice on a hectare area of farmland is this family's main business, while growing cassava is the secondary business. She has been involved in the farming business for ten years. She faces a challenge of getting lower outputs from their cassava farm which is destroyed by insect pests.

She formed a group of two members to request loans from VisionFund. Her past loan helped her to provide timely support of her family’s living and buy household supplies. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to boost crop yields. A remaining portion of the loan will be used to celebrate a traditional ceremony. She hopes she can get more yields and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to boost crop yields so as to improve their standard of living.

loans.name: Mikerlange

texts.fr: Mikerlange, 30 ans, est célibataire. Elle n’a pas d’enfant à charge. Elle vit en famille avec ses parents et ses frères et sœurs. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Cela lui permet d’être indépendante financièrement. Son rêve est de parvenir à être entièrement autonome et répondre à ses besoins sans grandes difficultés. Elle sollicite un crédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Mikerlange is 30 and single.  She has no children under her care.  She lives with her parents and siblings.  She buys and sells food products, an activity which allows her to be financially independent.  Her dream is to become completely self-sufficient and to meet her needs without any major difficulty.  She is taking a loan in order to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy crates of oil and spaghetti.

loans.name: Germicia

texts.fr: Germicia, 58 ans, veuve. Elle n’a pas d’enfant. Elle vit seule et mène une petite activité de revente d’articles divers : shampoing, boite à lunch, passoir, couvre-plat, etc. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Germicia is a 58-year-old widow with no children.  She lives alone and makes a living by buying and selling various goods such as shampoo, lunch boxes, strainers, dish covers etc.  She has requested a loan in order to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy crates of shampoo.

loans.name: Alaimoana

texts.en: Alaimoana is a 48-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small plantation and grows cucumbers, cabbages, tomatoes, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Alaimoana has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, bush knives, chemicals, and a spade. She has been a member of SBPD since September 2015. With her profits, Alaimoana hopes to save for unexpected emergencies and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, bushknives, chemicals, and a spade.

loans.name: Saloaloa

texts.en: Saloaloa is 65 years old and a widow with eight children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily consumption goods such as drinks, snacks, frozen food and more. She has been doing this for more than 10 years. Saloaloa needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour, rice, and chicken and drinks, sausage, snacks and more. She hopes to use her profits to support her family financially and to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, rice, and chicken and drinks, sausage, snacks and more.

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en: Fuifui is a 32-year-old woman who is single with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows vegetables in her community for a living. Fuifui needs a loan to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds. She will use her profits to expand her business and to support her family financially. Fuifui joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rakes, bush knives, a bag of fertilizer and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Kabwre

texts.en:
Kabwere is a 57-year-old food kiosk owner in Kilifi, Kenya.

He is a father of five and has worked together with his spouse in this business for the last four years, earning great income.

This is his fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase milk, cooking fat, beans, wheat and maize flour. With the anticipated profit, he will expand his food stall.

He hopes to have a successful business and a happy life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cooking fat, beans, wheat and maize flour.

loans.name: Maria Ana

texts.en:
Maria Ana is 27 years old and married with two children.

Maria Ana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Maria Ana has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Maria Ana aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, beverages, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Jolenda

texts.en:
Jolenda is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

Jolenda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Jolenda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jolenda has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jolenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling veterinary products in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nancy is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional veterinary products to sell for her business buying and selling veterinary products.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 42 years old and married with ten children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Nelia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Nelia has been farming bananas for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Julieta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Timotea is 56 years old now.

Timotea has a fishing business in the Philippines. Timotea requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Timotea has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Timotea would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en:
Juliebeth works hard to support her family. Juliebeth is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell.

Juliebeth has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Juliebeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia works hard to support her family. Amalia is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Amalia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Xochitl Azusena

texts.es:
Xochitl, considera que los créditos son herramientas útiles para mantener su fuente de subsistencia con vida, su situación económica es estable y su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas, verduras, carnes y mariscos, considera que al ofrecer nuevos productos atraerá más clientes y las ventas serán mayores.
texts.en:
Xochitl considers her loans as useful tools to keep her source of sustenance alive. Her economic situation is stable and her family has better living conditions.

She needs a new loan to buy fruit, vegetables, meat and seafood. She thinks offering new products will attract more customers and her sales will be greater.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, meats and seafood, offering new products will attract more clients and greater sales.

loans.name: Chhengkhim's Group

texts.en:
Chhengkhim, aged 50, is a married woman who resides in a rural area of Kampong Cham province. She is blessed with four children, two of whom are dependent and still in school. She, together with her husband, is growing cassava and black pepper to support her family’s living. Diseases are a challenge to the business of growing cassava.

This is Chhengkhim's second loan with VisionFund. Her past loan enabled her to improve her living conditions, buy household supplies, and support her children’s education. As the leader of a three-member group, Chhengkhim will use her loan portion to buy organic fertilizer and organic pesticide to support her business growing cassava and black pepper. She hopes to generate more income so that she can buy two-hectare area of farmland to grow black pepper, buy a truck to transport cassava, and keep her children in school until they graduate from university.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so that she can buy a truck, two-hectare area of farmland, and keep her children in school.

loans.name: Phoeun's Group

texts.en: Phoeun is a 57-year-old widowed woman living in Sangke district of Battambang province and the mother of six children. Phoeun has been growing rice and raising cows for 10 years and worked as paid labor to make extra income to support her family’s living. Unfortunately, her hard work in the farming business has been ruined by drought. She can manage to earn about 8 USD per day and she can save around 4 USD each day to support her living. This time, she is leading a group of two members to take a loan, which is her first time with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for supporting her farmland to produce a good yield. She hopes to earn a good income so that she can afford to expand her current business larger and upgrade her lifestyle to be better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to produce good yields so that she can afford to expand her current business.

loans.name: Fleurina

texts.fr: Fleurina est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Ils sont régulièrement scolarisés. Depuis l’année 2009, elle tient un commerce de produits alimentaires sous une tente tout près de sa maison. Tous ceux qui sont dans la zone viennent auprès d’elle pour faire leurs petits achats quotidiens. Son activité l’aide à contribuer aux dépenses familiales. Fleurina désire agrandir son commerce et s’offrir de meilleures conditions de vie. Tenant compte des fortes demandes de sa clientèle, elle a sollicité un microcrédit en vue d’augmenter son stock de marchandises.
texts.en: Fleurina is 35 years old, married, and the mother of two children who regularly attend school.  She has been managing a small retail business since 2009 and sells food products in a tent, close to her house.  The local residents visit her to buy the goods that they need on a day-to-day basis.  Thanks to her activity, Fleurina contributes to the family's expenses.  She now wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.  Due to the high demand she gets from her customers, she has requested a micro-loan in order to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: to buy several bags of beans and some milk.

loans.name: Amataga

texts.en: Amataga is a 64-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a business sewing and painting clothes in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Amataga has requested a loan to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, design boards and designs. She plans to use her profits to expand her business and support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing machine, paint, design boards and designs

loans.name: Faalemigao

texts.en: Faalemigao is 35 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation that grows vegetables that she sells in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years now. She needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. In the future, Faalemigao hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

loans.name: Fuli

texts.en: Fuli is 54 years old and a married woman with 10 children. She runs a small business fishing and selling fish in her community and has been doing this for five years. Fuli has requested a loan to buy fishing net, goggles, torches, spear, etc. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuli hopes to extend her house for her family's living and to support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, goggles, torches, spear, etc.

loans.name: Glynn

texts.en:
Glynn is a 44-year-old woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and a mother of 17-year-old boy who is in college. Glynn wants the best for her son; she wants to give him a good future. That is why she and her husband work hard for financial stability.

She runs a sari-sari store (general store) business while her husband has a fishing business. Glynn is asking for a larger loan amount to help her enhance her earnings. She is in need of PHP 30,000 to buy assorted commodities such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, chocolate bars, sugar, powdered chocolate drinks and juice. In the future, she wishes to expand her business to have enough money for her son’s education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, chocolate bars, sugar, powdered chocolate drinks and juice

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica has owned a variety store for six years. She is 28 years of age and still single. Jessica would like to increase the stocks of grocery items she offers but her capital is not enough. For this reason, she is seeking a loan of PHP 5,000. She will invest this loan in buying more stock of grocery items such as sugar, canned goods, rice grains and soft drinks. Jessica hopes for the smooth flow of her variety store to sustain her family's needs and save for future emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as sugar, canned goods, rice grains and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Guadalupe Cote Group

texts.es:
En una pequeña comunidad de origen mazahua donde los habitantes son muy amables, sonrientes y, sobretodo, muy trabajadores se integró el grupo llamado Guadalupe Cote. Dicha región se caracteriza porque la actividad económica principal es la cría de animales y el cultivo de maíz. De igual forma se caracteriza por un pan hecho de forma artesanal al cual llaman pan de “piojo” o de “monte”.
   Doña Cristina es, quizás, la integrante más alegre del grupo sin dejar de lado su actitud trabajadora y dedicada al bienestar de su familia. Vive casada con don Juan desde hace 20 años y han tenido siete hijos de los cuales dos aún se encuentran estudiando; uno la educación primaria y otro el preescolar. 
   Doña Cris, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a elaborar el tradicional pan de su tierra y recuerda que desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta peculiar receta. "Aprendí muy rápido pues mis padres todos los días me enseñaban algo nuevo” comenta con alegría. Así, y después de decidir formar una familia, comenzó con dicho negocio para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar y, sobretodo, los estudios de sus hijos. Todos los días jueves se le puede observar trabajar en su horno, una jornada extensa desde las 6:00 am y hasta las 10:00 pm ya que al siguiente día sale a vender su producto a la capital. 
   De igual modo, está muy agradecida con el crédito de VF México pues cuando inicio con su negocio no tenía horno y después de este beneficio logró construir el que actualmente utiliza. Con este nuevo préstamo compraría harina, levadura, leche, azúcar y leña, para de este modo tener la producción suficiente que satisfaga el paladar de sus clientes.
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Silvia, Araceli, Alejandro e Irene quienes invertirán en la elaboración de pan tradicional.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de Don Alejandro, Cristina es quien viste el vestido azul.
texts.en:
The group called Guadalupe Cote formed in a small community of Mazahua origin, where the inhabitants are very friendly, smiling, and above all, hardworking. Said region is characterized by its principal economic activity, which is breeding animals and farming corn. Likewise, it is characterized by a handmade bread which is called "piojo" bread or "monte" bread.

Cristina is, perhaps, the happiest member of the group, without forgetting her hard-working and dedicated attitude towards the wellbeing of her family. She has been married to Juan for 20 years, and they have had seven children, two of whom are still in school. One is in elementary school and the other preschool.

Cris, as she is affectionately called, works preparing the traditional bread of her land. She remembers that since she was little her parents showed her this peculiar recipe. "I learned very quickly, as every day my parents showed me something new," she comments happily. After deciding to start a family, she started with said business to be able to straighten out her home expenses and, most importantly, her childrens' studies. Every Thursday she works at her oven. It is a long workday, from 6:00AM to 10:00PM, and the following day she goes out to sell her product in the capital.

By the same token, she is very grateful for the loan from VF Mexico, as when she started her business, she did not have an oven. After this blessing she managed to build the one she currently uses. With this new loan she would buy flour, yeast, sugar and firewood. In this way she would have sufficient production to satisfy the taste of her clients.

The other members of the group are Silvia, Araceli, Alejandro and Irene, who will invest in the making of traditional bread.

*The photo was taken in the business of Don Alejandro. Cristina is wearing the blue dress.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, milk, sugar and firewood.

location.town: Guadalupe Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anafe

texts.en:
Anafe is thanking CCT and Kiva from the bottom of her heart for their untiring spiritual and financial support for her transportation business. It made it possible for her tricycle to be properly maintained and thus allowed her family a steady income. She is also blessed with a general store that helps send her two children to school.

This time she needs funds in the amount of PHP 25,000 to buy and refill her store with more essential food items such as canned goods, rice, instant noodles, bread, cooking oil, powdered milk and chocolate, eggs, coffee and other household cleaning agents to sustain and grow her store. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help.

Anafe's priceless dream is to see her two children get to college and become professionals and she prays for God to bless her efforts with success. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is glad that she was previously granted a loan which really helped sustain and grow her general store business, and thus fund her family's daily needs. Although there were times when she encountered customers who did not pay their obligation, she maintained her faith that things would get better, and true enough, God provides for their daily needs.

This time Helen needs funds in the amount of 50,000 PHP to buy and refill her store with large quantities of essential grocery items like canned goods, instant noodles, sugar, rice, bread, cooking oil, eggs, coffee, and frozen foods like processed sweetened marinated pork, hot dogs, "longanisa" (wrapped ground marinated meat). She puts all her best efforts and heart into her store as it is her source of livelihood and means to send her children to school. She hopes that people of good heart will continue to help small businesswomen like her.

Helen, just like any other small store owner, aims to have a big grocery someday. She prays to live a godly and a blessed life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed foods, rice and other grocery items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a business buying and selling eggs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of eggs to resell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elena dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of eggs to resell.

loans.name: Sokunthea's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in a rural village of Banteay Meanchey province, Sokunthea is 45 years old and has six dependent children. Nowadays, she needs to support the three children who are still in school. The main source of her income is from growing rice, which she has done for 25 years to support her family’s living. Moreover, she has worked for others for a fee to get more income. The rice’s price is lower than last year and this is her main challenge. She can earn about 11 USD per day as income. After her business expenses, she is able to save around 5 USD each day.

To save her business, she leads a group of two members to apply for a new loan. This is her second cycle with VisionFund. The previous one, which she fully paid back, completely enabled her to improve her living standards and she could afford to buy household supplies. This time she will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to increase the productivity of her crop. She hopes this year her farming can produce crop yields higher than before, so that she can sell it with a higher price, which will enable her to save sufficient capital to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to increase the productivity of her crop so that she can sell it for a higher price, which will enable her to save sufficient capital to support her business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra is 40 years old and a farmer living in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother of two schoolchildren and they need support for their studies.

To make a living, Ra has grown rice for 17 years. This is her main source of her income, and she also works for others to supplement her income. Her crop has been destroyed by insects so she sold it in a lower price.

In this group of three, Ra is the leader. She and her members are seeking their first loan with VisionFund. Ra will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for protecting her rice fields and in order to produce good yields. She hopes that this first loan will help her earn more income to improve her living conditions and support her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce good yields in order to earn more income and improve her living conditions.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yves

texts.fr: Yves, 53 ans, est marié et père de trois enfants qui sont tous régulièrement scolarisés. Yves est un rude travailleur, il travaille tous les jours pour améliorer sa condition de vie et celle de sa famille. Ne pouvant pas trouver d’emploi, il a démarré une petite activité de revente de produits alimentaires à domicile. Il a projet de monter une grande boutique de distribution de produits alimentaires en gros dans la zone, mais il lui manque de fonds pour réaliser ce rêve. En attendant, il cherche du crédit pour développer son commerce petit à petit en espérant un jour parvenir à la concrétisation de son projet.
texts.en: Yves, 53, is married and the father of three children who regularly attend school.  Yves is a hardworking man: he works every day to improve his living conditions as well as those of his family.  Unable to find a job, he started his own small retail business and he now sells food products from home.  He is planning to open a large wholesale food distribution shop, locally.  However, he doesn't have the necessary ressources to make his dream come true.  In the meantime, he is taking a loan to gradually grow his business and he hopes to be able to concretize his long-term project.

loans.use: to buy several bags of rice and ground corn.

loans.name: Peti

texts.en: Peti is a 33-year-old woman who is married with two children. She runs a business sewing clothes in her community. She has two years of experience in this business. Peti has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, material, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in September this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, scissors, material, etc.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is a man with determination. In spite of the challenges that he encountered, he is still willing to take any risk to start a new business that will help him and his family augment their livelihood. He is planning to start a water-refilling business in the town of Concepcion in Iloilo, Philippines. But he cannot sustain the high demand of his expenses. So he needs our help to permit him to be lent a bigger amount of money. He will use the money to buy a dynamo for his water-refilling system. Thus, Rey wants to enhance his business for his grandchildren’s future.

loans.use: to buy a dynamo for his water-refilling system.

loans.name: Mimisa

texts.en: Mimisa is 29 years old and single with three children. She has a small business where she grows cabbages, cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. which she sells in her community to earn a living. She needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. In the future, Mimisa hopes to expand her business and to save more for her children's education. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
She is Lucy, age 58, from the island of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Happily married to Manuel, a farmer, she has two children in high school and two already working. It is a big challenge and a struggle living in a Third World country but the couple strives hard to make a living and to be able to give their children an education. They believe that a good education is their path and hope to improve their children's lives.

Lucy thought of putting up a small general store to augment their income and it has somehow helped fund their daily needs for five years already. She trusts your good heart that you would lend her funds in the amount of PHP 17,000 to expand her small store with essential food items such as bread, biscuits, canned good, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries. She is thanking God and you in advance for your valued help. Her earnings will help fund her children's schooling.

She prays for abundance from her labor and to always live a victorious life. She wants her child to finish her college education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Maiko

texts.en:
Maiko is 24 years old and he is married with two children. 

He has had a motorcycle transport business for the last one year. 

He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle parts such as a helmet, umbrella, and tires so as to keep his motorcycle in good condition to serve more customers. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and also to buy a dairy cow. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and educate his children to a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts such as a helmet, umbrella, and tires so as to keep his motorcycle in good condition to serve more customers.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 45 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are in school.

Nenita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for nine years now.

Nenita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She is requesting a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 52 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like spices, canned goods, egg, chips, etc.

Carmencita has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Carmencita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like spices, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rowena has a vulcanizing shop business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

Rowena has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Farncisca

texts.en:
Farncisca is 51 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, chips, etc. to sell.

Farncisca has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Farncisca would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, milk, soap, shampoo, chips, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn is 37 years old and married with three children. With three children currently in school, Rubelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Rubelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rubelyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, fabric conditioners, soft drinks, candies, snack foods, cereals, etc.

In the future, Rubelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 57 years old and married with six children. Sarah works very hard to provide for them.

Sarah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Sarah has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, coffee, cereals, eggs, noodles, juice, sanitary pads, etc.

Sarah would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: Sokhom lives in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district and she is 45 years old and the married mother of three children who are in school. She grows tobacco to earn the main source of income to support her family's conditions. She has been able to earn more income via catching fish for 26 years. Her tobacco did not grow well so this is her main challenge for her family’s business. She can earn as income about 12 USD per day and she can save around 6 USD each day after expenses. She is leading a group of three to ask for her first loan with VisionFund. As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan prompt to buy seeds and pay for labor fees to support her rice farming to gain a higher yield than last year. She hopes to sell her rice at a good price so that she can get a decent income to support her children’s education until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for labor fees to gain higher yields so she can sell her rice at a good price.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en: Alicia is a 42-year-old woman who lives in the city of Baybay in Leyte, Philippines. She is married and a mother of two children ages 18 and 12 years old. Her husband is a driver while Alicia runs a sari-sari store (general store) business. She has been doing this for 20 years. Alicia became proficient in this business and she eagerly wants to do this business for another 20 years or more. The problem is there are times that her capital is used for other emergency needs such as school fees and bills. For this reason, she needs a loan amount to buy commodities needed for her store. She will purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice. Thus, Alicia wants in the future to enhance her store business to be able to start other business opportunities such as raising pigs that will probably augment her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati is a single woman. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from operating a general store. Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, etc. for her food vending business.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, cooking oil, etc.  for her food production business

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta is a 32-year-old married woman with three children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience in this business.

Elisapeta needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, an oven, a pot, shopping bags and vegetable oil. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to save more for her children's education. Elisapeta has been a member of SPBD since September, 2015.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, a bag of sugar, an oven, a pot, shopping bags and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 46-year-old married woman from the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She needs to compete well with other stores to earn a living. Miriam is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, and shampoo. With this, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers. Miriam dreams of expanding her retail store and making it a sustainable source of income so she can provide for her eight-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, and shampoo.

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is 44 years old and married with one child. She wants to start a small business growing and selling vegetables in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake. In the future, Faleupolu hopes to expand her business and to save more to support her family financially. She joined SPBD in September 2015 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a spade, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and a rake.

loans.name: Elicito

texts.en:
Elicito is a 48-year-old man. He has four children between the ages of 5 and 23. He is very busy providing chainsaw services. Most of his clients are neighbors and local dwellers in his town. He also engages in a lumber business.

Elicito decided to avail the loan to buy more stock of lumber to invest in his lumber business. In this way, he hopes to improve his income. He hopes to meet the demand and eventually expand both of his businesses.

In the future, he is determined to improve his sources of income to become sustainable and to continue financing the schooling of his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of lumber.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is 31 years old and lives in Coron, Palawan, Philippines. He is married to Roselita, who takes care of their elementary-school children and their other two children who are not of school age yet. They live in the beautiful and most visited tourist spot where most island hopping is concentrated, with volcanic limestone cliffs towering over magnificent lagoons and lakes. This led Randy to go into the transportation business to provide for his family.

At present he has a tricycle which he drives within their town. Although it helps with their daily needs somewhat, it is not enough to cover his child's schooling. So he thought of buying a boat which he will use to transport tourists from one island to the other. He expects the influx of local and foreign tourists to spend their Christmas holidays in the gleaming white sand beaches of Coron. In view of this, he is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to pay for his new boat. He is thanking you in advance for your valued help so he can fully provide for his family.

Randy hopes and prays for safe and efficient service for his passengers. He dreams of his business being successful to give his wife and children a good life. He also prays for abundance in their lives. Every week, he faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a new boat for transportation (island hopping) of tourists.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 36 years old and married with five children who are in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, candies, canned goods, eggs, etc.

Nenita has been in this business for one year.

In the future Nenita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, candies, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedita is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Mercedita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mercedita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, wood, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Mercedita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, wood, gasoline, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Raymonda

texts.en:
Raymonda is 64 years old and married.

Raymonda is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Raymonda requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Raymonda has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Raymonda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling crabs in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional crabs to sell for her business buying and selling crabs.

Remedios has been in this business for four years. Remedios earns more income from direct selling avon products.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional crabs to sell.

loans.name: Jhuna's Group

texts.en:
Jhuna, 34, is a humble lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph with her infant. She lives with her child and her parents in a small village in the Khurda district. She has been working in agriculture, raising poultry for more than three years. She is a divorcee. But Jhuna is a lady of immense patience and determination and for that reason, she never broke down; she decided to earn her own living.

Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. And the income from her business is unstable because when some disease happens to her poultry, they could die, which would leave her nothing to sell. So she would have trouble with her finances.

The main hardship that Jhuna faces is the lack of capital. She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Ligaya has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Ligaya has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma resides in San Miguel, Bohol. She earns a living through her retail sales of cosmetic products from Personal Collection. She also started a small sari-sari store (general store) selling bath soap, shampoo, matches, detergent, and canned goods.

She is asking for a loan to buy more cosmetic products, perfume, powder detergent, lotions, soap, toiletries, lipsticks, coffee, sugar and canned goods. With this, she will be able to sell more and earn more. She dreams of expanding her business in the future and saving money for the schooling of her children, ages 11 and 18.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products, perfume, powder detergent, lotions, soap, toiletries, lipsticks, coffee, sugar, and canned goods.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
32-year-old Ma. Elena has a food vending business. She sells snack foods like banana cue (deep fried banana in caramelized sugar) and camote (sweet potato).

Ma. Elena is married and has two children, ages five and nine years old. Her husband also earns an income that supports the needs of his family.

Ma. Elena requested a loan to buy ingredients for her business like bananas, camote, sugar and bamboo skewers. These are essential for the improvement of her day-to-day activity. She will be able to prepare and sell a variety of snack foods. Thus, slowly she will able to pay her obligation and manage her earnings wisely.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like bananas, camote (sweet potatoes), sugar and bamboo  skewers.

loans.name: Edilyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Edilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and raising pigs. Edilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business.

Edilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, coconut, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins.

Vilma has been raising pigs for 13 years now. She has borrowed 27 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Revocatus

texts.en:
Revocatus is in his mid 50s. He is married and has six children. Four of them are grown, and two of them are still in school. He has been running a grocery store for seven years now. He works from 7:30am to 11:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Revocatus's second loan form Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to increase his inventory of drinks and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, to reinvest in the business, and to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy the best selling drinks and chairs for the grocery store.

He dreams of owning a hardware shop.

Revocatus will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling drinks and chairs for the grocery store.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 18 años de edad, quien vive de manera humilde junto a su padre, sus hermanos de 4 y 7 años y hermana de 12 años de edad, reside en vivienda propia en la cual ha vivido desde hace 16 años. María es una joven impulsada por la visión de mejorar su calidad de vida, es muy responsable y trabajadora.
