Se dedica a la confección de ropa para camas, actividad que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logra llevar y de esta manera ayudar en la economía del hogar para que poco a poco pueda ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia. Para lo que María solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: elástico, hilo y tela para la elaboración de ropa de cama, y de esta forma conseguir suficiente material para confeccionar una cantidad mayor de sus productos para aumentar sus ventas y así aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
María is 18 years old. She lives modestly with her father, her brothers ages 4 and 7, and her sister who is 12 years old. They have lived in their own home for 16 years. María is a young woman who is propelled by the vision to improve her quality of life. She is very responsible and hardworking.

She makes a living making bedding. Through her hard work and dedication, she has managed to succeed in her profession. She helps with the household expenses as well so that little by little, she is able to improve the living conditions for herself and her family.

María is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy elastic, thread, and fabric for the production of bedding. Through this, she will have sufficient materials to make more of her products in order to improve her sales as well as her profit.

loans.use: to buy elastic, thread, and fabric to make bedding in order to increase the sales of her business.

loans.name: Gita's Group

texts.en:
Gita is a 25-year-old differently abled lady who lives with her husband, parents-in-law, and two children, 4 and 7 years old, in a small village in Odisha state, India. In the picture, the lady standing in the middle is Gita.

She is engaged in rice paddy cultivation. Her husband is doing the same business.

Some years ago, Gita formed a group with two other women from her village and named the group in her name. All three women are engaged in the same business activity to alleviate their poverty. Gita is the president of this group. She motivated the other two members to form this group so they could help and support each other in their businesses and personal lives.

Gita, along with her other two group members, requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

She hopes to build a house for her family, and she is very grateful to Kiva and People's Forum for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase standard-quality seeds and fertilizers for her paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Melquiades

texts.en:
Melquiades, 46 years old, is married and has four children. He has operated his rice mill machine for almost ten years to earn a profit and this business has become the family's main source of living. Melquiades has been able to sustain the business and send his children to school.

Melquiades is planning to engage in some other activities for the expansion of his business. He can now gain access to GDMPC and will take out a loan to be used to cover the maintenance cost of his machine so he can render a good service to his customers. Melquiades’ plan for the future is to save more money for his children's education when they get into college.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance cost of his machine

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en: Amparo, 64 years old, is married and has ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 22 years, Amparo has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Amparo has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. Amparo would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 50-year-old married father of six children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, Mahmoud started working, thirty years ago, in the construction field specializing in plumbing to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Mahmoud is an ambitious man who is working hard to develop his business. He is thus acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy updated tools which will facilitate his business and help him to provide his customers with better and quicker service. Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy updated tools which will facilitate his plumbing business

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has a 22-year-old daughter. Lucita and her husband have been selling fish for almost twenty years to raise their family. They sell fish by going to some rural areas on their motorcycle. They have been doing this to increase their sales since there are many competitors in the market place. Lucita is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy more fish and enhance their livelihood. Lucita earns additional income from raising pigs.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Vicky Del Carmen

texts.es: Vicky es una ama de casa que decidió seguir los pasos de su suegra quien se dedica a producir bollos de maíz y fritos, consideró que esta actividad sería una alternativa para tener su propio negocio y ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar. Diariamente elabora empanadas, caramañolas y papas rellenas que comercializa en la terraza de su vivienda, así mismo prepara bollos de maíz que dispone en el mismo punto donde comercializa las comidas rápidas. Ella desearía ampliar su producción y por ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar maíz al por mayor y utensilios de cocina necesarios en la preparación de sus comidas. Su meta es duplicar sus ventas para el próximo año y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Vicky is a homemaker who decided to follow in the footsteps of her mother-in-law who makes a living making fried corn dough buns. She thought that this occupation would be a way to have her own business and help her husband with the household expenses.

Everyday,Vicky makes empanadas, caramañolas, and papas rellenas (all are regional food dishes) that she she sells from the patio of her home. In addition, she prepares fried corn dough buns that she offers from her patio as well.

Vicky would like to increase her production, and for this reason she is applying for a credikiva, the first financing that she has done through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the loan to buy corn at wholesale as well as necessary kitchen utensils to prepare her food. Her goal is to double her sales in the next year and remodel her home.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale as well as kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is a 43-year-old woman from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She is a beautician who owns a beauty parlor in her place. She cuts and styles hair and provides manicure and pedicure services. She is requesting a loan to buy cotton, acetone, alcohol, different nail polishes and chemicals for hair treatments. Once these are all available, she can cater to more customers and increase her income. In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful so that she can continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy cotton, acetone, alcohol, different nail polish and hair treatments

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Rafael

texts.en:
Rafael is a 41-year-old married man and a father of three children. The family lives in Trinidad, Bohol. Rafael has been engaged in the hog raising business for three years. He also farms rice for supplemental income.

Rafael is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops and feed to make his hogs healthy. With this, he will be able to improve his harvest and yield and he can fatten his pigs. In the future, Rafael hopes to expand his business to make it more sustainable and productive for the education of his three children, ages 12, 14 and 17.

loans.use: to  buy feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 64 years old, is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  For the past 26 years, she has operated a general store business in the Philippines. Gloria has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. In the future, Gloria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling firewood in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years, and earns additional income from providing manicure/pedicure services.

Dolores is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of firewood to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel, es soltera, no tiene hijos, vive con su hermana en casa familiar, para tener los recursos para cubrir sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia ella fundo una tienda, en la que ofrece detergentes, aceite, bebidas, etc., tiene su negocio desde hace cinco años.
Invertirá en cereales, pastas, boquitas, bebidas, etc., mejorara el inventario de la tienda para competir en el mercado y ayudar a sus clientes a encontrar en un solo lugar lo que están buscando.
Su visión es tener un negocio más amplio para sobre salir en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Anabel is single with no children, and she lives with her sister in a home owned by their family. She started her own store in order to be able to take care of her personal expenses and help her family. In her store, she sells detergent, oil, drinks, etc. She has had her business for five years.

With this loan, Anabel will buy cereal, pasta, snacks, drinks, etc. in order to expand the inventory of her store to compete in the market and help her customers find all they are looking for in one place.

Anabel's goal is to expand her business to distinguish herself in her community.

loans.use: to buy cereal, pasta, snacks, drinks, etc. to expand the inventory of her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, milk and other items to sell.

loans.name: Yorling Arleja

texts.es: Yorlin está muy agradecida con los créditos obtenidos por parte de KIVA  y MiCrédito, poco a poco ha ido aumentando el inventario de su negocio y ha logrado poner nintendo para que los clientes cuando llegan a su pulpería se entretengan jugando un poco. Con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado mejorar su casa ya que se siente un poco insegura con la infraestructura que esta tiene. Para seguir supliendo la demanda de sus clientes Yorlin solicita un crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, jugos entre otros productos.
texts.en:
Yorlin is very thankful for the loans she has already received from KIVA and MiCrédito. She has gradually been expanding the inventory of her business, and she has managed to get a Nintendo so that her customers can entertain themselves a little when they come to her store.

With the profit that she has earned, she has been able to improve her home, since she feels a little insecure about the infrastructure of her home.

In order to continue meeting the demands of her customers, Yorlin is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, and juice among other products.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and juice among other products.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime, es casado y tiene cinco hijos. Sus dos hijas mayores ya están casadas y están estudiando y sus tres hijos menores están solo estudiando. El señor Jaime, es un pequeño agricultor y ganadero, actualmente siembra granos básicos y café. También realiza labores para aserrar madera. En la comunidad donde vive don Jaime no hay luz eléctrica y ellos se tienen que estar alumbrando con candelas y foco, es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de un sistema solar el cual será instalado en la casa de habitación ya que éste les será de mucha utilidad para todos los miembros del hogar, ya que los hijos que están estudiando podrán realizar sus tareas por las noches y la señora de don Jaime podrá alumbrarse por las noches y las madrugadas para hacer la comida, don Jaime comenta que estaría muy agradecido si le brindan la oportunidad de este préstamo para poder comprar este sistema solar que lo está necesitando bastante.
texts.en:
Señor Jaime is married and he has five children. His two older daughters are already married and they are studying. His three younger children are only studying at this moment. Señor Jaime is a small farmer and rancher, and he is currently farming staple grains and coffee. He also does work sawing wood.

There is no electricity in the neighborhood where Jaime lives, and so his family has to use candles and flashlights to get light when it's dark. For this reason, they are requesting a loan to buy a solar system which will be installed in their home, and will be very useful for everyone in the household. His children who are studying will be able to complete their work at night, and Jaime's wife will be able to have light at night and at dawn in order to prepare food.

Jaime says that he would be very thankful if you would give him this opportunity through a loan to be able to buy a solar system which they need so much.

loans.use: to install an 85-watt solar system with 4 floodlights.

loans.name: Cindy Marcela

texts.es: Cindy es una diseñadora de modas que inició su microempresa en su apartamento, ella está enfocada en la confección de prendas de vestir y lencería. Esta apasionada por la moda se profesionalizo en este arte con la finalidad de garantizar un producto único y estético, diariamente recibe a sus clientes en su taller y les asesora en cuanto a tonalidades, diseños y tendencias que mejor le favorezcan.  Ella cuenta con tres años de experiencia y sus canales de promoción los realiza por medios masivos como internet y redes sociales, lo que le garantiza una gran base de clientes es por ello que su capital no abastece su demanda y está solicitando un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materias primas e insumos que le permitan generar una producción a costos moderados y le garanticen excelentes utilidades. Su meta a futuro es formalizar su taller en un local y continuar estudiando.
texts.en: Cindy is a fashion designer who started her small business in her apartment. She is focused on designing clothing items and lingerie. She is passionate about fashion. She studied this art in order to guarantee an original and artistic product. Daily, she receives her customers in her workshop and helps them regarding tones, designs and the fashion styles that favor them the most. She has three years of experience, and she promotes her business through massive media such as internet and social networks which assures her a good number of customers. Since her capital is not enough for the demand she has, she is requesting a Credikiva, her first loan to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to buy raw materials and inputs that will allow her to generate production at moderate cost and warrant excellent profit. Her goal in the future is to formalize her workshop in a store and to keep on studying.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and inputs to allow her to generate production at moderate cost.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 28 years old, married and had three children. She is managing a small store and acquire income in selling grocery items to the people in their village. She wanted to improve her earnings that is why she is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy canned goods, breads, eggs and softdrinks to sell. 

In the future, Jessica hopes to continue improving her sales and save fund for family's emergency needs.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, breads, eggs and softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year old Rogelio owns a farm and grows rice.  He is married with and all his children are adults. He has been into farming for 32 years now.
He is in need of additional capital to be used to pay for labor of the hired farmers and fertilizer to maintain his farm. These could help improve his crops' growth.
Rogelio hope that someday all his hard work will pay off and that he can live an abundant life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en: Rufina hails from Trinidad, Bohol.  She is 43 years old and relies in farming for a living.  Her farming has been existent for eleven years now. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor of other farmers.  She wanted to increase her income so she can buy the basic needs of her household like healthy meals and pay for electricity.  Any additional income will be for savings and school fees of her four children ages 4-21.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor of other farmers

loans.name: Maria Melona

texts.en: Early this year, a 54-year-old woman named Maria Melona has successfully own a sari-sari store (general store) with basic products such as sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, bread, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, cooking oil, noodles and canned goods. She was very happy because through this business she has the chance to help her husband financially. Hence, she needs an amount to purchase additional items such as soft drinks, drinking liquor, laundry soap, biscuits, candies, chips, etc. and rice to sell. Maria Melona dreams to expand her business in the future. She wants to uplift their livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, drinking liquor, laundry soap, biscuits, candies, chips and rice.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old, married with five children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from vegetable vending.

Nenita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jorge Ernesto

texts.es:
Jorge es dueño de un cibercafé, ofrece al público el servicio de copias, uso de computadoras con acceso a internet, papelería, etc., el negocio lo tiene ubicado en las cercanías de una universidad, lo que le da mucha ventaja para atraer a nuevos clientes, él es soltero, no tiene hijos y vive con su madre.
Para mejorar más su negocio hace la solicitud de un crédito con el que comprara papelería, memorias, tintas, etc., surtirá el inventario que ofrece a sus clientes para mantener su fidelidad, espera dar un servicio más ágil y administrar bien el préstamo.
Sus sueños son tener un mejor estilo de vida y un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Jorge is the owner of a cyber cafe. He offers copying services, access to computers with internet, paper products, etc. to the public. His business is located in the vicinity of a university, and this advantage enables him to attract new customers.

He is single with no children, and he lives with his mother. In order to improve his business, he is requesting a loan which he will use to buy paper products, computer memory products, ink, etc. to stock his inventory for customers and retain their loyalty.

He hopes to offer a more agile service to his customers and manage his loan well. His dreams are to have a better quality of life and a promising future.

loans.use: to buy paper products, computer memory products, ink, etc. to stock his inventory for his customers in order to retain their loyalty.

loans.name: Chhaylon's Group

texts.en:
Chhaylon, 39, is a resident living in Banteay Meanchey province and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school while the remaining two are under the age of school. Her husband is a blacksmith and she is farmer raising pigs. They have been involved in these businesses for 19 years. Slow growing of pigs and diseases are the obstacles to her pig-raising business.

She has been with VisionFund for three cycle loans already; past loans which were paid back completely have helped her to buy enough household supplies to use and send her children to school. Now, she is leading a group of two members to get loans and she is going to use her loan to buy piglets and feed to nourish them. She hopes she can earn more income to expand her business by buying more piglets to raise and to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to nourish them so that she can buy more piglets to raise and support her children’s education. 	.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
NAGINA is a 38-year-old woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children; now they have grown old and they have needs as well. 

Her husband has a business of providing the transport of goods such as sand, pebbles, concrete, cement, and soil from one place to another. He has been doing this work for many years and generating a reasonable income for his family. Nowadays his tractor trolley has broken due to overloading and unpaved paths. He is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to fix the tractor trolley. Due to this reason, he is unable to continue his services and his earnings are zero.

Therefore, NAGINA has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan; her husband will use this amount for buying tires for tractor trolley so he can start his services again. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tractor's tires for her husband's construction material supplying business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is a resident of Trinidad, Bohol. This town is two hours away by bus from the capital Tagbilaran City. Near Trinidad town is a place where people thrive due to the gold rush that started in 1980s. People from this place work on the river banks to collect gold deposits even if it still needs refining. From them, Gloria buy raw gold and sell it to other buyers in the town of Trinidad. Aside from buying gold, she also farm rice to earn a living. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer for her crops. Gloria dreamed of living an abundant life in her old age. She is 64 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Julynie

texts.en: Julynie is 22 years old. She is married woman with a two-year-old son. As her husband work as a farmer, Julynie spent her time raising hogs and selling gasoline in retail. She is inspired by this business because this does not take her away from her child. She is asking a loan to buy feed, piglets and gasoline. She hope to have a sustainable business and it is her dream to build a beautiful house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and gasoline

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol is a resident of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old while her youngest child is 16 years old. She has always been dreaming of a better means of living, in order to give her children a good education for them to have better lives in the future. Therefore, she decided to raise pigs to augment their livelihood. She is running a hog raising business but she is always worried how to sustain their feed. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy feed for her pigs. In addition, she wanted to improve this business to reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a 38 year old second hand shoe dealer at Kilifi Kenya. He is a father of five whose spouse is a house wife and has been in this business for the last two years earning great income.

This is his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business, he will use the loan to purchase second hand shoes and the anticipated profit to expand his business and educate his children. He hopes to own a shoe shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase second hand shoes

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman with five children, all of whom attends school. She owns a  house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 15 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
Martha, tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposo, sus hijos ya trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, ella se dedica a cultivar granos básicos desde hace más de 20 años junto a su esposo, cuando recoge sus cosechas una parte la almacena para consumo familiar y la otra la comercializa para tener ingresos.
Ella utilizará el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, plaguicidas y abono, contara con los materiales para sembrar maíz y frijol, le será de ayuda para mejorar la producción, abastecer a sus clientes y tener mayores ganancias.
Su sueño es mantener su familia unida y trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old and lives with her husband. Her children work and help to support her financially. She has been working at growing staple grains for over 20 years, together with her husband. Part of their harvest is stored to be eaten by the family and the rest is sold to provide an income.

She will use the loan to buy compost, fertiliser, insecticides and pesticides and obtain the materials needed for planting corn and beans. This will help her to improve production, supply her clients and increase her earnings.

Her dream is to keep her family together and to work to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertiliser, insecticides and pesticides and obtain the materials needed for planting corn and beans

loans.name: Im's Group

texts.en:
A widowed woman who has two children in school, Im is 32 years old living in a bed-room house located in Kampong Cham province. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income. Moreover, she has worked as a paid labor to earn more income. These businesses have been with her for 14 years. The crop has been destroyed by insect pests which enable her to earn income about 7USD per day. After her business expenses, she is able to save around 5USD each day.

She has a better house to stay in from her past loans and this is the third loan with VisionFund for her new loan. Im is leading a group of two and she is the group leader. She will manage her entire portion of loan in order to buy fertilizer to produce good outputs. She hopes this year she can sell it in good price, so she can earn more income to improve her family’s living and support her children’s education on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to produce good outputs so that she can sell it in good price and improve her family's living.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Raul De Jesus

texts.es: Raúl de 48 años de edad habita en residencia propia, en donde ha vivido durante 22 años. Ahí reside junto a su esposa, sus hijos y junto a un nieto de dos años de edad. Raúl es una persona responsable y trabajadora, él se dedica a laborar como albañil independiente, además se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Negocio que administra desde hace 10 años y para lo cual a la fecha cuenta con un número bastante grande de clientes que lo prefieren, gracias a este negocio ha podido mantener la economía del hogar. Raúl tiene el deseo de mejorar su condición de vida para lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: concentrado, vitaminas y también más pollos para aumentar las ventas y de esta forma aumentar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Raúl is 48 years old, and he lives in his own home where he has resided for 22 years. He lives with his wife, their children, and a grandson who is two years old.

Raúl is responsible and hardworking. He makes a living as an independent bricklayer, and he also raises and sells chickens. He has managed this business for 10 years, and now has a large customer base that prefers his services. Thanks to this business, he has been able to take care of his family.

Raúl would like to improve his living conditions, and so he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy feed concentrate, vitamins, and more chickens to increase his sales and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate, vitamins, and more chickens to increase the sales of his business and earn more profit.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una ama de casa que actualmente labora para para ayudar en el gasto familiar, ella este presentando problemas en sus muelas del juicio que no le están saliendo correctamente por lo cual necesita una cirugía correctiva, de no realizarse dicha cirugía podría dañar otras piezas. Sin embargo no cuenta con los recursos para llevar a cabo la cirugía.
texts.en: This borrower is a housewife who also works to help with the household expenses.  She has problems with her wisdom teeth, which are not coming in correctly.  This is why she needs corrective surgery.  If this is not done, her other teeth may be damaged.  However, she lacks the resources to pay for the surgery.

loans.use: for dental treatment

loans.name: Silvia Janneth

texts.es: Silvia de 31 años de edad y tiene 9 años de habitar en vivienda propia, vive con su hijo de 13 años, su hija de 8 años de edad y su compañero de vida quien le apoya económicamente. Silvia es una persona que busca la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello se dedica a la venta de ropa de cama. Ella hace todo lo posible por lograr satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia y así sacar adelante a sus hijos, y en busca de mejorar sus ingresos económicos ella decide vender ropa de dama y de niño, en vista que hay una gran demanda en el mercado por estas prendas de vestir pero para poder vender este tipo de ropa es necesario invertir, pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa de cama, blusas, faldas, camisas y todo tipo y estilo de ropa de dama y de niño para su negocio para maximizar las ventas y así las ganancias.
texts.en:
Silvia is 31 years old, and she has lived in her own home for 9 years. She lives with her son who is 13 years old, her daughter who is 8 years old, and her life partner who shares in the financial responsibilities.

Silvia is searching for a way to improve her quality of life, and for this reason she makes a living selling bedding. She does everything she can to meet the needs of her family and take care of her children. Looking for a way to earn more income, she has decided to sell women's and children's clothing as well. There is a large demand for this type of clothing in the market, but it's necessary to make an investment in order to sell this type of clothing.

Silvia lacks available cash to make this investment, and so she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy bedding, blouses, skirts, shirts, and all types and styles of clothing for women and children for her business in order to maximize her sales and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy bedding, blouses, skirts, shirts, and many other styles of clothing for women and children to increase the sales of her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Corazon is 55 years old.

Corazon has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Corazon requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Corazon has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Nelieza

texts.en:
Nelieza, 42, is married and has two children, one of whom is in school. For the past six years she has had a sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines.

Nelieza has applied for a 14,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store. She is working hard to build up her business so as to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is a married woman with five children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past eight years Mayasa has sold coconuts in her area to earn a living. Seasonality and the high cost of transportation are a challenge for her business.

Mayasa decided to join Kiva's field partner Yehu in order to take advantage of its loans to build up her business. She has applied for a 50,000 KES loan to buy more sacks of coconuts to sell. She dreams of developing her business to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Juana Evangelista

texts.es: Juana de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de tortillas, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo y constuyendo nuevas paredes, pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo no le alcanza para realizar dicho proyecto, por esa razon solicita a INTEGRAL un credito para la compra de los materiales de contruccion necesarios y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Juana, who is 57, lives in her own home with her family. She has been selling tortillas for five years. Thanks to this job she has been able to get ahead on household expenses. She would like to improve her home by changing the ceiling and constructing new walls, but with what she earns at work she can't afford that project. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL to buy materials necessary for construction and thereby be able to have more secure housing.

loans.use: buy necessary materials for construction.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza es una microempresaria que habita junto a su familia en un barrio del Sur de Barranquilla, ella continuo con el legado comercial que su familia había dejado y que con la intensión de velar por el bienestar de su hogar, decidió vender en su vivienda refrescos; actividad que desarrolla todos los días de la semana a partir de las 4 p.m. hasta la 1 p.m. Esta emprendedora de 58 años de edad encontró una oportunidad de generar ingresos y de continuar con sus roles hace seis años, en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en gaseosas, jugos y cervezas al por mayor con la finalidad de mejorar sus costos, garantizar mayores ganancias y aprovechar la temporada de fiestas que se avecina.  Su meta de negocio es seguir creciendo y su meta personal ayudar a su familia a cumplir con sus objetivos.
texts.en: Maritza is a small business owner who lives with her family in a suburb in south Barranquilla. She continues the commercial legacy of her family with the intention of ensuring the welfare of her home. She sells soft drinks from her home, an activity carried out every day of the week from 4 pm until 1 am. This enterprising 58-year-old found an opportunity to generate revenue, continuing in this role for six years. She is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to invest in soft drinks, juices and beer wholesale in order to improve her costs, ensure higher profits and take advantage of the holiday season ahead. Her business goal is to keep growing her business and her personal goal is to help her family to meet their objectives.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, juices and beer at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ana Griselda

texts.es: Ana de 46 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 4 y 10 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida, negocio con el cual genera sus ingresos económicos que gracias a que en su comunidad es el único comedor que hay eso le ha permitido tener una numerosa cantidad de clientes que la visitan y la recomiendan además de brindar todos los insumos básicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus dos hijos. Ana desea invertir en su negocio comprando más productos para la elaboración de la comida y poder ofrecerles a sus clientes más variedad de comidas de esa manera  poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, carne, vegetales, frijoles, azúcar, papas, pollo, etc., para invertir en su negocio y poder ofrecerles ha sus clientes nuevas variedad de platos de comida a sus clientes.
texts.en: Ana is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their two children, ages 4 and 10. She is a hard-working woman who sells meals, a business that generates income. Thankfully, hers is the only diner in the community and this has allowed her to have numerous clients who recommend her in addition to providing her the means to help her raise her children. Ana wants to invest in her business by purchasing more products for preparing food and to offer her customers a greater variety, in this way increasing her income. She is requesting a loan through Kiva partner FUSAI to invest in corn, meat, vegetables, beans, sugar, potatoes, chicken, and more to improve her business and to offer her customers a new varieties of dishes.

loans.use: invest in corn, meat, vegetables, beans, sugar, potatoes, chicken, and so on for her business.

loans.name: Ghislaine Esperance

texts.fr: Ghislaine est âgée de 53 ans. Mariée, elle a six enfants. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Cette activité lui procure des revenus qui lui permettent d’épauler son mari pour couvrir les dépenses de la famille. Elle veut tirer davantage de bénéfices de la revente des produits alimentaires. C’est pour cela qu’elle est à la recherche de financement pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Ghislaine is 53 years old. Married, she has 6 children. She resells food products. This business brings her income that allows her to assist her husband to cover the family expenses. She would like to draw more profit from the resale of food products. That's why she is looking for funding to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy cases of eggs and bags of flour.

loans.name: Socheat's Group

texts.en:
Socheat, 32, is a local farmer living in Battambang province. This married woman is blessed with three dependent children, two of whom are in school, while the remaining one is too young for schooling.

She makes a living through growing rice, raising pigs and fishing. These businesses earn her about USD8 per day, and she can save approximately about USD3 each day. Drought, which causes crops to produce lower outputs, is the main challenge to her business.

This is the second loan cycle for her with VisionFund. The past loan has enabled her to send her children to school. As the leader of a three-member group, she will divide her loan into parts and use it as following: some to support rice growing by purchasing organic fertilizer, pay for land preparation cost and pay for reaping fees. Some loan remaining will be used to buy feed to nourish the pigs.

She dreams of an increase in income to expand her farming business and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to enrich her farmland so that she can keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Simplicio

texts.en:
Simplicio has been selling foods in the street. With the use of his motorcycle, he could be able to deliver it to his loyal customers as early as he could. He was earning more profit from this activity. He was able to repay his previous loan.

Recently, he took a new loan to buy more foods to sell and to pay for the maintenance cost of his motorcycle that he will be using in selling his food products.

Simplicio wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy more foods to sell and to pay for the maintenance cost of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites works hard to support her family. Marites is married and has a raising goats business in the Philippines.

Marites requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her goats.

Marites has been in this business for 11 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like beans and Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Purnima's Group

texts.en:
Purnima is a differently abled lady and the president of the the group. She is the one standing to the right in the photograph. She resides in a small village in the Khurda district of Odisha. She has stories to tell about how she made her living and gradually improved her lifestyle by making leaf plates. She, along with her husband, prepares leaf plates and sells them in the local market. The business of leaf plates began long ago.

She, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 24,000 INR. Purnima will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase raw materials for her business like different sizes of leaves, thread, glue and other necessary materials which will support her business.

She wishes to sell their leaf plates in the main market rather than the local market. She even plans to sell these leaf plates to various sweets shops, small stalls selling eatables, etc.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business like different sizes of leaves, thread, glue and other necessary materials which will support her business.

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es:
El Estado de México se caracteriza por sus comunidades en donde viven personas muy amables, trabajadoras y muy orgullosas de sus raíces indígenas mazahua, como es el caso. Allí aún conservan su lengua materna, vestimenta, valores, fiestas patronales, etc.  Gran parte de los pobladores se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, calabaza, habas etc. sin dejar de lado la cría de animales. 
   Doña Amelia es una persona reservada pero muy amable, trabaja diariamente para apoyar a su familia integrada por su esposo Don José y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales uno se encuentra estudiando la educción preparatoria. Su esposo siempre ha sido comerciante, la mayor parte de tiempo dedicado a la compra y venta de productos para el hogar; “yo sólo llevo 20 años con esta actividad e inicié por necesidad pues debía cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar y la educación de mis hijos” comentó. Su forma de vender es “rancheando”, es decir, que vende de manera ambulante dentro de comunidades aledañas, en sus plazas o tianguis. Ella considera ésta la mejor opción pues vende mejor que si sólo tuviera un lugar fijo.  En cuanto a la competencia se muestra muy optimista pues sabe por experiencia que las ventas son un cincuenta por ciento la atención que des al cliente.
   Por otro lado, está muy agradecida con VF México porque gracias a los préstamos  adquiridos compra toda la mercancía posible sin preocuparse por recaudar la inversión primera. Ahora, con este nuevo préstamo, compraría jergas, fibras, trapos, cepillos, entre otros artículos de jarcería. Uno de sus más grandes sueños es que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando, espera que puedan graduarse de alguna carrera profesional.
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Albino quien invertirá en almohadas y colchas; María de los Ángeles, en pollos, y discos musicales; Maricela, en una tortillería; Josefina y Don Mateo, en una bonetería y Alicia, en vasos de licuadora.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro del municipio, Amelia es quien viste el suéter color azul.
texts.en:
The state of Mexico is known for its communities of kind, hard-working people who are very proud of their native Mazahua heritage. They still preserve their native tongue, clothing, values, patron saint festivities, etc. Many of the locals work in agriculture growing corn, beans, pumpkin, lima beans, etc while also raising animals.

Amelia is a reserved person who is very kind. She works every day to support her family comprised of her husband, Jose, and their four children, one of whom is in high school. Her husband always has worked as a merchant and she has worked mainly in buying and selling home products. "I have only been in this business for 20 years and started it to cover household expenses and pay for my children's education." she says. She works as a street vendor in the squares or markets of neighboring villages.

She feels this is her best option because she sells more than if she were in a permanent place. She is very optimistic regarding her competition because se knows through experience that 50% of sales has to do with customer service.

She is very grateful to VF Mexico because thanks to their loans she is able to buy the merchandise she needs without having to save for a first investment. With the new loan now she will buy cloths, fibers, rags, brushes and other cleaning articles.

One of her greatest dreams is for her children to continue their education and graduate with a professional degree..

The other members of the group are Albino, who will invest in pillows and bedspreads; Maria de los Angeles, in chickens and music CDs; Maricels, in a tortilla business; Josefina and Mateo, in a sewing supplies shop; and Alicia, in blender glasses.

*The photo was taken in the center of town. Amelia is the one wearing a blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy cloths, fibers, rags, brushes and other cleaning articles.

location.town: San Agustin Mextepec, San Felipe del progreso

loans.name: Nelson Jhovany

texts.es: Nelson de 33 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 16, 14, 12 años y una hija de 9 años de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador que labora en una vivienda cerca de su comunidad en la cual se desempeña como jardinero, actividad que le permite satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. Nelson habita en una humilde vivienda que ha sido construida con láminas y con el paso del tiempo se ha empezado a deteriorar, y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para mejorar las paredes de su hogar con material nuevo y de mejor calidad, y de esta manera también ampliarlo para mejorar su comodidad y la de su familia, logrando así vivir de una mejor manera, más tranquilos y más seguros.
texts.en:
Nelson, 33, lives in his own home with his life partner and sons, ages 16, 14, 12 and a daughter age 9. He is a hard-working man who works as a gardener at a home in his community. Through his work he is able to satisfy the basic needs of his family.

Nelson lives in a humble dwelling built out of corrugated metal. Over time it has become deteriorated so he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy new, better quality metal, wood and nails to repair the walls of his home. He also will expand the house to make the home more comfortable, safer, and with quieter living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new, better quality corrugated metal, wood and nails to repair his house.

loans.name: Nelson Vladimir

texts.es: Nelson de 24 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y junto a sus 3 hijos de 7 y 5 años y un hijo pequeño de 1 año de edad. Él es un hombre trabajador y responsable que se gana la vida gracias a que labora en una finca, labor que le permite obtener ingresos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia. La vivienda en la que reside Nelson y su familia es humilde, la cual ha sido construida con madera y lamina. Debido a las fuertes lluvias que han azotado, su vivienda muestra partes dañadas y desea reparar su vivienda lo antes posible, pero al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria, solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para reparar las partes que se encuentran dañadas de su vivienda, para que sus hijos puedan vivir de una mejor manera y de una forma más segura en su hogar.
texts.en:
Nelson, 24, lives in his own home with his life partner and their three children, ages 7, 5 and 1 year old. He is a hard-working, responsible man who earns a living working on a farm which allows him to earn enough income to cover the basic needs of the family.

Nelson's dwelling is humble, made of wood and corrugated metal. As a result of the harsh rainfall that beats down on the house, parts of it are damaged and require repair as soon as possible. Since he does not have the money to cover the cost he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy corrugated metal, wood and nails to repair the damaged parts of the house. This is so his children have better living conditions and a safer home environment.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal, wood and nails to repair the damaged parts of his house.

loans.name: Miguel Humberto

texts.es: Miguel de 33 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañera de vida, su hijo de 7 años y una hija de 12 años de edad. Él con mucho esfuerzo lucha por que a sus hijos no les falte nada y puedan crecer con todo lo necesario en su vida. Miguel labora en una empresa que se encuentra cerca de su comunidad, en la cual presta sus servicios como jornalero y así también posee una tienda en la que vende productos básicos del hogar, la cual administra su compañera de vida. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Miguel decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para construir un cuarto en su propiedad y de esta manera proteger a sus hijos brindando resguardo y tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Miguel, 33, lives with his life partner, a son, age 7, and a daughter, age 12. Through much effort he struggles to provide his children with everything they need in life. He works as a day laborer for a company near his community and also has a store where he sells basic home products. His partner helps with the store.

In order to improve his lifestyle, Miguel has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy corrugated metal, wood and nails, and to hire workers to build a new room on his property. This is to increase the safety and tranquility of his children.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal, wood, nailes and hire workers to build a room on his property.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 36 years old and has three children. Shirley is married and all three children are in school.

Shirley is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Shirley has been pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Shirley would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over 20 years, she has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Misaidi

texts.en:
Misaidi is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and competition in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Her name is Epifania, 43 years old, and she is from the province of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Benjamin, a maintenance man, she has three children, one of whom is in college and one is already working. Making a living in a developing economy is a big challenge but the couple support each other in order to make ends meet.

Her husband's income as a maintenance man is not enough to raise a family so Epifania thought of driving a tricycle so she could help provide for their needs. A tricycle is a motorcycle with a side car that carries around four passengers. It is a common means of transportation in the Philippines and serves as a kind of taxi for short distance travel.

Proper and regular maintenance of her tricycle is necessary to ensure efficient and safe service. In view of this, she is humbly seeking your help in the amount of PHP 10,000 to pay for repair, spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. This will help ensure a steady income from her tricycle service and will help fund her child's college education.

Epifania's priceless dream is to see her child earn a college degree and become successful in her chosen career. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for repair, spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit for transportation.

loans.name: Ma. Ruby

texts.en:
Ma. Ruby is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Ruby is 30 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Ma. Ruby has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

Ma. Ruby has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Ma. Ruby would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like wood, nails, and paint for her business.

loans.name: Love's Group

texts.en: Love is 36 years old and a mother of three. She is a teacher at the community primary school. She lives with her husband and children in their family compound. To be able to meet her daily needs and that of her family, she joined the palm oil milling association. She invests part of her monthly salary into the trade, working every weekend at the mill and also after school hours. This strategy is really helping her provide for her family. A portion of this loan will help her and her fellow group members, who are also teachers, to increase production this season to generate more income. This is their second loan after successfully repaying the first loan. Love was able to purchase a fairly used motorbike from her profits and savings. The profit from this loan and her weekly savings with Nke-Anyi Cooperative will be added to her future plans savings. Love and her group members thank all Kiva lenders who support their loan.

loans.use: to process and store palm oil products

loans.name: Jamali

texts.en: Jamali is married and doing farming alongside owning rentals in Kasese, Uganda. By doing this, he is able to provide for his family. Jamali would love to plant bananas. Since its the rainy season,  he looks forward to being the leading banana farmer in his area. He, however, needs to buy improved banana stems and plant them under the land where he has already applied fertilizer to increase their immunity and resistance to pests and diseases. At the moment, he lacks enough money to meet his budget. He is requesting money to buy improved banana stems for planting.

loans.use: to buy improved banana stems for planting.

loans.name: Simon Peter

texts.en: Simon has been in the "rice farm" type of business greatly for more than 10 years. Amazingl, he’s only 45 years old and a father of three children. He firmly decided to apply for a loan for the purpose of buying fertilizer and covering the cost of farm labor from GDMPC micro-credit to improve his business production. In God’s time, he’s hopeful that soon he will own more farmland for his livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to cover the cost of farm labor.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Chantha is a 31-year-old married woman who has six dependent children, four of whom are in school while the remaining two are under the age of school. She and her husband are growing rice, raising pigs and cows and fishing to earn a living. She earns around USD 12 per day and can save approximately around USD 5 each day. Drought is the obstacle in the rice-growing business and she gets lower-than-expected outputs.

She leads a group of three members to request a loan from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and rice seeds and pay for land preparation cost.

She hopefully wants to increase her income to expand her business and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and rice seeds to increase her yields so as to keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add to his stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: Alpia

texts.en:
Alpia works hard to support her family. Alpia is married and has a business selling broomsticks in the Philippines.

Alpia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more broomsticks to sell.

Alpia has been in this business for eight years now.

In the future, Alpia would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more broomsticks to sell.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 48-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards seem not fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw, which is their single source of income.

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her son as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total.

Therefore, Nasreen wants to receive a loan for her son so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way, she will encourage her son, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family.

Nasreen hopes that her son will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for her son so she can add an earning person to the family.

loans.name: Kuka

texts.en: Kuka is a 38 year old mother with 4 children, she runs a small business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Kuka requested for a loan to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, backpack sprayer, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank, backpack sprayer,

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de zapatos desde hace 6 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su casa en una zona muy transitada por eso posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el esta solicitado un credito para la compra de mas zapatos por mayor y asi continuar con sus ventas para tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jose, 31 years old, lives in his own house with his family. He has worked selling shoes for 6 years, his business is located near his house in a highly-trafficked area, so he has many customers. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover some of the expenses that come up in his home. He is asking for the loan to purchase more shoes in bulk and, so, to continue with his sales to have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Alba Areli

texts.es: Alba de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia la cual inicio con capital propio, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, etc. para seguir con sus ventas y seguir obteniendo mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Alba, 33 years old, lives in her own house with her life partner. For 5 years she has had a small store located in her home which she began with her own capital. She has many customers because of her good prices. With the earnings that she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She is asking for another loan to be able to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc., to continue with her sales and continue getting improved earnings.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is 41 years old and has four children. Manuela is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Manuela is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Manuela requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Manuela has been raising livestock for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Manuela would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 33 years old, married with three children.

Nena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like breads, toothpaste, cooking oil, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Nena has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like breads, toothpaste, cooking oil, coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and materials for rebuild her pigpen.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fish vending.

Rowena dreams that one day she will be able to save money to buy a farmland for livestock.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and materials for rebuild her pigpen

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa is 57 years old and married with three children. 

Nicolasa is in the agricultural business, raising cattle in the Philippines. Nicolasa requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle.

Nicolasa has been raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nicolasa would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Jodelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Jodelyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase boxes of fish, plastic bag, etc for her fish vending business.

Jodelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of fish, plastic bag, etc for her fish selling business.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a very hard working married man who lives in Hoima Uganda. He started his business of riding a motor cycle for transport in union he also owns studio basically taking photos to raise an extra income to support his family. He desires to expand and develop his business however; inadequate capital hinders the attainment of his desires. He is seeking for loan facility to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is a married woman with six children, three of whom attends school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
María, de 51 años de edad, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron las actividades de la agricultura y la ganadería, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera y sus hijos tienen sus hogares aparte, pero le ayudan a realizar las labores agrícolas.

María, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio lo desempeña desde hace varios años junto a sus hijos, durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas y en el transcurso de la tarde ella dedica a ordeñar las vacas para elaborar lácteos. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla que le vende un familiar y espera que en el futuro le ayude a incrementar la producción de leche.

María, sueña con comprar un terreno para pastar sus animales y poder sembrar.
texts.en:
María, 51 years old, grew up with her parents who taught her the agricultural and livestock tasks. She went to school up to the ninth grade, she is single and her children have their own homes, but they help her to do the agricultural work.

María works in agricultural. She has worked in this field for some years with her children. In the morning, they work in the plots and throughout the afternoon, she works milking the cows to make dairy products.

María needs the loan to purchase a heifer which a relative is selling to her and she expects that in the future it will help her to increase her milk production.

María dreams of purchasing a plot of land to graze her animals and be able to plant.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona lejana de la capital del país, se está esbozando para poder salir adelante, es por ello que estudia y se dedica, la carrera que eligió es la de ciencias contables.
Está en el último año de su carrera, y comenta que su mayor anhelo es recibirse para poder emprender en su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para usarlo en el pago de sus gastos de tesis.
texts.en:
Sandra is from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is distant from the country's capital. She is outlining a plan to be able to get ahead, and for this she is studying and dedicated. The degree that she chose is accounting.

This is her last year in her program and she says that her greatest desire is to graduate to be able to work in her field.

She asks for this loan to use it to pay for her thesis costs.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe owns a Sari-sari store in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She like doing this business because she don't have to go far. This is just attached to her house. She sell powdered fruit juice, sugar, milk, coffee, canned food, toiletries and seasoning. She is asking a loan to buy canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, liquor and soft drinks. This will put her at edge over other store owner when her stocks are full. Fe hope to live life to the fullest with her income.

loans.use: to buy canned sardines,  beef loaf, shampoo, bath soap, milk, coffee, sugar, liquor and soft drinks

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia  earns an income from her gardening production business. She is from Aurora,Zamboanga Del Sur,  and has been gardening for more than two years, and earning enough money to sustain her living expenses. Lucia has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for farm fertilization. She always finds ways to augment her earnings. Recently, Lucia took a new loan to buy fertilizer  and for the for her  vegetables replanting costs in order to produce a good of products and deliver plenty of vegetables in the market. Lucia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer  and for the for her  vegetables replanting costs

loans.name: Levy

texts.en:
Levy is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children., five of whom in school.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like can goods, egg, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like raising pig.

Levy dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

Alicia has been in this business for 11 years. Alicia earns more income from selling ready to wear.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zaida

texts.es:
Doña Zaida  es casada, tiene 61 años de edad y es madre de 5 hijos, todo mayores de edad e independientes económicamente, sin embargo ella continua ayudándolos siempre que puede. Tiene más de 44 años de casada, su esposo trabaja como mensajero en un centro de salud. Para Doña Zaida y su esposo sacar adelante a 5 hijos con solo un ingreso era muy difícil, ella decidió trabajar como empleada domésticas por horas para poder aportar un ingreso adicional a su hogar, fue ahí donde conoció a una señora, su antigua jefa y dueña de una pequeña fábrica de ropa de cama, quién le enseño a coser. Luego se especializó en la confección de ese tipo de prendas como: edredones, ropa de cama, cobertores de electrodomésticos, delantales, cortinas, juegos de baño y pijamas. Tiene 29 años de dedicarse a este negocio y asegura que su actividad productiva le permitió ayudar a sus hijos para que terminaran sus estudios, incluso su hija menor hace un año se gradúo como doctora en farmacia y siempre contó con el apoyo monetario de su madre. Doña Zaida asegura que también su negocio le enseño a ser independiente económicamente, algo que es muy importante para ella. Actualmente como una actividad paralela además de esparcimiento trabaja en la pintura de piezas en cerámica producto que se le está vendiendo muy bien. La señora cuenta con una amplia trayectoria en la organización, su primer crédito lo solicito en el año 2008, este es su quinto financiamiento y se caracteriza por su puntualidad y responsabilidad. 
Su primera máquina la compra por medio de un financiamiento, la misma señora que le enseño a coser le regalo sus primeras telas, una carrucha de elásticos y una de hilo, fue así como inicia el negocio.
Sus clientes son vecinas, amistades, familiares, amas de casa y muchos otros, de la misma comunidad y otras aledañas. Por su amplia experiencia y calidad en la confección de sus prendas ha logrado mantener la fidelidad de sus clientes. En su comunidad no hay competencia en esa especialidad, ya que si existen costureras pero de ropa a la medida.
texts.en:
61-year old Sra. Zaida is the mother of five children, all of whom are now adults and financially independent. Nevertheless she continues to help them whenever she can. She has been married for 44 years; her husband works as a messenger for a health centre.

For Sra. Zaida and her husband to support their five children on a single salary was very difficult, so she decided to work as a domestic servant on an hourly wage in order to bring in additional income. That was how she met a woman, her former boss and owner of a small factory making bed linen, who taught her how to sew. Then she specialised in making items such as quilts, sheets, furniture covers, aprons, drapes, bathroom sets, and pyjamas. She has had her business for 29 years, and it has allowed her to help her children complete their studies; one daughter a year ago qualified as a pharmacologist and could always count on her mother's financial assistance.

Zaida's business has also taught her to be economically independent, something that is very important for her. In a side business that is also a means of relaxation, Zaida paints ceramic pieces which then sell very easily.

She has a good record with the organisation. Her first loan was in 2008. Now she is seeking her fifth loan. She is noted for her punctuality and responsibility. Her first sewing machine was bought through a loan. The very woman who taught her to sew gave her her first fabric, a box of elastic and another of thread; that was how she started her business. Her customers are neighbours, acquaintances, relatives, housewives, and many others from her community and others nearby. Because of her years of experience and quality work, her customers are now regulars. In Zaida's community there is no competition in her particular line of business although there are seamstresses who make clothing.

loans.use: buy supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, lace, unpainted ceramics, paint brushes, paints, chalk, polish etc.

loans.name: Neydis

texts.es: Neydis es una emprendedora ama de casa de 29 años de edad que complementa sus labores en el hogar con su actividad comercial, la cual se ha convertido en una buena fuente de  ingresos para su familia.  Su negocio surgió por su cónyuge quien la motivó  a realizar un negocio desde su casa ubicada un sector de Barranquilla un municipio del Atlántico donde ha tenido muy buena acogida por los habitantes del sector a quienes ofrece bolis y cubetas de hielo, así mismo maneja un amplio surtido de productos de uso personal; cosméticos, cremas, shampoo, colonias, splash entre otros productos que exhibe en una vitrina, así como artículos de papelería.  Todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. esta dispuesta a recibir a sus clientes, sin embargo necesita renovar el surtido y variedad de productos es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en cremas corporales, tratamientos de belleza y fragancias.  Neydis es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad a quienes les ofrece una mejor calidad de vida con el fruto de su trabajo.  Su meta a futuro es comprar un congelador nuevo y realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Neydis is an enterprising homemaker, 29 years old, who complements her household work with sales, which have become a good source of income for her family. Her business began from her spouse who motivated her to start a business from her home, located in Barranquilla, a municipality in the Atlantic department where she has been warmly welcomed by the people in the area to whom she offers bolis [frozen treats] and ice cubes and she also manages a wide assortment of personal use products: cosmetics, creams, shampoos, colognes, splash, and other products which she shows in a display case, as well as paper goods. Every day, from 8 am, she is ready to receive her customers.

However, she needs to renew her stock and the variety of products and for this she is applying for her first Kiva loan that she is currently processing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in body creams, beauty treatments, and fragrances. Neydis is the mother of four children who are minors and to whom she offers a better quality of life with the fruits of her labor. Her goal for the future is to purchase a new freezer and make repairs to her house.

loans.use: to purchase body creams, beauty treatments, and fragrances.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old, married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell.

Norma has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Norma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell

loans.name: Umazi
