texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman and has been blessed with eight children all of whom attend school. Together with her husband, they live at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability leading to losses.In addition she also operates a paraffin selling business that earns her another source of income.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
GULSHAN is age 58. She is living with her five children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been selling vegetables for many years; he uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, and as a hawker he can easily reach near to the people. The people like to buy vegetables at their doors instead of moving to the market. Due to his fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for vegetables has increased, and around noon his stock comes to an end.

GULSHAN feels proud for her son and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is receiving this loan for her son so that can buy seasonal vegetables in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. She wants to save the excess profit so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables for her son's green grocery business.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
BUSHRA is the age of 43 living along with her spouse and a daughter in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She runs a small business at home with the help of her husband. Her practice is to paste sequins, pearls and precious stones on to shirts and has been selling them in the market. She has been purchasing raw material through her savings; her savings are spent upon household goods and does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw material to continue her business.

Therefore, BUSHRA has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan; she will utilize the amount for purchasing sequins, gum, pearls and cloth to continue her business.
She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy cloth, sequins, gum and pearls for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
21 mujeres son las que integran este grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras, son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo conjunto y unido y por medio de las capacitaciones que les ofrece la fundación.
Mirna es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella se dedica a la peluquería, es una persona que se sacrifica mucho por sus seres queridos, ya que se esfuerza para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Mirna agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Twenty-one women make up this group called Mujeres Emprendedoras, they are very hard-working and determined. They got together to be able to help their families through their collective and united work and through the training that the Foundation offers.

Mirna is one of the members of this group. She works in hair-styling. She is a person who sacrifices a lot for her loved ones and she works hard to be able to give them everything that she was not able to have.

Mirna is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting and asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her hair-styling business, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses, and more, so to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to purchase hair-styling products such as dyes, creams, shampoos, rinses, and more.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 30 años, es vendedora ambulante de prendas de vestir tanto para damas, caballeros y niños, por todo Caaguazú, tiene más de 800 clientes a quienes siempre vende.
Maria empezó como cobradora de una Boutique donde fue captando experiencias y rescatando contactos, en donde una día se decidió en independizarse y realizar visitas de forma personal, y asi poco a poco ha podido crecer y mejorar.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir de distintos tipos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo y ofreciendo a sus clientes lo que desean.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and sells clothing for men, women, and children in the streets of Caaguazú. She has more than 800 regular customers. She began as a collection agent for a store and in this way gained experience and contacts. One day she decided to start her own business and make visits in person to her customers; that was how her business grew and became more successful.

María is seeking a loan to buy different kinds of clothing so that she can continue to grow her business and provide what her customers want.

loans.use: buy a variety of clothing to resell

loans.name: Mwitongo Grp  Musoma Mwitongo Grp  Musoma Group

texts.en:
Coletha is in his late 20s is single with one kid who is still in school. She has been a tailor and also sales clothes for three years now. She works from 08am to 05.30 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up to date materials for selling and for making suits and dresses to resale. She dreams of increasing good materials for her business.

Coletha will share this loan with her loan group Musoma Mwitongo which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy up to date materials for selling and for making suits and dresses to resale.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is 34 years old. He is married with four children. He has had a livestock farming business for 10 years. He will be using the loan to purchase cattle for sale and hopes this will help him eradicate poverty  and to invest. His hopes and dreams for the future are to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for sale to help him eradicate poverty  and to invest

loans.name: Jhona

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Jhona works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Jhona is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Jhona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie works hard to support her family. Elvie is married and has a direct selling personal collection products business in the Philippines.

Elvie requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more products from personal collection to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for 4 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products from personal collection to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Josephine is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients and materials like meat, frozen foods, bamboo stocks, etc. for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients and materials like meat, frozen foods, bamboo stocks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lilliam Lisett

texts.es:
Ser madre soltera ha sido una de los grandes impactos en la vida de Lilliam, una joven de 24 años de edad, madre de un pequeño de dos años, quien la motivó a salir adelante con su propio negocio. Esta joven emprendedora tiene tan solo cuatro años de haber iniciado con su pulpería y va con pequeños pasos, pero muy fuertes, gracias a su esfuerzo y ala apoyo de su padre y de su madre.
Ella sueña con mejorar la infraestructura del negocio e invertir más en este, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar pan, arroz, frijoles, dulces, servilletas, azúcar, entre otros productos que le gustaría integrar a su pulpería y que asegura le traerá mejores ingresos. En sus planes está casarse, así como mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su hijo.
texts.en:
Being a single mother has been one of the greatest impacts on Lilliam's life. She is a young woman, 24 years old, the mother of a 2-year-old little one, who has motivated her to get ahead with her own business. This young entrepreneur opened her store only four years ago and it is going with small, but very strong, steps thanks to her efforts and her father's and mother's supportive wings.

She dreams of improving the business's infrastructure and investing more in it, so she asks for a loan to purchase bread, rice, beans, sweets, napkins, sugar, and other products that she would like to incorporate into her store and which will surely bring her better income. In her plans are to get married and also to improve her quality of life and that of her son.

loans.use: to purchase bread, rice, beans, sweets, napkins, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Ron's Group

texts.en: Ron is 53 years old living in Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district and she is a married mother of five children, one of whom is in school. To support her living, she has been growing rice for 33 years. She has worked for others for a fee and fishing to get additional income. Destroying by insects, she couldn’t get high yields from her rice farm. In a group of two members, she is the group leader to seeking her first loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed to increase the productivity crop. She hopes to earn more income to expand her current business and upgrade her standard of living next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to increase the productivity crop so that she can earn more income to expand her current business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen, is a 48-years old married woman, living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession in Lahore city which is very populated area. A few days ago he was in a road accident; he was looking for the passenger by standing beside the road, a speeding car hit the rickshaw from behind. He did not get any fracture but the rickshaw’s body was seriously damaged and needed to be replaced with a new one. Her husband has some amount short to buy new body for auto rickshaw.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy the body of auto rickshaw.
Nasreen is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan, for this support.

loans.use: to buy new body for her husband's rickshaw so he can compensate against an accident .

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; el socio Manuel alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de venta de autopartes para autos, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio vende lo que son parabrisas, faros entre otros, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
EL socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de parabrisas entre otros.
 El socio agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the Padre Urraca communal bank. The borrower, Manuel, alternates his daily tasks with working at his business selling car parts. The member has had his business for a good while, which is going well for him, thanks to the determination that he puts into his business each day. The borrower sells windshields, headlights, and more. The borrower wants to be able to continue working to, in this way, continue supporting his family.

The borrower asks for the loan to purchase windshields and more.

The borrower is grateful for the loan through this platform and in the same way promises to make the payments on the stipulated schedule.

loans.use: to purchase windshields and more.

loans.name: Samul

texts.en:
Samul is a 31-year-old married mother of four dependent children. Two of them are in school and the other two are too young to attend school.

To make a living, she and her husband grow rice and work for others for a fee. Together, they earn about USD 9 per day and can save about USD 5 each day.

Her challenge is to get better output from the rice, which is destroyed by insect pests.

This is the first cycle for her with VisionFund and she is going to use her loan to buy a decent motorbike and renovate her house. She hopes that new motorbike can reduce cost of commuting and make her living more convenient.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike to reduce the cost of commuting so as to save more money for her school-aged children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Sachala's Group

texts.en:
Sachala is 40 years old, a single mother who lives with her two children, age 15 years and 13 years. She has taken care of and brought up her children with great effort and love. Once they were older, she had more free time so she began to teach herself crafts such as sewing, decorating terracotta statues of Lord Jagannath, and other handicrafts. Little by little she creates her products and sells them to her neighbours and friends.

Along with her group member, she is requesting a loan of 24,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase supplies and merchandise at wholesale as Samuka (used for decoration) items, wood, fabric, thread, paint, etc. This will allow her to continue to work and offer more variety to her customers. It will also allow her to fill the orders she already has and increase her sales and income.

The financial support will help her to strengthen and grow her business even more with the aim of generating job opportunities for some family members who need jobs and thereby improve the quality of life for her whole family. She is standing to the left in the photograph.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and merchandise at wholesale such as wood, fabric, thread, paint, etc. to make Samuka (decorative) items.

loans.name: Munkhtur

texts.en:
Munkhtur, 28 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

He has been working as a technologist at a leather factory since 2011. His wife has a position of tailor at the same factory where he works. Their daughter, now 7 years old, goes to elementary school.

He is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy furniture such as a sofa, a closet and a chest of drawers for his home. By doing so, he will enable his family to live in a comfortable environment.

loans.use: to buy furniture such as sofa, a chest of drawers and closet.

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
María con 42 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera, vive en casa familiar de material rústico, vive junto a sus padres y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona rural.

María se dedica al alquiler de play station,Cuenta con 30 años dedicándose a este rubro. La venta lo realiza en su domicilio. El destino del crédito sera para invertir en negocio en compra de aves así como mantenimiento y compra de discos de play station, con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene mejores precios.

María es socia nueva para nuestra institución Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
42-year old María is a single mother in a civil relationship. She lives in the family home made of simple materials with her parents and two young children in the district of Pucará, province of Jaén, department of Cajamarca, in a rural part of Peru.

To earn her living María rents out Play Station, a job she's had for thirty years. She works from home.

She plans to use the loan to buy additional equipment as well as maintenance and discs for Play Station so that she can generate more income and improve her quality of life. There is not much competition in this line of work in the area so María will earn good money with these purchases.

She is a new client with the Edpyme Alternativa institution.

loans.use: buy additional equipment as well as maintenance and discs for Play Station

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. Elvira is married and has a buy and sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Elvira requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

In the future, Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Verceli

texts.en:
Verceli is 35 years old, married, and has three children. With one child currently in school, Verceli works very hard to provide for them.

Verceli runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as beers, coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as beers, coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Verceli would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items such as beers, coffee, soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Set

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of Dambae district in Tbaung Khmum province, Set is a 58-year-old mother of three dependent children, one of whom is still in school.

Growing cashews is the primary source of her income and she can earn additional income growing cassava. These businesses have been with her for 40 years. The crop has not grown well and this is the main challenge in her business.

After successfully repaying her past loans, she is requesting the third loan with VisionFund now. The previous loans helped her improve her family’s living. Set will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer to support her crop to increase her crop for her family. She hopes that this new loan will help her to make a good income and improve her standard of living next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase her crop so she can earn more income to support her living.

loans.name: Sery's Group

texts.en:
Sery is a mother of two children who lives in a wooden house located in Kampong Thom province and she is 29 years old.

Rice farming on a one-hectare area is the main source of her family’s income. She can earn additional income via working for others for a fee. She can earn about 12 USD per day and she has been with her business for ages.

She has been with VisionFund for two loans already and she paid back her past loans successfully. She improved her living conditions with her past loans.

In a group of four members, she is the leader of group. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy a decent latrine for supporting her family members so that they can live a comfortable life and avoid infectious diseases. She hopes that all her family members are healthy and they can perform their jobs better than before to earn more income to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a decent latrine for supporting her family members so that they can live a comfortable life and avoid infectious diseases.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, es un comité nuevo, donde las integrantes del grupo se esfuerzan para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por medio de las capacitaciones y del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Sra. Ninfa, quien se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha por sus seres queridos, para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ninfa tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, y gracias a su buena atención siempre va sumando más clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para surtir su despensa con verduras, frutas, comestibles variados, leche y otros, y así poder seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group was formed in the town of Caaguazú. It is a new committee where the members of the group are working hard to be able to improve their living conditions, through training and a programme for the elimination of poverty.

One of the members of this group is Ninfa, who stands out by being a very hard-working woman who fights to be able to give a better quality of life to her loved ones. Ninfa has a small grocery store where she works every day from the early hours. Thanks to her good attention she is always attracting more customers.

She is asking for this loan so that she can invest in buying supplies to stock her grocery store with vegetables, fruits, various groceries, milk and other items, so she can keep offering a wide variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, various groceries, milk and other products to sell.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 48-year-old married father of five children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp.

Due to the low financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, 35 years ago he started working in concrete painting to cover his family's needs and expenses.

Youssef is a hard worker and an ambitious man who has a good reputation in his region. He is trying desperately to develop his business and provide his family with decent living conditions.

Today he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay his children's school tuition fees.

Youssef hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to pay his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old. She is married and has six children.

She has had a vegetable-selling business for the last 10 years and earns a good profit.

She will be using the loan to purchase more stock of assorted vegetables for sale and hopes this will help her expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to expand the business.

loans.name: Wevina

texts.en:
Wevina, 50, is a married woman with five children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Wevina has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Wevina requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Wevina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Katupyry está en su ciclo número 1, es un grupo nuevo, trabajan dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Entre las integrantes se destaca la Sra. Catalina, una mujer muy optimista, y trabajadora, que se esfuerza para poder aprender más, y por medio de esas capacitaciones poder mejorar su humilde emprendimiento, el cual es la venta de ropas. Catalina comenta que aunque su trabajo es duro, toda lucha es por el bien de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans, y otros,  y de esa manera poder seguir ofreciendo a sus clientes una buena variedad que es lo que siempre les llama la atención.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Katupyry group is in its first loan cycle. It is a new group, working within a programme for the elimination of poverty, to be able to improve their living conditions and help their loved ones.

Catalina stands out among the members as she is a very optimistic and hard-working woman. She makes a real effort to learn more, and through the offered training opportunities she will be able to improve her modest business, which is selling clothes. Catalina says that although her work is hard, every struggle is for the good of her family.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy a variety of garments, such as t-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and other items, so that she can continue to offer her clients a good selection which is what always attracts attention.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, trousers, jeans and other items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Neverless

texts.en:
Neverless has requested a loan to buy more clothes to sell to her customers.

She is married with three children who attend school; they all live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She trades in used clothes, mainly buying and selling men's and women's clothing. With the proceeds, she has been able to pay school fees for her children and support her husband in providing for the family.

She worked hard on cocoa growing and managed to get the initial capital for starting the clothes selling business. She is, however, challenged by increasing transport costs to markets, competition and high market dues paid to local authorities on a daily basis.

Her business dream is to own a boutique in the major streets of town, while her personal goal is to educate her children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
ZARINA is a 48-year-old mother of five children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a turner by profession. He works over a lathe machine and manufactures various spare parts usable in machinery and vehicles by utilizing cast iron. He has been doing this business for many years and up to now his business has been very steady.

Due to continuously working the lathe machine, some important parts have been tearing off and urgently need to be replaced. The whole mechanism of the lathe machine is affected without the replacement parts.

Her husband is a poor person and does not have sufficient cash on hand to buy spare parts to fix the lathe.

Therefore, ZARINA has requested a loan for her husband so that he can fix the lathe machine and to buy cast iron to continue his manufacturing business smoothly.

ZARINA hopes that this loan will prove productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to fix the lathe machine and to buy raw material (cast iron ) for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
ZUBAIDA is the age of 39, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son newly set up a mobile shop near his home; he offers types of mobiles, accessories and provide a recharge facility. He has attained a list of customers in a few days. Nowadays, he is facing problem due to lack of availability of funds because he wants to increase the mobile accessories, which is in demand and costly nowadays. He just began this business and does not have further cash on hand to purchased the desired inventories.

This is the reason ZUBAIDA contacted with Kiva's field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and requested a loan for her son. With the help of loan, he can easily purchase mobile accessories and extra recharge on various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family.

ZUBAIDA would be very thankful to such lenders who take an active part for loan raising.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and extra recharge of networks for her son's mobile shop.

loans.name: Mathokoane Group

texts.en:
Makhathatso is a 74-year-old mother of three children and grandmother of four, aged between 12 and 6 years. She lives alone with her 79-year-old husband.

Makhathatso lives in a traditional hut that is not well ventilated, nor warm in winter. Together with her husband, despite the age, Makhathatso works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her family. She has to wake up very early, around 5am, to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water, and warming the house both for her and her husband. Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demands a lot of her time.

Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high. Winters can get very cold, and often Makhathatso has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and in the worst case, death. In these circumstances, life for people like Makhathatso is very difficult.

Makhathatso has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to purchase clean cook stoves, which will provide her and 12 other people from her village, who are living in similar circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families. It also does not require expensive paraffin and gas, or a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho. This stove can be started with the use of very little readily-available biomass, like dry twigs and dry cow dung, that does not require lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the home.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery, which runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones and a mini LED lamp. It is a life-improving package for these people. This stove saves them time to be with their family, saves energy, eliminates toxic inhalation, and gives them a better lit home to see in the evening while cooking and enables children to do their homework. For more stove info, please check www.africancleanenergy.com.

loans.use: to pay for the ACE cook stove, which will improve her life in terms of health, cost of fuel and time spent collecting firewood.

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Roeung is a 45-year-old widowed woman who is the mother of one child. She lives in a bed-room house located in Kampong Cham province. For the past 25 years, Roeung has grown cassava and also worked as a paid laborer to get more income. Unfortunately, her hard work on her cassava business has been ruined by insect pests. 

Roeung is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for cutting grasses to improve her cassava farm production. This will be her second micro loan with VisionFund and she wisely repaid her previous loan on time. She used her previous loan to expand her farmland. Roeung hopes to sell her produce at a good price so that she can upgrade her family’s living condition in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for cutting grasses to improve her cassava farm production

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two school-going children. She operates a business selling Khangas, which is a women’s wrap cloth, and she also runs a tailoring business. Fatuma sells from her home and door-to-door to neighbors and passersby. She lives with her family in her own house without electricity or running water. Fatuma’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees and her major business challenge is competition. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase bales of Khangas to resell.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas to sell

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: Sambo, who is a 36-year-old farmer, lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is still in school and the other one of whom is too young for school. She has struggled for a living via rice growing for 16 years. She has being growing cassava on a one-half hectare area to make supplemental income. Her rice did not grow well, so she can earn income of only around 8 USD per day and she can save about 4 USD each day to support her family. She has never been with VisionFund; this is her first time. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity of her crop. She hopes to get more income so that she can afford to renovate her old house to improve her family’s living and make it better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase crop productivity.

loans.name: Hurmat

texts.en:
Hurmat is very industrious woman from Tajikistan. She is married and has four adult children. Hurmat always tries for the well-being of her children. For the past 15 years, she has been busy with animal sales and she had a great deal of experience in this field. Hurmat’s working day usually begins early morning at 6 o’clock when she goes to the cowshed to feed her sheep and cows. She rears cows some months and then sells them in a local market, using the profit to buy food and clothing for her children. Hurmat loves her children very much. 

Hurmat is requesting a 5,000 TJS loan to buy an additional 10 cows. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy ten cows

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two school-going children. She operates a business selling Khangas, which is a women’s wrap cloth, and she also runs a business selling food in the open air. Fatuma sells from her home and door-to-door to neighbors and passersby. She lives with her family in her own house without electricity or running water. Fatuma’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees and her major business challenge is competition. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase bales of Khangas to resell.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khangas to sell

loans.name: Navy

texts.en:
Navy is 29 years old. She is a mother of two schoolchildren and a farmer living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. For the past 10 years, Navy has grown cassava and raised pigs to earn a living. She also sells grocery items to get additional income to improve her family’s income. Navy’s business challenges include the decreasing price of cassava and the sickness of her pigs.

Navy is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pig feed for her businesses. This will be her second loan with VisionFund. Navy repaid her previous loan completely. She hopes that her cassava will produce more so she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions and support her children’s studying.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and pig feed

loans.name: Chhunla's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in a rural area of Kampong Cham province, Chhunla is a 27-year-old mother of one child. To make a living, she has been growing rice for 9 years. She can earn more income via selling mushrooms. For a few years, her business did not grow well as the drought affected her crop. Chhunla and her group members are seeking a first loan with VisionFund. As the leader of the group, she will manage her loan portion to buy rice seed, organic pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm in order to produce a good yield. She hopes this year her rice can produce a higher yield so that she can sell it at a higher price, which will enable her to save sufficient capital to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, organic pesticide and fertilizer to support her rice farm in order to produce a good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en: Originally from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Neat is a 34-year-old mother of two schoolchildren. The primary source of her income is from growing cassava. Moreover, she has grown rice to earn more income. These businesses have been conducted by her for 16 years. Her cassava has not grown well so she can’t earn a good income. Neat can afford to buy household supplies to support her living via her past loan; this is her second loan with VisionFund. She leads a group of two in seeking this new loan. As a group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy organic pesticide and fertilizer to increase the crop and she will also use a part of her loan to buy school supplies for her children’s education. She hopes that she can make a good income to improve her standard of living and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide and fertilizer to increase the crop, and to buy school supplies for her children’s education.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is 37 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, and she is the mother of 10 children. To manage her household expenses and to feed the huge population of her children, she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Farzana and both of her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her elder daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work from her, and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Farzana wants to buy a new juki machine for her elder daughter, so that she can contribute to their income by sewing clothes. Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Farzana wants to make some savings so that she can arrange the marriage ceremonies of her daughters. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a juki machine for her daughter so she can also contribute to the monthly income.

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en: Noeurn, 57, is a farmer is living in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She has six children. She has grown rice to support her family for 20 years. She has worked for others for a fee to make more income. The crop has been destroyed by insects and that is the main challenge for her business. After successfully repaying a previous loan, Noeurn will request a new loan with VisionFund. Her family’s living has improved since her past loan. As the leader of two, she is going to take her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland to produce a good yield. She hopes this second loan will enable her to sell it at a higher price than before and thereby allow her to improve her family’s standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farmland to produce a good yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Жительнице района Яван 38 лет ее зовут Сураё. Она замужем и имеет 5 детей. У нее 3 сыновья и 2 дочери. Муж Сураё занимается механиком. Сураё любит животных, и поэтому она занимается животноводством. Сураё занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота всего 10 лет. Она покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Сураё обратилась за кредитом, чтоб расширить свою деятельность. Она считает, что в течение 10 лет набралась опыта и хочет увеличить поголовье скота и расширить деятельность. Сураё за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. Этот кредит поможет ей достичь своей целей и улучшить условий жизни ее семьи.
texts.en:
Surayo is a 38-year-old resident of the Yavan region. She is married and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Her husband works as a mechanic. Surayo loves animals and therefore works in animal husbandry. She has been raising cattle for 10 years, buying young calves and fattening them over a certain amount of time, then reselling them at the cattle market.

Surayo is requesting a loan in order to expand her business. She believes she has gained a lot of experience over the past 10 years and wants to increase her head count of livestock and expand her business. She will use the loan amount to buy a few calves. This loan will help her achieve her goals and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to expand her animal husbandry business by buying calves

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 46-year-old married mother of four children. She has been running her manakish bakery since 2012 and is working hard to support her husband in covering their family's needs. She is very supportive of her husband and well known in her region.

Her income combined with her husband's is covering their family's daily living needs. That's why performing necessary maintenance on her car requires an external financial supporter.

Her acquired loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua will be invested in performing necessary maintenance on her car to keep it in good shape for business and family needs.

She hopes to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance on her car to keep it in good shape for her business and family needs.

loans.name: Tolbert

texts.en:
Tolbert is a 35-year-old married man with one child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has a motorcycle transport business, which he started with the hope of employing himself and looking after his family.

He is facing challenges of bad weather - especially heavy rains that make roads impassable and spoil the motorcycle. Besides that, he is looking forward to buying a car as a way of expanding his business.

He has asked for a loan to help him buy tyres and repair his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy tyres and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza is 33 years old and has one child. She is married. Her child attends school.

Anna Liza is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Anna Liza has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Anna Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Yesenia Adaliza

texts.es: Yesenia es una mujer trabajadora de 37 años de edad que vive en la localidad rural de Huambo, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que ella misma cultiva, Yesenia además se dedica a la elaboración y venta de queso orgánico. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, con lo que espera mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el futuro Yesenia espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Yesenia is a hardworking, 37-year-old woman who lives in the rural town of Huambo, which is located in Arequipa. She makes a living by raising organic cattle. She pays a lot of a attention to the care and food that she gives them, which includes organic alfalfa that she grows herself. Yesenia also makes a living by making and selling organic cheese. She is requesting a microcredit to buy two organic cows that she hopes will improve her income. In the future, Yesenia hopes to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy organic cattle.

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
18 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, ellas  se unieron con la idea de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Shirley, una humilde comerciante quien tiene una despensa en su propia casa, comenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que poco a poco fue creciendo mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su despensa, como ser bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y esforzándose por mejorar.
texts.en:
Eighteen women make up this group, they got together with the idea of improving living conditions for themselves and their loved ones. They belong to the poverty elimination program, and they strive to improve.

Shirley is one of the members, she is a humble seller who has her store in her own home. She comments that she began with a small business, but little by little she has been expanding and improving it. 

She is requesting this loan to stock her store, she will buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, and more. She will then be able to continue selling, endeavoring to improve.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Claudia Domitila

texts.es: Claudia es una mujer trabajadora de 64 años que vive en la localidad rural de Huambo, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella se dedica a trabajos múltiples como peonaje agrícola y cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por alfalfa orgánica que ella misma cultiva, Claudia además se dedica al cultivo de orégano orgánico, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de orégano, es decir para comprar abonos orgánicos y pagar a los trabajadores que le ayudarán en las labores agrícolas. En el futuro Claudia desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida, pero sobre todo desea contar con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Claudia is a hardworking woman aged 64 who lives in the rural community of Huambo which is located in Arequipa. She makes a living from a variety of jobs including agricultural labourer, and organic cattle rearing. She takes great care of the animals, she grows her own organic alfalfa to provide her cattle with food.
Claudia also makes a living by growing organic oregano, hence her request for a microfinance loan to take care of her oregano crop. She wants to buy organic fertilizers and to pay the workers who help her with agricultural tasks.
In future Claudia wants to improve her living conditions, but above all she hopes to remain healthy which is why she is betting on organic farming .

loans.use: take care of her organic oregano crop.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Expedito, es de la ciudad de San Ignacio ellas son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, ellas están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La señora Aurelia es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella es casada, y tiene hijos, por quienes ella lucha y se esfuerza por salir adelante, ella se dedica a la cría vacas y gallinas. Pide este préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de más vacas y gallinas para su respectiva venta a fin de año. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
This is the San Expedito group from the city of San Ignacio. They are united in support of each other, they work together on activities. They feel and they are satisfied with the support of the women's committee program to grow and improve.

Aurelia is one of the members, she is married and has children for whom she strives to get ahead. She works raising cows and chickens for sale. 

She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more cows and chickens that she will sell at the end of the year. She is grateful for this opportunity to improve living conditions for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy cows and chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Las Bellas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Bellas está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, además está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio de su trabajo y lucha.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Laura quien se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas y de todo tipo, comenta que gracias a que tiene buena variedad ya se pudo formar una buena clientela con la cual pudo ayudar a su familia y sus seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, jeans y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Las Bellas group is in its 1st cycle of the Women's Committee Program. In addition, they are in the Poverty Elimination Program, in which all of them want to improve their living conditions through working and fighting.

One of the members is Laura, who sells all types of clothing. She says that thanks to having a good variety, she has been able to establish a good clientele and be able to help her family and her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying various items of clothing to sell, such as t-shirts, shorts, pants, jeans, and more, so that she can continue to sell, as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity that all of them are receiving.

loans.use: to buy different clothes to sell, such as t-shirts, pants, jeans and more.

loans.name: Pacoba Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Pacoba Poty, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la ciudad de Curuguaty, una zona muy alejada de la capital del país, que lucha por poder mejorar su acceso a ciertos servicios básicos.
La Sra. Lidia,  es una de las integrantes, ella se dedica a la venta de queso y animales. Con este trabajo desea que conforme pase el tiempo, y por medio de las reuniones de capacitación vaya mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por salir adelante. 
Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de animales y queso para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y saliendo adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called Pacoba Poty. It is in its 3rd cycle of the Women's Committee Program. They are from the city of Curuguaty, an area that is far from the country's capital, which is fighting to have better access to basic services.

Lidia is one of the members. She sells cheese and animals. With this work, she wants to improve her and loved ones' living conditions over time and through the trainings meetings. She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who is fighting to get ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy animals as well as cheese to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and keep getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise, as well as cheese.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 56 years old. She lives in the municipality of Trinidad, Bohol. Even at her age, she has multiple businesses. She does rice farming, raises hogs, sells prepaid top-ups to mobile subscribers and attends to her sari-sari store. It is common for hard working Filipinos like Vicenta to keep their lives busy since there are limited opportunities there. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, feed, prepaid top-ups, canned food, toiletries, bath soap, detergent and condiments. It is her dream that when she can save enough, she will buy a beautiful house for herself and her husband.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed, prepaid top-up, canned food, toiletries, bath soap, detergent and condiments

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 36 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries items to sell, like rice, foods, canned goods, and beverages.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries items to sell, like rice, foods, canned goods, and beverages.

loans.name: Frelyn

texts.en:
Frelyn is a married woman with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Frelyn is 43 years old.

Frelyn's business is raising pigs in the Philippines. Frelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Frelyn has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Frelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is married, 34 years old, and a mother of 2 children. She has been selling foods inside the school and this became her family's main source of income. 

She wants to expand and engage in other business activity. She joined and gained credit access from GDMPC. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more foods such as candies and fruits to sell in the school.

Cristita's plan for the future is to save more money and to improved the quality of life they have.

loans.use: to buy more foods such as candies and fruits to sell in the school

loans.name: Jersie

texts.en:
Jersie is 56 years old and married with three children. Jersie works very hard to provide for them.

Jersie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Jersie has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, fabric conditioners, soft-drinks, etc.

Jersie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is married with children. He farms as the main source of income and also operates a bar business for additional income. Through these two sources, Daniel's family lacks nothing as he is able to provide for them with the incomes. 

The farming business is at risk, however, due to it being a rainy season as his crops are vulnerable to pests and  diseases. He is requesting money to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his tomato garden to save his crops, attain better yields and thus, a better market price. Given this, nothing would stop him from paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his tomato garden

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman and has been blessed with three children, all of whom attend school. Together with her husband and children, they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mwanatumu has operated a fish selling business for over three years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishability of her stock leading to losses.

With the KES 25,000, Mwanatumu wants to purchase bundles of fish to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old, married and has two children.

Gloria is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies.

Gloria has been fattening pigs for five years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies.

loans.name: Mhay

texts.en:
Mhay is 53 years old and has two children. Mhay is married and one of her children is still in school.

Mhay is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Mhay requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Mhay has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and she has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mhay would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 44 años de edad, ella no cuenta con ningún nivel académico, debido a que eran una familia de escasos recursos económicos, es madre soltera y vive con sus tres hijos de 17, 14 y 11 años de edad.

Maribel, ella vende comida típica en la comunidad desde hace 8 años, en ese momento ella necesitaba tener mejores ingresos para la sostenibilidad de su familia porque su esposo no se encontraba con ella, ahora con el apoyo de sus hijos ella se encuentra en mejores condiciones, pero aparte de eso también realiza el comercio de marisco que sustraen sus hijos de la laguna.
    
Maribel, necesita el préstamo para comprar papas, aceite, sal, entre otros productos para la elaboración de enchiladas, tacos, papas fritas y otros productos que prepara para sus clientes.- Y también para la reparación de equipo de pesca.

Ella tiene como objetivo que sus hijos tengan una estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Maribel is 44 years old and did not finish school because she is from a family with scarce financial resources. She is a single mother and lives together with her three children of 17, 14 and 11 years of age.

Maribel has been selling typical food in her town for eight years. At the moment, she needs to increase her income to sustain her family because her husband is not with her anymore. With the support of her kids, she is now in a better situation. But she also has a business of selling seafood, that her children collect from the lagoon.

Maribel needs this loan to buy potatoes, oil, salt, and similar goods to make enchiladas, tacos, french fries, and so on for her customers, and also to repair fishing gear.

Her goal is also for her children to have stability in her family.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, oil, salt, and similar goods to make enchiladas, tacos, french fries, and so on for her customers.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
El  Sr. Silvino, es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene una despensa y carnicería, con buena clientela porque su negocio es bien surtido. También se dedica a la agricultura tiene más de 1000 plantas de tomate, locote y repollo y tiene una furgoneta donde toda la mañana bien temprano sale a vender sus productos por toda la zona y alrededores.
Comenta que su esposa es docente y se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de semillas para cultivar y así para que no le falte su producto.
texts.en:
Silvino is from the city of Santaní. He has a small grocery store and butcher's shop, which has a good customer base because his business is well stocked. He also makes a living in agriculture. He has more than 1000 tomato, green pepper, and cabbage plants. He also has a truck that he uses to go out early every morning to sell his products throughout the area and its outskirts.

He says that his wife is a teacher and that they work together mutually to to get ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice. He is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in buying seeds to farm so that he won't be short on product.

loans.use: to buy seeds for farming.

loans.name: Brillo De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BRILLO DE LUNA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de herramientas para construcción, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de material escolar, venta de carne de res, venta de comida, venta de ollas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que integra Pro Mujer por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de herramientas para construcción; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres hace treinta años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de palas por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente,  lo comercializará en las ferias de las comunidades Achacachi y Batallas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene ocho hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Brillo de Luna" group began its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch Focal Center. It's comprised of nine members and is led by a board of directors of which Julia is the president. The businesses owned by the members of the association are varied. Among them are the sale of tools for construction, the sale of vegetables, a neighborhood store, the sale of school supplies, the sale of beef, the sale of food, and the sale of pots.

The loan they will obtain will benefit micro enterprises including Julia's business. She joined Pro Mujer through the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling construction tools. She learned this trade from her parents thirty years ago. The loan she will take out will be used to increase her capital, through the purchase of shovels wholesale that she will acquire from wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. Later she will sell them in fairs in the communities of Achacachi and Batallas. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family economically, since she is married and has eight children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she responded that she likes the trainings it offer.

loans.use: to buy shovels wholesale.

loans.name: Sandy Roxana

texts.es:
Sandy es una mujer casada de 37 años de edad, tiene una familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 14 y 17 años, está linda familia vive en una comunidad de Panajachel.

Sandy para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia es comerciante, desde hace 3 años, pero con este ingreso no es suficiente, es por ello que trabaja también en un hotel en el puesto de mantenimiento. 
Sandy afortunadamente cuenta con un terreno que se encuentra ubicada en el centro de su comunidad y desde hace algún tiempo tenía la idea de utilizarlo como  parqueo, pero su dificultad había sido no tener los recursos suficientes para arreglar el terreno y darle un aspecto bonito para que llame la atención de los clientes, a raíz de esta necesidad Sandy solicita un préstamo para poder abrir su parqueo lo más pronto posible.
Su esperanza de vida es comprar más terreno para ir creciendo con este tipo de negocio.
texts.en:
Sandy is 37 years old, married, and has a family of three children between 14 and 17 years old. This beautiful family lives in the town of Panajachel.

To make an income and support her family, Sandy has been a merchant for three years. But since the income is not enough, she also works in a hotel as a maintenance person.

Fortunately, Sandy owns land which is located in the town center and for some time she had the idea to use it as a public parking lot. But her challenge was not having enough resources to prepare the land and make it look beautiful to attract customers.

Because of this reason, Sandy is requesting a loan to be able to open her parking lot as soon as possible.

Her life goal is to buy more land to increase this kind of business.

loans.use: to build a parking lot.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has been selling foods for many years. She's working hard to earn more profit. She wants to be able to sustain and provide for the needs of her only child as well as pay for their daily household expenses. She wants to expand her business and engage in other business activities. Recently, she took a loan to buy foods such as bread and bananacue to sell.

Zenaida wants to use her additional revenue for the renovation of her store.

loans.use: to buy foods such as bread and bananacue to sell.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is a sari-sari store owner who lives in the city of Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has six children, five are adults and one is a school-aged child. Her husband raised them all through farming. Two years ago, with her eagerness to help her husband, she successfully started her own business. Milagros is a 53-year-old woman who dreams of a better means of living. Thus, she wanted to improve her business to help them in their daily needs. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries, coffee, sugar, salt, spices, noodles and canned goods, etc.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, toiletries, coffee, sugar, salt, spices, noodles and canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old and has five children. Josephine is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Josephine is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in pig fattening for 3 years now and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Cheryl has been in this business for 21 years. Cheryl earns additional income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: José Alberto

texts.es: José es un microempresario que reside en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y en su triciclo recorre las coloridas calles de este municipio diariamente, ofreciendo a transeúntes una variedad de bebidas aromáticas, cafés, panes y cigarrillos.  Anteriormente tenía un kiosco escolar pero los propietarios del establecimiento cerraron el colegio y quedó desempleado, en medio de esta situación y con tres hijas a quienes debía ofrecerles bienestar, José emprendió esta actividad con la que ha logrado solventar a su familia.  Con la finalidad de contar con un capital de negocio más amplio, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en ingredientes de sus bebidas; café, manzanilla, canela, hierbabuena entre otras, también en panes, galletas y cigarrillos, que le permitirán producir más cantidades de bebidas y ofertar más variedad. A futuro desea continuar trabajando para costearles los estudios a sus hijas y que tengan un futuro promisorio.
texts.en:
Jose is a micro-entrepreneur who resides in the city of Cartagena de Indias. On his tricycle, he travels the colorful streets of this municipality daily, offering pedestrians a variety of aromatic drinks, coffees, breads and cigarettes.

Previously, he had a school kiosk but the proprietors of the establishment closed the school and Jose became unemployed. In the midst of this situation, and with three daughters to provide for, Jose undertook his present activity, and has managed to support his family.

For the purpose of acquiring more ample business capital, Jose is applying for his first Kiva loan, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in ingredients for his drinks; coffee, camomile, cinnamon, and mint among others. He also sells breads, cookies and cigarettes. This loan will enable him to produce larger quantities of drinks in a greater variety.

In the future, Jose wishes to continue working in order to cover his daughters' studies and to enjoy a promising future.

loans.use: invest in ingredients for the drinks he sells; coffee, chamomile, cinnamon, mint, among others, and also breads, cookies, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal lives in Masindi-Uganda. She is a married mother of three children. She operates a salon business but also sells cosmetics and shoes for extra income. She has a dream of educating her children up to higher levels of learning. She has a vision of expanding her business and serving the people more by owning a modern bridal salon in future.

Racheal is in need of a loan to buy salon equipment like perm rods, a hot combing machine, oils and treatments to sell.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment like perm rods, a hot combing machine, oils and treatments to sell.

loans.name: Twekambe Nyakakonge Group

texts.en: Henry, a member of Twekambe Nyakakonge Group, is a married man aged 30. He is charged with the task of taking care of 3 children who all attend school in Hoima, Uganda. He ventured into the produce business, chiefly buying and selling maize and beans. The income from this business is supplemented by income from operating a retail shop, mainly selling salt and sugar. He desires to expand and develop his business, however, price fluctuation and inadequate capital pose a strong threat to his business. He is seeking credit to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Winifrida

texts.en: Winifrida is aged 50. She is a married, hardworking lady who is tasked with providing the basic needs to 7 children, all of whom attend school in Hoima, Uganda. She deals in produce mostly, buying and selling maize, beans. and other items. She joined the business way back in 2000 after realizing a need to supplement her husband’s income. She dreams of growing and expanding her business as well as educating her children up to a degree level. She is seeking a loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Memsa

texts.en:
Memsa is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married mother of seven children, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Reina Lisseth

texts.es:
Reina, de 36 años de edad, solamente estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a impartir capacitaciones en la zona donde ellos viven, tienen 2 hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad y en su casa viven sus padres, sus hermanos y sus sobrinos.

Reina, se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, pero además les colabora a los jóvenes de la comunidad en las tareas de la escuela, porque posee una computadora que compró con mucho esfuerzo, pero actualmente se encuentra dañada y es por eso que está solicitando ayuda.

Reina, está solicitando el préstamo para comprar una fotocopiadora y una computadora, porque este empleo le genera un buen ingreso, el cual le sirve para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.- Reina, aparte de ese trabajo, también se dedica a impartir capacitaciones gratuitas a los jóvenes que son de escasos recursos económicos.

Ella sueña con tener su propio lugar para impartir clases, porque existen jóvenes que no tienen posibilidades y este es un medio de apoyo hacia la juventud.
texts.en:
Reina is 36 years old. She only went to school until high school. She is in a common law marriage. Her partner works providing trainings in the area in which they live. They have 2 children, 1 and 3 years old, and live with her parents, siblings, nieces and nephews. Reina works taking care of the home, but she also helps the neighborhood children with their homework, since she has a computer that she obtained through great effort. However, it's currently broken, which is why she is seeking help.

Reina seeks this loan to buy a photocopier and a computer, because her works generates good income, which serves to meet the needs of her family. She also provides free training to children with limited economic resources. She dreams of having her own place to give classes, because there are young people with no future, and this is a way of supporting youth.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier and a computer.

loans.name: Louis

texts.en:
Louis is a single woman. She is the mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity.

For the past nine years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces a major challenge of competition from other operators in her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Mercedes De La Concepcion

texts.es: Mercedes de la concepcion, mayor de edad soltera con dos hijos aún bajo su tutela originaria de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, es una microempresaria administradora y propietaria de sus propios negocios los cuales consisten en la compra  venta de ropa nueva como: trajes de niños, camisetas, pantalones, blusas, trajes de damas, calcetines entre otros mas, el cual lo realiza de forma ambulante y también en su casa de habitación ya se por encargo, mercedes se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable con muchos deseos de superación personal tiene clientes  fijos como al credito los cuales recupera  quincenal o mensualmente, inicia este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el deseo de mejorar  los ingresos en su hogar, al verse sola y madre soltera tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ha realizado  durante  tres años  en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sus sueños es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio. mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos  lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales desde muy temprano ella se levanta a abrir su venta para empezar a vender y poder sacar adelante a  su familia .mercedes  ha venido poco a poco mejorando su negocio, No es primer crédito con león 2000 es cliente número uno   el objetivo de este crédito es para poder comprar más mercadería como;trajes de niños, dama, ropa interior etc.
texts.en:
Mercedes de la Concepción, is a single adult woman with two children still in her care. She is originally from Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. She is a small businesswoman, manager and owner of her own businesses, which consist of buying new clothing, such as children's dresses and suits, tee shirts, pants, blouses, women's dresses and suits, socks, etc., which she does door to door and also from her home through orders.

Mercedes is known for being a very hard-working and responsible woman with a strong desire to improve herself. She has regular customers who buy on credit, and she collects from them every two weeks or monthly. She started the business with her own funds because of the need to work and the desire to improve the income coming in to the home. Upon finding herself alone and a single mother, she made a committment to get ahead. With the effort and the constant work she has put in for three years, she has shown her responsibility to pay correctly and on time.

One of her dreams is to be able to have a big business, to improve her home and for her children to become good professionals. She gets up very early to open her sales so she can start to sell and be able to help her family get ahead. Mercedes has been improving her business little by little. This is not her first loan with León 2000, she is our number one customer. The goal of this loan is to be able to buy more merchandise, such as suits for children, women, undergarments, etc.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing styles for children, women and men.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 47 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales ninguno dependen de ella.

Zoila, se dedica a la crianza de pollos para venderlos ya procesados, es decir ya embolsados y divididos por libra, también se dedica a cultivar café y de estas actividades percibe un buen ingreso, ella creció en una familia que desde pequeña se dedicó a los trabajos agrícolas y de esta manera ella sigue trabajando en fincas de café.

El crédito lo solicita para sembrar café y para aplicar los abonos y fertilizantes que estos requieren.
