Su sueño es tener una finca muy cuidada y obtener una buena cosecha de café y tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 74, went to school through the third grade. She is married and has four children; none of them are dependent upon Zoila. She raises chickens to sell already processed, which means already bagged and separated by the pound. She also grows coffee. It is from these business activities that she gets a good income. She grew up in a family that, every since she was little, devoted itself to agriculture work. In this way she continues working on coffee farms.

She is requesting the loan to plant coffee and to apply the compost and fertilizers that the crop requires.

Her dream is to have a very well cared for farm, to get a good coffee harvest, and to have a house in better condition for herself and her family.

loans.use: to plant coffee and to apply the compost and fertilizers that the crop needs.

loans.name: Mkonga Road Group

texts.en:
Donatha, who is in her early 40's, is a single mother with three kids. One of her kids is still in school, and the others are grown up. She has been running a food business commonly known as mama lishe for two years now. She works from 5 a.m. until 4 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Donatha's third loan form Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her food stock and serve more people. She paid back her loan very well, and she used the profits to pay school fees for her child, repay the loan, reinvest in her business and cover household expenses. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group.

She will use this loan to increase her mama lishe stock to meet her customers' demands. She dreams of opening mama lishe in different places. Donatha will share this loan with her loan group, Mkonga Road, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mama lishe (food vending business) stock to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas is 58 years old and married. He has six grown children. His main source of living is from raising hogs. Aside from hog raising, he also engages in vegetable farming. He grows and sells vegetables to supplement his income. He would like to improve the yield of his farm, but he has insufficient capital to expand his project.

Nicolas decided to join CEVI to access loans to boost his livelihood. He would like to obtain a loan to buy fertilizers and feed for the pig. With these, he could raise quality hogs and slowly augment his earnings.

He is hoping that someday he will become successful.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and feed for the pig

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar con 37 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo,vive en casa propia de material rústico,en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, departamento de Cajamarca, país Perú, en una zona rural. Oscar cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los habitantes de la localidad. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Oscar se dedica al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas de café variedad catimor; plantación tiene 3 y 4 años de edad en primer y segundo año de producción. Cultivo se desarrolla en terreno propio. Oscar cuenta con amplia experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café ya que sus padres toda la vida han cultivado café variedad nacional; con estos ingresos han sido criados y desde muy niños han cultivado este plantación. Ahora por cuestiones de enfermedades y plagas han renovado plantación variedad catimor que es mucho más resistente a enfermedades. Adicionalmente Oscar se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros), venta lo realiza los días domingos.El destino del crédito será para el mantenimiento de 1 hectárea de café de las 2 hectáreas con las que cuenta; asegurando campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Oscar es socio recurrente en nuestra institución, Edpyme Alternativa. Oscar firmará con su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old, in a relationship, and lives together with his spouse and his youngest son. He lives in his own house made of basic materials in the district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, in a rural area of Peru.

Oscar has a very good reputation among the inhabitants of his area - both personally and professionally. The people from this place mainly make a living in agriculture, trade and cattle raising.

Oscar is earning a living by growing coffee. By now he owns 2 hectares of coffee, growing the Catimor variety. His cultivations are three and four years old and are in the first and second year of production. He is growing this on his own land.

Oscar has a wide experience in the trade of growing coffee because his parents have been growing coffee of the national variety all of their lives. Through this income the have been raised and since they were little they were growing coffee. Now, with the issue of diseases and pests, they have renewed the farm with the Catimor variety, which is much more resistant to diseases.

Additionally, Oscar is earning a living by growing and selling small animals (chicken, guinea pigs, pigs and more). He is selling them on Sundays.

This loan is for performing maintenance on one of his two hectares of coffee, in order to ensure 2016's harvest. This will reflect in a bigger volume of sales, so he will have more income to be able to increase his and his family's quality of life.

Oscar is a recurrent member of our institution, Edpyme Alternativa. Oscar will sign with his spouse.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on one of his two hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Narcisa works hard to support her family.

She has a rug-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Narcisa is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, etc. for her rug-making business.

Narcisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer de sesenta años de edad que no le tiene miedo al trabajo duro, ella desde muy pequeña aprendió como era el trabajo en el campo con los animales. En la actualidad tiene sus propias vacas, a las cuales ordeña y saca productos derivados de la leche, también tiene una pequeña hortalizada en la cual produce verduras. Ella vive una zona alejada de la ciudad, no obstante MiCrédito y Kiva han logrado ya beneficiarle con un financiamiento, por eso ella está muy agradecida y confía fielmente en ambas organizaciones. 
Tuvo tan buena experiencia y ganancias con el primer préstamo, que ha vuelto a solicitar uno, esta vez para ocuparlo en compra de comida y vitaminas para el ganado, material para reforzar los cercos y compra de una cerdos pequeños que planea criarlos y engórdalos para luego venderlos a un buen precio. Ella es una mujer muy dinámica, en un futuro desea poder comprar más tierra para así producir más, y crecer como productora.
texts.en:
Luisa is a 60 year old woman who is not afraid of hard work.  Since she was very young, she learned how to do work in the field with the animals.  Now, she has her own cattle, which she milks and makes various products from the milk.  She also has a small garden that produces vegetables.  She lives in an area far from the city.  Nonetheless, MiCrédito and Kiva have been able to benefit her financially.  She is very grateful and trusts both organizations.

She had a good experiences and earnings with the first loan, and now she has returned to request another one.  This time to buy food and vitamins for the cattle, material to reinforce the fences, and to buy small pigs that she plans to raise and fatten to later sell at a good price.  She is a dynamic woman.  In the future she wishes to be able to buy more land to produce more and grow as a producer.

loans.use: To buy food and vitamins for the cattle, material to reinforce the fences, and to buy some small pigs.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 48 years old and married with one child. Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Amalia has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, sugar, soft-drinks, juice, coffee, shampoo, etc.

In the future, Amalia would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more item to sell in her general store

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is very industrious woman residing in the town of Pilar, Bohol. She is a 62-year-old married woman with six children. One of her children is still attending school. She prepares and sells snack food like puto (steam rice), suman (glutinous rice cooked in coconut milk mixed with sugar), and bibingka (rice cake). In addition to food vending, she also farms and grows rice.

She is applying for a loan to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, leavening agent, and glutinous rice, and farm supplies like fertilizers.

Antonina is applying for a Kiva loan from Kiva's field partner, CEVI, because she has to purchase more ingredients and farm supplements. In this way, she will be able to cope with demand. She can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill future needs as well.

Antonina is very thankful to Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, leavening agent, and glutinous rice, and farm supplies like fertilizers.

loans.name: San Juan Bosco Group

texts.es:
El grupo se formó en Ciudad del Este, están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de sus seres queridos, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Pabla, quien vende ropas de todo tipo, ella a través de su lucha y trabajo está proponiéndose mejorar su calidad y es por eso que pone todo de sí. Ella comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus ropas, y es por ello que le está yendo muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, camisas, jeans, blusas, vestidos, pantalones y otras prendas, para poder surtirse y poder ofrecer una buena cantidad de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is formed in Ciudad del Este (City of the East).  They are putting in their best effort to be able to improve their life conditions and that of their loved ones.  They are part of the program to eliminate poverty, striving to grow and get better.

One of the members is la Señora Pabla, who sells clothing of all types.  Through her struggles and work, she is aiming to improve her quality and that is why she is giving it her all.  She comments that she has good customers who always buy their clothes from her, and it is because of them that she is doing very well.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses, dresses, pants, and other clothing to be able to stock up and be able to offer a good quantity of products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shirts, jeans, blouses, dresses, pants, and other clothing to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a thirty-eight year old widow with three children living in Masindi, Uganda. She sells drinks like milk and sodas as her major business. She is a very ambitious woman who started her business with an aim of sustaining her family as a widow. She hopes to open up another branch to maximize profits.

She is grateful to Kiva funders for the previous loan which helped her in the expansion of her business. Betty intends to use the loan to buy more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is single. He is in the produce business. He has been able to start up a poultry project out of the savings from the first business. Both businesses are doing great. Moses is a hardworking man and always wants to use opportunities to move to higher levels. He now wants to add rice and ground nuts to his business to attract more customers, and thus increase his income levels. However, at the moment he lacks the money to do so. He is requesting money to buy rice and ground nuts for selling and will gladly pay back.

loans.use: to buy rice and ground nuts for selling.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is the age of 43. She is a young and energetic woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been running a garments shop in a nearby market for many years and cherishes their children. Her father-in-law started the garments business and now her husband is looking after the current affairs of the garments shop.

The shop is situated in the garments market and there are a lot of competitors in the market. Due to this competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to pay a profitable price. This competition is the cause of low sales and more effort as well. Her husband has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of garments so that he can maintain the rate of sales.

Shahida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy fresh stock of delightful colored garments. Shahida hopes that her husband will purchase garments according to his desire at the right time so that he can cope with the market competition and can grow his income as well.

Shahida thanks Kiva and its field partner for this support.

loans.use: to buy fresh stock of delightful colored garments for her husband's garments store.

loans.name: Sreythea

texts.en:
Originally from the Kandal province, Sreythea is 32 years old and has a young child. To make a living, she has grown rice and she has worked at a garment factory to supplement her income. She has been involved in her job for 6 years. Her crop yield has been decreasing and she can only save around 5 USD each day after expenses.

Sreythea has been with VisionFund for one cycle already and she repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loan helped her to have decent household supplies to support her lifestyle better than before. She is going to use the new loan to buy a decent motorcycle to get to work on time and to purchase more fertilizer to grow her rice. She hopes that this year the crop yields will be higher so that she can sell the rice at a higher price which will enable her to save sufficient income to support her business next year.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorcycle to get to work on time and to purchase more fertilizer to grow her rice so that she can earn more income to support her lifestyle.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is married with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is electricity.

For the past five years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a widowed mother with two children . She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling to local neighbors. She faces major challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding to improve her living standards.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Loma Buenavista Group

texts.es:
El grupo Loma Buenavista se formó en una comunidad mazahua, cuya mayor celebración se realiza el 15 de septiembre, mismo día del Inicio de la Independencia de México. Sin embargo, para los habitantes también es importante adorar y dar gracias a la Virgen de Dolores. En este día, la iglesia principal y las capillas se llenan de asistentes, después de escuchar misa, las personas se reúnen para compartir sus alimentos y disfrutar un momento juntos.
Eulalia es integrante y líder del grupo de préstamo, desde hace 15 años se dedica a criar pollos, actividad que también practicaban sus padres y que es muy común entre los habitantes del pueblo ya que el campo ofrece un vasto espacio para los animales. 
Esta pequeña actividad permitió a Eulalia apoyar a Carlos, su esposo, con los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus 7 hijos. A pesar de que actualmente ya sólo 3 niños dependen económicamente de la pareja, Eulalia aún continúa esforzándose por hacer crecer su negocio de venta de pollos. 
Con esa intención, hace 5 años solicitó un préstamo a VFMéxico que le ha ayudado a invertir mayor capital y tener más ganancias. Gracias a esto, Eulalia pudo mejorar su casa e incluso pudo liquidar algunas deudas pendientes. Tal como el primer préstamo, Eulalia utilizará el dinero para comprar más pollos ya que sigue trabajando para hacer su sueño realidad: tener una granja con mayor variedad de animales y abrir una pequeña tienda de abarrotes. 
“Todo es cuestión de seguir activos y aprovechar bien el crédito” comenta Eulalia al hablar acerca del uso responsable del préstamo. “Muchas veces quieres invertir, pero uno sólo no puede juntarlo todo, siempre terminas usando los ahorros para otra cosa, es cuando el crédito se vuelve últil”.

Los demás integrantes son Juan quien invertirá en cerdos; Bonifacia, Beatriz, Carlos, Fernando y Rosario, en borregos y 
Tomasa, en borregos y pollos.

*La imagen se capturó en el centro del municipio donde se encuentran la plazoleta, el quiosco, una iglesia católica y el palacio de gobierno. Eulalia es quien viste la chamarra morada.
texts.en:
The Loma Buenavista group was formed in a Mazahua community. Its biggest celebration is on September 15th, the same day as the the Independence of Mexico. However, it is also important to the inhabitants to adore and give thanks to the Virgen de Dolores. On this day the main church and the chapels are filled with attendants. After hearing the mass, the people get together to share their food and enjoy some time together.

Eulalia is a member and leader of the communal bank. She has been raising chickens for 15 years. Her parents also engaged in this business activity. It is very common among the inhabitants of the village because the country offers a vast space for the animals. This small business activity allowed Eulalia to support her husband, Carlos, with the household expenses and to get her seven children ahead.

Even though only three of her children are now financially dependent upon the couple, Eulalia still continues putting forth great effort to make her business of selling chickens grow. It was with this intention that she requested a loan from VFMéxico five years ago. The loan has helped her to invest more capital and to have more earnings. Thanks to this, Eulalia was able to improve her house. She was also able to repay some pending debts.

Just as she did with her first loan, Eulalia will use the money to buy more chickens because she continues working to make her dream come true. Her dream is to have a farm with a greater variety of animals and to open a small grocery store. "It is all a question of continuing with assets and taking good advantage of the loan," Eulalia says upon talking about the responsible use of the loan. "Many times you want to invest, but one person alone is not able to get everything together. You always end up using your savings for something else. That is when the loan becomes useful again."

The other members are Juan, who will buy pigs; Bonifacia, Beatriz, Carlos, Fernando, and Rosario, who will buy sheep; and Tomasa, who will buy sheep and chickens.

* The photo was taken in the municipal center where there is a small square, the kiosk, a Catholic church, and the government palace. Eulalia is the one wearing a purple jacket.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a 51-year-old woman who lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is married and has six children, four adults and two school-aged children. Rosita earns a living by doing a hog raising business. It is the business that helps her pay school fees for her children. Thus, she wants to improve this business for their future needs, but to raise pigs she needs a bigger capital to finance for feed.

That is why she is in need of a loan to sustain feed for her sow, and piglets as well. Additionally, Rosita aims in the future to have her own capital to run this business.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Teok

texts.en:
Originally from Battambang province, Teok is 49 years old and she has six dependent children. Nowadays, she needs to support four children, two of whom are still in school.

Teok has grown cassava for 12 years to earn income for her family. She can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She lacks the capital to buy fertilizer for her cassava farm, and this is her main challenge.

This is Teok's fourth loan and she is seeking a new loan with VisionFund. The past loans helped her to have better house to live in. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to support her farming and gain a better yield than last year. She hopes that she can get more yields from her farm to upgrade her family’s standard of living and support her children’s education as well.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees to support her farming and gain good yields, so that she is able to earn more income to upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.name: Neliza

texts.en:
Neliza is a married woman with eight children. She is 57 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Neliza is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell tobacco business in the Philippines. She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell to her customers.

Neliza has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anneve

texts.fr: Anneve a 49 ans. Elle a un enfant et gère une petite boutique chez elle ou elle vend des produits de première nécessité. Elle demande un microcrédit afin d'augmenter son stock. A l'avenir, elle espère augmenter ses revenus, et ainsi pouvoir épargner davantage pour l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Anneve is 49 years old and has one child.

She runs a small shop from her home where she sells basic goods. She is seeking this micro-loan in order to increase her stock.

In the future, she hopes to increase her earnings so that she can save for her child's education.

loans.use: to buy cases of concentrated milk and bags of yellow sugar.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada resides in Bien Unido, Bohol. She is 57 years old and a sari-sari (variety) store owner in her place. She sells grocery items like sachets of shampoo, hair conditioner, seasonings, canned food, condiments, detergent and biscuits.

She is asking for a loan to buy salt, seasoning, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk. These items sell on a daily basis. By buying in bulk, she can be assured of higher earnings.

Diosdada plans to manage her business well so she can further expand, save and reinvest in the same business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, seasonings, canned food, biscuits, chips, candies, eggs, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste and milk.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
Pilar is 50 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Pilar is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Pilar has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en:
A local resident living in a bedroom house in Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Pheap is 31 years old and a mother of two dependent children who are under the age of school. Rice farming is the primary source of her family’s income. Moreover, she can get additional income via working as a paid laborer. She earns income of about 5 USD per day, because of her crop has been destroyed by drought.

Pheap has never been with VisionFund and she will manage her loan to renovate her old house more comfortably and she will use a part of her loan to buy fertilizer to support on her family’s business. She hopes to upgrade her family’s living to better than before.

loans.use: to renovate her old house and to buy fertilizer to support her family’s business.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sopha's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Kampong Cham province, Sopha is a 45-year-old and a mother of two children. Rice farming is the main source of her family’s income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working at a garment factory. She has been involved in her job for 25 years.

Destroying by insects on her rice is the main challenge in her family’s business. She can earn income of about $12USD per day. After expenses, she is able to save around $6USD each day. She has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, and she repaid her past loans successfully. Sopha has a better house to live in from her previous loans.

She leads a group of three; she will manage her loan portion in order to buy fertilizer for supporting her farmland to produce good outputs. She hopes to get additional income to upgrade her living conditions next year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for supporting her farmland to produce good outputs.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 37-year-old, married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has businesses of motorcycle transport and farming, growing food crops and rearing pigs. He has been in these businesses since 15 years ago with a hope of employing himself.

He has a vision of educating all his children to higher levels of learning and buying more land where he can construct a good residential house.

Robert needs a loan to buy three pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy three pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is the age of 36 and living along with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She runs a small business at home with the help of her husband. Her practice is to paste sequins, pearls and precious stones over shawls and she has been selling them in the market. She wants to grow her production, and for this is reason she wants to buy additional raw materials.

Therefore, Khalida has requested a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will utilize the amount to purchase sequins, gums, pearls and shawls to increase her business. Her wish is to provide better education and medical facilities to her children.

Khalida is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy sequins, gums, pearls and shawls to increase her handicraft production.

loans.name: Magdala

texts.fr: Magdala a 34 ans. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle fait le commerce de produits alimentaires depuis bientôt cinq ans. Elle travaille corps et âmes pour améliorer sa situation de vie. Elle cherche à trouver un prêt pour acheter un stock de céréales. A l’avenir, elle espère gagner assez de revenus pour pouvoir épargner un peu d’argent.
texts.en:
Magdala is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of one child.

She has worked selling food products for almost five years now. She works with her body and spirit to improve her living situation.

She is seeking this loan to buy cereals.

In the future, she hopes to earn enough to be able to save a little money.

loans.use: to buy sacs of cereals and sugar.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
For Estrella and her husband Jully, the sea is a marvelous source of their family’s livelihood. It provides lots of benefits to the people in their community in Calumpang, General Santos City. Estrella operates three big fishing boats, and her husband leads ten helper-fishermen. Estrella manages the finances, deals with buyers, pays the helper-fishermen, and oversees the maintenance of their boats. There are times when their neighbors rent the boats from them. They earn extra income from this. Their livelihood provides for the usual needs and education of their two children in high school and elementary.

As Estrella aspires to save more for the future and college education of her children, she plans to buy another fishing boat, which she can rent out to the neighborhood. She needs PHP 60,000 for this. She also intends to allot some amount for additional fishing nets, hooks and rolls of nylon. She hopes to increase her income in this way. It will ensure the continuity of her business and livelihood of her helper-fishermen.

Estrella dreams to see her children with college diplomas and stable careers in the future. She is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy another fishing boat, additional fishing nets, hooks and rolls of nylon.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
Donika and her blind husband have been in the livestock practice for a very long time. They have established a rural activity with some equipment that are needed in the practice, such as machines for plowing the soil, grinding corn and other kernels to make food for the animals and poultry, and also some other equipment for feeding and milking.

Donika will use this loan to add some calves, raise them and then sell them.

loans.use: to buy calves, raise and sell them.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is a 43-year-old lady, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother; she wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities for her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her three sons have been driving auto rickshaws for many years; their income is insufficient to feed the entire family. One of her sons has to maintain the auto rickshaw, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem.

Therefore, Mumtaz has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son will be able to fix the auto rickshaw. She hopes that she will be able to make enough savings until the time of their marriages. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to fix her son's auto rickshaw so he can contribute in monthly income.

loans.name: Famille Koko Group

texts.fr: Les revenus du crédit précédent du groupe KOKO a permis à la famille de supporter les frais scolaires, d'améliorer leur habitation et d'agrandir leur activité. Clément est caféiculteur et sollicite un second crédit afin de lui éviter de vendre en gros son café (fruit) non encore mature mais plutôt d'attendre jusqu'à la récolte. Il est accompagné sur photo par son épouse Asifiwe.
texts.en:
The earnings from the previous loan that the Koko group received allowed the family to cover school fees, improve their home, and expand their work.

Clément is a coffee farmer and is seeking this second loan so that he can wait to sell his coffee beans until the harvest, rather than having to sell them at wholesale before they are matured.

He is joined in the photo by his wife Asifiwe.

loans.use: to maintain a field.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 23-year-old single lady. She is a graduated university student who has provided education services from her parents' house since 2009, and is working hard to develop her career in the future. Zeinab is well known in her region for her special educating talents and is seeking to expand them in the region.

She is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car that will help he provide education services outside of her region. She is willing to open a special tutoring center in the future.

loans.use: to buy a car that will help her provide education services outside of her region.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Yasmin is an amazing mother who lives in small village near Hebron City. She has two children and she is working hard to ensure a good life for them and that they do not need anything. Yasmin’s husband works as taxi driver, but he cannot cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can, and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Yasmin started her business five years ago. She sews clothes to sell. After she felt that she had a good experience in this business, she decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to help her to buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics to increase her income. She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics to increase her income.

loans.name: Famille Kwizera Group

texts.fr: De son premier crédit, Christophe a payé la main d'œuvre pour l'entretien et la récolte. Les revenus produits ont été orientés dans le paiement des frais scolaires des enfants et l'achat d'un lopin de terre. Le second crédit servira dans le paillage et le sarclage de son champ. Il est accompagné sur photo par sa sœur Consolata, membre du groupe KWIZERA.
texts.en:
From his first loan, Christophe paid a work hand to maintain and harvest [a field]. The earnings that resulted were used to cover his children's school fees and to buy a plot of land.

This second loan will be used to pay for the weeding and mulching of his field.

Christophe is joined in the photo by his sister Consolata, the other member of the Kwizera group.

loans.use: to weed and mulch a coffee [field].

loans.name: Eng

texts.en:
Eng, 32, is a farmer living in a rural area of Siem Reap province. Nowadays, she grows rice on one hectare and works for others for a fee to support her livelihood. Unfortunately, her crop produces lower outputs for her as the farm is always being flooded by heavy rain. She can earn income of about 9 USD per day and she can save around 3 USD each day after expenses.

Eng has been with VisionFund for three loans already and has paid back her past loans completely. With the previous loans, she can afford to support her living better. She is applying for a new loan in order to buy cows to support her rice farm to produce more yield for her family. She hopes that her fourth loan will help her and her family to earn more income to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows to support her rice farm and produce more yield for her family.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Mazin

texts.en:
Mazin is a 25-year-old, single man from Deir Al Balah city. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Mazin works in the public sector, and he also has a workshop for automotive paint in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the bad condition in Gaza directly affects every small business.

Mazin took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy paint for his workshop. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to expand the workshop.

loans.use: to buy paint  for his workshop.

loans.name: San José Barrio Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy apacible del Estado de México se encuentra un grupo integrado por personas muy alegres y trabajadoras quienes aún preservan su lengua de origen, es decir, la mazahua. Conservan, igualmente, tradiciones y expresiones culturales; gran parte de su población se dedica a la cría de animales, sobre todo, ovejas, cerdos, pollos y gallos. Huelga decir que sienten un aprecio profundo por la tierra que les da entre otros beneficios el valioso maíz. 
   Doña Lety, como le dicen de cariño a Leticia, es una mujer trabajadora quien siempre tiene una sonrisa para brindar. Toda su vida ha sentido un fuerte aprecio por el campo, prueba de ello es que decidió iniciar con la cría de animales debido a que cuenta con un terreno donde cultiva maíz. El sobrante del producto junto con el zacate lo aprovecha como alimento para los animales por lo que encontró la mejor manera de sacarle provecho a sus dos actividades.
   "Mientras más pesen mi animales mejores son mis ganancias" comentó Lety a quien le encanta cerciorarse del desarrollo óptimo de cada cría. En algunas épocas del año los cuidados deben ser más delicados ya que muchos ejemplares pueden enfermar e incluso llegar a morir. Sin embargo sabe que con base en el trabajo arduo puede superar cualquier reto que se le presente; y ahora, con sus ganancias, tiene una casa digna donde vive con su familia. Uno de sus sueños es aumentar su producción para mantener su segunda actividad y así tener los medios para solventar sus gastos.
   Ella de igual forma está muy agradecida con VF México porque con su ayuda ha podido adquirir pollos, pavos y cerdos en mayor cantidad. Actualmente tiene cinco cerdos, más de 20 aves de corral, y con este préstamo planea comprar el alimento especial que necesita su ganado para crecer en forma.
   Las otras integrantes del grupo son: Margarita quien invertirá en botanas; Martha, Jacinto, Olivia, Josefina, Gabriela y Maricruz, en cerdos; Adriana, en pan; Erika y María Martha, en ovejas; Isabel, en abarrotes y María Luisa, en ropa.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Lety es quien viste el suéter rosa y cuida de una niña.
texts.en:
In a very quiet community in the State of México there is a group made up of very happy and hard-working people who still preserve their native language, which is Mazahua. They also have kept their traditions and cultural expression. The greater part of the population work raising animals mainly sheep, pigs, chickens and roosters. It goes without saying that they feel a profound appreciation for the earth which gives them their precious corn amongst other benefits.

Lety, as people lovingly call Leticia, is a hard-working woman who is always ready with a smile. She has had a strong appreciation for the countryside, proof of which she decided to start raising animals as she had some land where she grows corn. She takes advantage of the remains of her product together with grass as feed for her animals as she finds it the best way to take advantage of the two activities.

"The more my animals weigh the higher my profits" commented Lety who loves to make sure of the maximum development of each animal. At certain times of the year the care must be more dedicated as many animals can get sick, even dying. However she knows that from her foundation of hard work she can overcome any challenge that comes along and now with her profits she has a dignified house to live in with her family. One of her dreams is to augment her production to maintain her second business and thus having the means to pay her expenses.

At the same time she is very grateful to VF México as with their help she has been able to acquire chickens, turkeys and pigs in greater quantities. At present she has five pigs, 20 poultry and with this loan she plans to buy special feed that she needs for her livestock to grow to form.

The other members of the group are: Margarita who will invest in snacks; Martha, Jacinto, Olivia, Josefina, Gabriela and Maricruz, in pigs; Adriana, in bread; Erika and María Martha, in sheep; Isabel, in groceries and María Luisa, in clothing.

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Lety is wearing the red sweater holding a girl.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: San Pedro El Alto, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Famille Lulibulira Group

texts.fr: Orienté dans l'entretien du café, les revenus produits par le précédent crédit ont aidé dans la scolarisation des enfants, l'alimentation et l'élevage de chèvres. Durant ce crédit, la famille  LULIBULIRA a été endeuillé par la mort du père de Jean. Ceci a occasionné la prise en charge de certaines dépenses liées aux soins médicaux du défunt; ce qui a fait chancelé le remboursement de la dernière tranche du crédit. Cependant avec le crédit sollicité actuellement, Jean et son épouse Babwiriza l'utiliseront dans le taillage, sarclage et paillage de leur café.
texts.en:
Oriented with coffee farming, the earnings from the previous loan helped Jean cover his children's school fees, and feeding and raising goats. During that loan [period], the Lulibulira family was overshadowed with the death of Jean's father. Jean was tasked with covering some of his father's medical costs, and this interrupted his repayments on the loan.

This current loan that Jean and his wife Babwiriza are seeking will be used to cover the weeding, pruning, and mulching their coffee.

loans.use: to weed, prune, and mulch coffee.

loans.name: Famille Samunane Group

texts.fr: Lors de son premier crédit, Gérance a entretenu son champ et dont les résultats l'ont conséquemment aidé dans la scolarisation des enfants et l'alimentation. Comme obstacle, il nous signifie que le prix du café a baissé, ce qui a occasionné un léger retard dans le remboursement de la dernière tranche. Ils forment le groupe SAMUNANE avec sa mère Rose.
texts.en:
With her first loan, Gérance farmed her field which resulted in her being able to help feed and school her children.

She faced a slight delay with the final repayment on that loan because of a drop in the coffee price.

She forms the Samunane group with her mother Rose.

loans.use: to pay a work hand to mulch.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
In the photo is Richard with the UGAFODE staff member in charge of his loan (right to left). Richard is a repeat borrower of Nakasero branch. This is his second cycle with UGAFODE Microfinance.

He is a resident of Kanyanya and is married with five children; all of them go to school. He is a motorcycle driver, a business that has enabled him to look after his wife, children and siblings. His income is over-stretched and he feels that if he gets a second motorcycle, he will be a able to increase his income. He will use the loan to buy another motorcycle that he will hire out at a fee. He is a hardworking and resilient man.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es: Martha es una modista reconocida en el sector donde residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico, esta actividad la aprendió de su madre y decidió dedicarse a ella, porque le permitía estar en su vivienda al frente de la crianza de sus hijos.  Ella cuenta con 10 años en esta labor, ofreciendo todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros sobre medida y como estamos próximos a la mejor temporada del año, puesto que en las fiestas decembrinas su producción se incrementa, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para comprar telas, hilos, botones, cremalleras y toda serie de accesorios que necesite con la finalidad de manejar un stock que le permita realizar sus trabajos sin interrupciones y entregar sus pedidos en los tiempos estipulados. Además esta inversión permitirá que sus compras se realicen en una temporada de precios más bajos y así pueda tener mayores utilidades.  Su meta a futuro es tener un local y continuar ayudando a su cónyuge con los gastos en el hogar.
texts.en:
Martha is a well-known designer in the area where she lives, a neighborhood in the town of Barranquilla, which is located in the Atlántico department. She learned this work from her mother and decided to do it herself because it allowed her to be at home to care for her children. She has done this work for ten years. She offers all types of clothing for women and men made to measure.

Since it is close to the December holidays, her production is increasing, and she is requesting a Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. This is her first loan, and she will use it to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other types of accessories she needs so that she has a stock that allows her to do her work without interruption and complete her orders on time. This investment will allow allow her to make her purchases during a time when prices are lower so that she can earn more profits.

Her goal for the future is to have a store and to continue helping her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, and other types of accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, yarns and fabrics.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a rice farmer from the community of Trinidad in the province of Bohol. She has been farming rice for fifteen years. This livelihood is responsible for supporting her two children who are already adults. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crops healthy and pesticides to ward off pests and diseases. She hope that through these farm inputs she can harvest more than before. Her income will be for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Katherine Paola

texts.es: Katherine es una emprendedora joven de 24 años que con unos ahorros inició la comercialización de productos de uso personal, ella comenzó con una cantidad de productos moderados, sin embargo en la medida que su clientela se fue incrementando decidió afiliarse a varias empresas de catálogos para incrementar sus ventas.  Ella es madre de dos hijas menores de edad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que este no interfiere con sus deberes en el hogar, por el contrario les beneficia en los gastos del hogar.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en productos de uso personal; perfumes, colonias, cremas y demás encargos de sus clientes. Con esta inversión proyecta que sus ventas se incrementaran y podrá apoyar a sus dos hijas en sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Katherine is an enterprising young woman, age 24, who started a business selling products for personal use with some savings she had. She started with a moderate supply of products; however, as the number of her clients grew, she decided to parnter with several catalog companies to increase her sales.

She is the mother of two daughters who are still young, and what she likes most about her work is that it doesn't interfere with her duties at home. Quite the opposite, it helps with the household expenses.

She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in products for personal use - perfumes, colognes, creams and other items her customers order. With this investment, she is projecting that her sales will increase and she will be able to support her two daughters with their basic necessities.

loans.use: to invest in products for personal use - perfumes, colognes, creams and other items her customers order.

loans.name: Famille Bivundu Group

texts.fr: Pour l'actuel crédit, Modeste prévoit entretenir son champ de café et en acheter un autre. Durant le crédit précédent il s'est heurté à un problème de prix lors de la vente de son café, toutefois, il n'est sans ignoré que les bienfaits de ce crédit ont été palpables lors du paiement de frais scolaires et l'alimentation de sa famille. Il est sur photo avec son épouse.
texts.en:
For this loan, Modeste plans to maintain his coffee field and buy another. During his previous loan, he encountered a problem with the price of coffee when he was trying to sell his crop. However, he still cannot ignore the benefits of the loan which helped cover his children's school fees and provide food for his family.

He is in the photo with his wife.

loans.use: to maintain a coffee field and buy another.

loans.name: Akanisi

texts.en: Akanisi is 47 years old with 5 children. She operates a business of selling banana and taro in her community to earn a living. Akanisi requested for a loan to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, wireless fence, nail,  to assist her run the business. She joined SPBD in 2002, She will use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tube(seedling), taro roots(seedling), wheelbarrow, water tank, hand gloves, rake, shovel, chemicals, wireless fence, nail,

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is 34 years old, married man who lives with his family. He runs a sheep farm in Khanyounes in the Gaza Strip, the farm is next to his parents' house. He works alone in the farm. Adel has been in this business for three years He sells all sheep products and also sells the sheep themselves.

Adel started the business with only 4 sheep and now he have 12 sheep. The farm is the only source of income for Adel and his family.

Adel says that the challenges for his business is the political situation as there are no certainties in Gaza. The other challenge is the competition in the market. 

He requested the loan to buy new sheep for the farm. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve his family's standard of living. In the future, Adel would like to expand his business and sell additional livestock in his farm.

loans.use: to buy new sheep for the farm.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a business, selling ornamental plants in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and food vending.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more ornamental plants to sell.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ornamental plants to sell.

loans.name: Munopaishe Group

texts.en:
Born an entrepreneur, Annah has always had to sell anything even way back in her school days. She remembers the time when she used to make small cakes and sell to fellow pupils at school in her teens for a profit to partially fund her education. Now she has grown to be a bigger entrepreneur and she feels she still have another room to do much better with the business support she continually receives for Thrive as well as financial aid in the form of a loan.

She is a married mother of two and she and the other ladies formed the Munopaishe (translating to Lord the Giver) group. They have been business friends for quite a long time and recently they have opened a bank account and started making weekly savings after realising the importance of saving from the financial training they receive from Thrive. Annah`s principal activity is selling fruits and vegetables at a shopping centre in her suburb of Eastlea. She sees Clyde shopping centre as a strategic selling sites as most of the clients from the supermarket always come looking for products that they will not find in these supermarket. Besides selling fruits and vegetables, she also restocks electrical and solar gadgets from South Africa to sell to people in the neighbourhood. With the increasing power cuts in Zimbabwe, Annah has found that the demand for solar gadgets has increased. With her loan, Annah will be able to restock more solar products to capitalise on the increasing demand.

loans.use: to restock more solar products to capitalise on the increasing demand.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov lives in a bed-room house located in Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province; she is 60 years old and a mother of six children. The main source of her income is from growing rice and working as a paid labor to get additional income to improve her living. She has been with her business for 42 years. Destroying by insects is her main challenge for her family’s business and she can’t earn good income.

This is her first time with VisionFund and she will request a loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to increase the productivity crop. She hopes that she can sell her rice with good price so that she can upgrade her family condition better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to increase the productivity crop so that she can sell her rice at a  good price and upgrade her life to earn more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Anna who is in her early 40's is married with six children while two of them are in school and others are grown up.She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 07am to 06pm daily and is able to make a good profit per monthly.

This will be Anna's 28th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase on the food stock and has managed to pay all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She earned some extra income which she used to pay school fees, build her own house, loan repayment, saved some in her bank account and covered household expenses. She is now requesting another loan increase her mamalishe stock to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of owning an hotel.

Anna will share this loan with her members group which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her mamalishe stock to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Masterchef - N06Xlộcđhải Group

texts.en:
Mrs Liên is 54 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling noodles for 5 years. Liên lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.
The main hardship that Liên faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking more breakfast to sell.

In 2013, Liên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income has been increased significantly. Liên has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of "Masterchef - N06XLộcĐHải", which consists of six members.
In the future, Liên hopes for her children to find a good job, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking more breakfast to sell.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is 37 years old. He is married with three children. He has had a farming business for 15 years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs and hopes this will help him buy  livestock. His hopes and dreams for the future are to be the biggest farmer in the region.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to help him buy  livestock

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like poultry and rice retailing businesses.

Myrna dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 37 years old, a married, hardworking, focused man who lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda with three children aged 8,6 and 2 years. He is a produce buyer doing farming for additional income. He has been in business for more than five years from where he has been able to sustain himself and the family at large.

He dreams of buying a motor vehicle to aid him in transporting his produce to markets with high prices. He is challenged with the unpredictable weather changes and price fluctuations which affect him negatively but he manages this by making proper timing of different crop seasons. Kenneth is requesting for the loan to buy more maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy more maize for selling.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam is the age of 48, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
Her son has been running a small general store for five years; earlier he was selling only general store’s items so he can easily bear the household expenses. His shop is situated in a populated area and a lot of customers are available here to buy miscellaneous general store items. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily usage.

A few days ago he started to offer fresh fruits as well, due to offering additional inventory, it impacts positively over his net income. But does not remained sufficient cash in hand to buy inventory for the general store. He wants to fully stocked his general store by purchasing inventories such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties etc. But the major problem is the lack of availability of funds.
Therefore, Mariam has requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son would be able to buy bakery items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties etc.
She is very glad after receiving this loan and hopeful that her son will be success to fulfill each request for any item and abstain from the disappointment of his customers. In this way he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional bakery items. She is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy bakery items for her son's general store so he can fulfill the requirements for his worthy customers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes used the previous loan to buy fresh foods and materials for making baskets.She is an enterprising thirty two year married woman with two children aged 10 and 3 years living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She runs a shop of fresh foods as her main source of income, which she started with an intention of educating her children and improving her standards of living.

She is also talented in making African baskets with vast designs and her passion now earns her extra income to support her family. Her personal dreams are to construct a permanent residential house and ensuring that her children attain degrees as minimum qualification while business dreams are to set up a crafts shop and expand her food business by opening a new outlet.Agnes is seeking for a loan to buy more fresh foods and materials for making baskets.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods and materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella tiene 24 años de edad es soltera y trabaja como enfermera en un hospital de especialidades. Sufre de una alteración refractaria del ojo derecho, por lo que ella debe usar anteojos permanentemente, esto afecta en gran parte su vida e incluso en su economía debido a que cada seis meses tiene que hacer el cambio de anteojos. Para mejorar su salud visual es necesario someterse a una cirugía.
texts.en: This borrower is 24 years old and is single. She works as a nurse in a specialty hospital.  She suffers from a refractory alteration in her right eye, and because of this she has to wear glasses all the time.  This greatly affects her life and her finances, as she has to change her glasses every 6 months.  In order to improve her vision, she needs to have surgery.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Timoteo Nemecio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS.
El socio Timoteo tiene 58 años de edad es soltero  y tiene 01 hijo, el socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de transporte, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank LLAPALLANCHIS PURISUNCHIS.

The member, Timoteo, is 58 years old. He is single and has one child. He divides his time between his daily activities and earning his living with a transport business. He has had his business for quite a while and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day. He would like to be able to continue working in order to keep supporting his family in this way.

Timoteo is requesting the loan to carry out maintenance on his car. He feels grateful for the loan granted and he promises to make his loan payments according to the terms established.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Vaiopua'a

texts.en: Vaiopua'a is a 53 year old mother with 7 children, she runs a business of selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. Vaiopua'a requested for a loan to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, to help her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2006.

loans.use: to buy backpack sprayer, taro roots(seedling), banana tube(seedling), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel,

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella tiene 25 años es enfermera, y tiene tiempo con dificultad para ver bien, se le detecto miopía y astigmatismo, visión que puede ser mejorada su con unos lentes graduados, a ella le gustaría mucho poder tenerlos ya que son indispensables  para poder realizar bien su trabajo. Tener sus lentes significaría mucho para ella ya que esto ha disminuido su autoestima y su seguridad.
texts.en: This borrower is 25 years old and is a nurse.  She has a hard time seeing, as she has myopia and astigmatism.  Her vision could be improved with graduated lenses.  She would very much like to get these, as they would be indispensable for her in doing her work.  To have glasses would be significant for her, because her vision problems have diminished her self esteem and her security.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Nirina

texts.fr:
38 ans, Nirina est une femme mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Deux de ces derniers seulement sont scolarisés actuellement.
Elle exerce avec l'aide de son mari une activité de vente de friperie. Avant 2011, le couple n'avait qu'un seul point de vente mais  depuis lors, à cause de leurs efforts et l'appui de CEFOR, chacun dirige  respectivement un point de vente.
Elle voudrait développer l'activité et se préparer déjà dès maintenant pour le marché en mois de décembre. Le prêt va donc lui permettre de renouveler les stocks et augmenter les quantités des marchandises.
texts.en:
Nirina is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four. Only two of the children attend school at the moment.

She manages a second-hand clothing business with the help of her husband. Before 2011, the couple only had one point of sale but since then, thanks to their efforts and CEFOR’s help, each of them manages a different outlet.

She would like to grow the business and is already preparing for the December-month market. The loan will therefore allow her to restock and increase her stores of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Henri

texts.fr:
42 ans, Henri est un père de famille passionné de son activité. Il fabrique et vend des baffles. C'était une activité exploitée par son propre père. Ce dernier est décédé en 2003 et depuis lors, il prenait le relève. Il voudrait développer et étendre l'activité. Il voudrait vendre d'autres articles comme des postes téléviseurs.
Il est marié et sa femme aussi est commerçante, elle vend des cartables et des sacs dames. Le couple a trois enfants qui sont âgés de 3 à 10 ans dont les deux premiers sont scolarisés actuellement.
La motivation de Henri à travailler dur c'est pour le bien-être de ses enfants, il désire leurs offrir une meilleure condition de vie et une meilleure éducation.
texts.en:
Henri is 42. He is a father and he is passionate about his business, he sells speakers. His father was in the same business. His father died in 2003 and Henri took over as from that time. He would like to expand his business and develop it. He would like to sell additional articles like television sets.

He is married and his wife is also a saleswoman. She sells school bags and ladies handbags. They have three children who are aged between three and 10, of whom only the first two attend school.

Henri is motivated to work hard for his children's well-being. He wants to offer them better living conditions and a better education.

loans.use: to buy speakers, plywood, amplifiers, and accessoires and small and medium screen television sets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand clothing: baby wear, pants, skirts, leotards.

loans.name: Yuleidis Patricia

texts.es: Yuleidis es una joven microempresaria de 21 años que estudió mercadeo y ventas en una corporación de formación técnica, ella decidió que su proyecto de vida era iniciar su propio negocio y con el apoyo de sus familiares, incluso la de su novio, compraron mercancías varias para vender en su lugar de residencia ubicado al sur de Barranquilla.  Con el pasar del tiempo la afluencia de clientes en su casa se incrementó y su oferta de productos se amplió a un nuevo segmento; carne de cerdo y cervezas, de este modo poco a poco su negocio se ha ido consolidando y su meta es captar nuevos clientes e incrementar su nivel de ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en cervezas, carne de cerdo y nuevo surtido de artículos misceláneos; accesorios, fragancias, prendas de vestir y demás.  Con esta inversión pretende aprovechar la temporada de fin de año y dinamizar sus ventas.  Su meta a futuro es comprar una vivienda.
texts.en: Yuleidis is a young 21 year old small business woman who studied marketing and sales in a technical training company. She decided that her life plan was to start her own business and with the help of her relatives and her boyfriend, they bought various merchandise to sell in her home which is to the south of Barranquilla. As time went by, the affluence of her customers increased and her range of products expanded into a new sector; pork and beer. In this way, little by little, her business has strengthened and her aim is to get new customers and increase her sales. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy beers, pork and a new stock of miscellaneous items; accessories, fragrances, clothes and others. With this investment she says she will make the most of the end of year period and boost her sales. Her future aim is to buy a home.

loans.use: to buy beers, pork and a new stock of miscellaneous items; accessories, fragrances, clothes and others.
